title: Senior Dotnet Developer
description:
**About us:** 




 Founded on the grounds of innovation – iXceed Solutions, is an ISO certified, leader in Talent and Digital recruitment solutions, serving fortune 100 companies globally.
 



 We have many global accolades to our credit – UK Enterprise Awards - HR Tech Startup of the year- Europe - 2022 , UK IT Awards - Leading Talent & Digital Solutions of the Year 2022 , Titan Awards-Entrepreneur of the Year -2023 , Asia fastest growing HR tech companies in 2023, Iconic Brand of the Year in Staffing & Recruitment 2023 , Top 4 The Most prominent Talent solutions firm to work with in 2024 , Hottest HR Tech Startup by Business World , The Greatest Brands & Leaders Asia & GCC -2020 -2021 by AsiaOne and many more.
 



 Website: www.ixceed-solutions.co.uk
 



 LinkedIn URL: https://www.linkedin.com/company/ixceed-solutions
 



**Job Description:**




**Job Description – Developer (SQL, .NET, C#, MS Graph, Infrastructure Tools)** 




**Location: Stockholm, Sweden** 




**Employment Type – Contract** 




**Language: Swedish & English.** 




**Position Summary:** 




 Need an experienced Developer with strong expertise in SQL, .NET, C#, and MS Graph and a basic understanding of enterprise infrastructure tools like Active Directory (AD), SCCM, Intune, and Citrix. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining applications that integrate with enterprise IT systems, as well as supporting automation and process improvements.
 



**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Develop and maintain applications using C#, .NET Core, SQL Server, and MS Graph API.
* Design, develop, and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and database structures.
* Integrate applications with Active Directory, SCCM, Intune, and Citrix to automate IT operations.
* Build and maintain API-based integrations with Microsoft 365 and Azure services.
* Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues, providing L3 support for enterprise applications.
* Implement automation for IT processes using PowerShell, C#, and Graph API.
* Ensure best practices in coding, security, and infrastructure are followed.
* Collaborate with IT and DevOps teams to deploy and monitor applications in on-prem and cloud environments.
* Lead technical discussions and mentor junior developers.
* Participate in code reviews, architecture design, and system documentation.



**Required Skills & Experience:** 



* 5+ years/3+ years of experience in software development with C# and .NET Core/.NET Framework.
* Expertise in SQL Server (T-SQL, stored procedures, query optimization).
* Understanding of Microsoft Graph API, RESTful APIs, and JSON processing.
* Understanding of Active Directory, SCCM, Intune, Citrix, and Windows Server environments.
* Experience in building applications that interact with enterprise IT infrastructure.
* Understanding of OAuth, Entra ID authentication, and identity management.
* Proficiency in PowerShell scripting for automation.
* Experience with logging, monitoring, and debugging enterprise applications.
* Excellent problem-solving, communication, and leadership skills.

title: Tech Lead Manager
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 You will act as both Tech Lead and Manager, in a perfect mix of leading people (Team of Developers) and developing code. Our aim is to consolidate the team of developers that you will lead in Stockholm. You will collaborate with your Product Partner, regarding planning and building the right products at the right time. You will be responsible for defining clear goals for your team and lead them in delivering on those goals.
   

  

 Apart from this, you are also responsible for setting salaries, helping individuals on your team grow and developing, as well as contributing technically to the team.
   

  

 As Tech Lead Manager you have a holistic perspective and the ability to inspire and lead others. You love working with tech and have experience working as a developer, working with code reviews, testing and quality assurance. You have at least one area where your team can rely on you making strong technical contributions.
   

  

* Communicate and collaborate with stakeholders
* Define quarterly goals and do weekly follow-ups
* Support and make sure the team members are the best they can be
* Develop and coach your team members individually
* Facilitate daily stand-ups and advise on agile WoW
* Contribute technically (wherever your strong area is) to the team


**Requirements**
* MSc/BS in computer science or similar degree
* Experience working as a Manager for a Tech Team
* Working in different contexts and organisations
* Interest in leadership and developing teams
* Proficient in English, both verbal and written
* Business minded and able to see the big picture
* A natural leader who is caring and inspiring
* Able to communicate clearly, both with your team and stakeholders
* Well organized and goal oriented


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Senior Software Engineer, Google Meet
company_industry: Information Services and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 5 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, and with data structures/algorithms.
* 3 years of experience with Machine Learning (ML) infrastructure (e.g., model deployment, model evaluation, optimization, data processing, debugging).
* 3 years of experience testing, maintaining, or launching software products, and 1 year of experience with software design and architecture.
* Experience in developing software systems in modern C++.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* Experience in Audio processing/Echo cancellation/or Video streaming.
* Knowledge of coding with Python.


**About the job** 
 Google Cloud's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google Cloud's needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. You will anticipate our customer needs and be empowered to act like an owner, take action and innovate. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Build a complete understanding of perceived video quality and identify opportunities for the application of Artificial Intelligence (AI)/Machine Learning (ML) to augment it.
* Develop ML models and the application of AI for video quality enhancements.
* Collaborate with cross-functional Meet Media teams (and external partners) for the integration of video processing solutions into production.
* Leverage AI/ML technologies to enhance the video experience for millions of Meet users.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: System Developer and Team Coach
description:
**🚀 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a 🚀
   

  

 Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our**
**About VIPAS**
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.
   

  

**Job Description**
 The Swedish eHealth Agency (eHälsomyndigheten) is expanding and seeking
 **up to four experienced consultants** 
 to join their teams as
 **System Developers with Team Coach responsibilities** 
 . In this dual-role position, you will lead agile development teams while actively contributing to the design, development, and maintenance of innovative digital health services.
   

  

 You will play a critical role in
 **test-driven development and test automation** 
 , ensuring the delivery of high-quality software solutions that support Sweden’s healthcare system. This is an exciting opportunity for individuals passionate about both leadership and hands-on software development within a forward-thinking government agency.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Acting as a Team Coach within a team
* Analysing requirements and developing solution proposals
* Developing new services, further developing, and maintaining existing services/functionality
* Documentation
* Working with test-driven development and test automation as a natural part of your role as a system developer


**Requirements**
* Have worked as a Team Coach and/or Scrum Master for a development team for at least two years in combination with the role of system developer.
* Have at least one year of experience as a back-end system developer using the following technologies:
* Java
* Jakarta EE
* JPA/Hibernate
* Have at least one year of experience as a front-end system developer using, for example, Vue, React, or Angular.
* Have at least one year of experience as a system developer working with container-based technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, and OpenShift.
* Have at least two years of experience working with test-driven development and test automation as a natural part of their role as a system developer.
* Have a relevant university degree or equivalent acquired knowledge.
* Have good proficiency in both Swedish and English, spoken and written.


****Meritorious****
* At least two years of experience working as a Team Coach or equivalent within the SAFe agile framework.
* At least five years of experience working as a full-stack system developer.
* At least one year of experience working with REST-based services. The work experience should have been gained within the last three years.
* Experience in development in a Linux environment.
* Experience in requirements analysis and breaking down requirements and creating solutions/solution proposals/prototypes in dialogue with stakeholders.
* Experience with the development tool IntelliJ.
* Experience working with open-source software.


**Why Join Us?**
 Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.
   

  

 You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!
   

  

 Apply Now & Please feel free to reach me at swathianantu@vipas.se
   

  

 Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!
   

  

 Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Senior Software Developer
company_industry: Financial Services and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**At Billogram, we like to be the good guys of billing—making money when clients are happy and pay on time, rather than from missed payments.** 
 We believe it always pays off to treat people well. That’s why our platform for invoices and payments is built to remove pain points and instead be beneficial to both our clients and their customers—improving their relationships.
 



  





 To support our growth and become a leader in the European consumer billing market, we are looking for a talented
 **Senior Software Developer** 
 with a background in payments to help us get there.
 



  





**About the Role:** 




 We’re looking for a Python Developer who’s excited by the challenge of rethinking how billing gets done. If you love collaborating with a diverse team, finding new angles to solve problems, and making an impact on real customer experiences, you’ll fit right in. You’ll join a friendly crew of developers, product managers, and other stakeholders who share a passion for building a platform that treats people well — and proves that great business grows from great relationships.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 



* **Standardize & Scale:** 
 Help shape a platform that’s ready to grow into new European markets. You’ll refactor, optimize, and test our systems so they can handle more transactions and delight more users.
* **Tackle Tech Debt:** 
 Fine-tune existing solutions so they run smoothly for larger clients, higher traffic, and increased complexity.
* **Create Real Value:** 
 Dive into coding, requirement analysis, and testing to build features that our clients — and their customers — will love.
* **Learn & Collaborate:** 
 Work side by side with other developers, share fresh ideas and keep our platform moving forward.



  





**What We’re Looking For:** 




 We want someone
 **humble, hungry, and happy** 
 : eager to grow, curious about how things can improve, and excited about shaping the future of billing. You enjoy discussing big ideas but are also comfortable rolling up your sleeves to make them happen.
 



  





**Key Qualifications** 



* **Python Expertise:** 
 At least 4 years of professional experience, ideally working on products with real-world impact.
* **Adaptability:** 
 Familiarity with PHP and an openness to learning new languages.
* **Product Mindset:** 
 Comfortable in a collaborative, product-focused environment, where everyone’s ideas matter.



  





**Bonus Skills** 



* **B2B & B2C Background:** 
 Experience building solutions for business and consumer needs.
* **Scaling Know-How** 
 : Exposure to international expansion or platforms that operate across borders.
* **Payment Experience** 
 : A couple of years (or more) dealing with payment systems, transactions, or other financial services.



  





**Why work with us?** 




 At Billogram we promise you an exciting journey as we break into new markets and grow at a rapid pace. That aside you will get lots of freedom and opportunity to develop together with great colleagues at our office, right in the center of Stockholm. We also offer flexible working hours, exciting challenges and a whole lot of laughs.
 



  





 We're committed to your long-term development, offering clear career progression paths. You'll also enjoy a fantastic benefits package, including 30 (+2) days of holiday, an occupational pension, a flexible wellness allowance, sick leave top-up, and parental leave compensation. At Billogram, our inclusive and diverse culture ensures that everyone can enjoy a fulfilling career and a great work-life balance.
 



  





 At Billogram, we provide equal opportunities and strive for an inclusive and diverse environment. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to gender, transgender identity or expression, ethnicity, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation, or age.
 



  





**Welcome to the world of Billogram!**

title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer (Java) - ZEOS
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet, Retail, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Over the last years, we learned that solving fulfillment-related challenges for the good of our customers helps us to fuel the growth of our platform. With more partners in Partner Program and Connected Retail joining our platform, we have been developing and testing additional further fulfilment services tailored to their needs.
   

  

 As a Senior Full Stack Software Engineer at ZEOS, Zalando’s B2B Logistics unit developing Europe’s leading Logistics Platform recently launched under the ZEOS Logistics brand, you will be part of a team working on designing technical solutions to connect various e-commerce platforms seamlessly with the robust logistics ecosystem of ZEOS.
   

  

 You will ensure that all our operational processes like warehousing, inventory management, inventory distribution, deliveries and returns can be steered on various e-commerce platforms. You will have the chance to learn about the broad business background we’re working with. In line with the overall Zalando philosophy you bring visibility and transparency to processes and thus have a huge impact on our customers and key stakeholders.
   

  

**WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)**
* You work regularly with others to ensure the right software/engineering design approaches and methodologies are applied.
* Design, develop, deploy, operate and improve software solutions that have a direct impact on our daily business with our partners.
* Discuss and design APIs and integrated solutions.
* Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well as operate large-scale applications on AWS.
* Working like a startup in an agile environment & taking ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation & maintenance. Write applications from scratch with the latest technologies free of your choice.
* Shape and champion an inclusive culture and diverse team environment.


**WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF**
* 10+ years of software engineering experience
* You have a deep understanding of microservice architecture, REST services and API design. Good knowledge of security concepts. Highly versed in deploying and operating applications in a cloud infrastructure.
* You are highly skilled as a Java Developer. Proven experience in frameworks like Spring Boot. Ideally you have experience with a distributed event store such as Apache Kafka.
* Experience with Frontend technologies like JavaScript (ES6 / ES2015), React, Typescript, Webpack, CSS/HTML, and showing interest in full stack development is a big Plus!
* You have a good understanding of PostgreSQL and cloud architectures/platforms (preferably AWS). Check our Tech Radar for more information on the technologies we use at Zalando.
* Demonstrated strong sense of ownership, entrepreneurial & analytical thinking add to your excellent communication skills.
* Ideally, you have experience integrating third-party services, such as through developing or working with middleware solutions.
* Shopify or other e-commerce experience is a merit.


**OUR OFFER**
 Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.
   

  

  

* 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
* Hybrid working model with 60% remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
* Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
* 30 days of vacation a year
* Health and wellbeing options
* Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh\_src=22377bdd1us


*We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.*

title: Flight Simulator Software Developer
description:
Navigraph is taking flight simulation technology to new heights and we’re now looking for a Flight Sim Software Developer to join our Simulator Developer team, a group of passionate individuals with diverse backgrounds and a deep interest in flight simulation and technology. The team is responsible for driving their own products, including but not limited to avionics integrations and third-party SDKs, while also supporting other product teams with simulator integrations and expertise. This variety offers flexibility to shape your role based on your interests and strengths. While the primary focus is on simulator development, there are also opportunities to contribute to projects beyond that scope.
 



  





**✈️ About Navigraph** 




 Navigraph is where the flight simulation community finds its wings! We provide charts, navigation data, flight planning tools, and training materials to make virtual flying as realistic as possible.
 



 With a modern tech stack, we focus on highly performant integrations, real-time GIS data processing, and seamless flight sim experiences. Our HQ is in Stockholm, but our team spans the globe, collaborating in an innovation-driven environment. We are in an excellent position to grow and will provide you with all the means necessary to excel in your work.
 



  





**Who you are!** 




  





 We believe you have a strong interest in aviation, experience developing add-on software, and a solid understanding of the simulator platform's possibilities and limitations. We place great emphasis on you as a person, your knowledge, and what you are passionate about. We also hope you have previous experience working in cross-functional teams, where daily collaboration with others to achieve common goals has been a natural part of your work.
 



  






 Navigraph’s head office is in Stockholm, but we work primarily remotely. You don’t need to be based in Stockholm, but you should be located in a time zone that allows for regular virtual meetings during Swedish office hours.
 




  





**What We’re Looking For!** 




  




* Solid software development experience.
* Proficiency in TypeScript and Rust, including advanced language features and ecosystem tooling.
* In-depth knowledge of the Microsoft Flight Simulator (MSFS) and its SDK in both the JavaScript and WASM environments, developer tools, file structures, and data models.
* Documented experience of development in MSFS Avionics Framework.
* Strong communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to thrive in a collaborative environment.
* Good understanding of low-level software engineering concepts like memory management, performance optimization, concurrency, and thread safety.



  





**Bonus Skills** 




  




* Active flight simulator pilot with a deep interest in flight simulation.
* Previous employment or membership in any flight simulator add-on software development group is a merit.
* Experience with low-level languages other than Rust, such as C/C++.
* A portfolio showcasing exceptional proficiency in MSFS development.
* Skills in debugging complex systems and performing reverse engineering when documentation is limited or unavailable.
* Experience with cross-platform desktop application frameworks such as Tauri and Electron.
* Experience with other technologies from our tech stack, including React, NestJS, Next.js, Docker, Python, and QT.
* A passion for developer experience and ways to improve it through documentation and SDKs.



  





**What We Offer!** 




  




* Flexible hiring: On-site, hybrid or remote (located in a time zone that allows for regular virtual meetings during Swedish office hours).
* Perks Galore: A great benefits package; please check out our career site.
* Growth Opportunities: We’ll support your professional development and give you the resources to excel.
* Memorable experiences: The Navigraph team is a tight-knit group with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We enjoy spending time together, and it is not uncommon for our yearly trips to flight simulator conventions in Europe and the U.S. to be combined with team-building activities that leave lasting impressions!



  





**How to Join the Team?** 




  





 We’re reviewing applications quickly - so don’t leave us hanging too long! 🚀✈️ Apply now and help us take Navigraph - and flight simulation - to the next level!

title: Java Developer
description:
HiQ är utan tvekan ett av Sveriges mest tekniktunga och spännande konsultbolag med kunder inom en rad olika branscher. Som Javautvecklare hos oss har vi ett brett utbud av spännande uppdrag hos våra större teknikintensiva kunder, t.ex produktbolag inom industrin, elkraft, försvar och autonoma fordon.
   

  

 För oss är din utveckling i fokus, oavsett om du bara har jobbat några år eller om du är en senior Javautvecklare. Hos oss utvecklas du självklart i dina uppdrag, där du har möjlighet att lära dig t.ex. nya tekniker och vi jobbar också mycket med det kollegiala lärandet genom kunskapsdelning mellan varandra.
   

  

 För att passa i rollen ser vi att du har:
   

  

* Högskole-/Civilingenjörsexamen inom datavetenskap, datateknik, teknisk fysik, elektroteknik eller motsvarande
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av Javautveckling
* Talar flytande svenska och engelska


 På HiQ arbetar personer med rätt attityd och rätt kompetens – det gör oss till ett smart, men också väldigt roligt gäng. Brinner du också för att förenkla och förbättra människors vardag genom digitala lösningar? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan i dag!

title: Identity Security Developer
description:
Are you ready for a change? To make the world a safer place?
   

  

 ID North offers products and services in the entire field of identity security (IAM, IGA, PAM), which is a central part of IT security. We are the leading company in Sweden and intend to further distance ourselves from the competition in the entire Nordics. We are on an exciting growth journey, which is why we are now looking for more solution developers who want to join our team and develop tomorrow’s identity security solutions for our customers!
   

  

**Your mission** 
 📌
   

  

 As a Developer, you will implement advanced solutions based on the customer’s needs and requirements, such as secure login, integration for automatic account creation, and management of administrator rights. The assignments are technically exciting and challenging, and those passionate about developing technical breadth are in the right place to become an expert. Working together in a project team with a project manager, solution architect, and solution developer, you will be involved in delivering top-notch identity security solutions within Project Delivery and/or our Service Delivery Organization!
   

  

**In your role, you will need to:** 
 💻
   

  

 Have an interest in configuring technically broad solutions in complex environments using market-leading products tailored to the customer’s needs.
   

  

 Be able to integrate systems for secure login and information flows for identities, accounts, and permissions.
   

  

 Work with customers and help them understand the solution being built.
   

  

 It is a merit to have worked with IAM, IGA, and/or PAM solutions before with the technology of one of our solution partners.
   

  

 Knowledge of Active Directory/LDAP, Web Services, and standards such as SAML, OpenID Connect, OAuth2, SCIM is advantageous.
   

  

 It is also a merit to have knowledge and experience with Linux and Windows environments, MySQL and MSSQL databases, Java and Tomcat, Apache httpd, certificate management/SSL/TLS/PKI.
   

  

 Version control and release management with tools like Subversion or Git, as well as Ant or Maven, are advantageous.
   

  

 Experience and knowledge with identity security products from SailPoint, Savyint Opentext, Okta, Nexus, CyberArk, Microsoft is a major plus.
   

  

 There may be business trips in the role. We have offices in Stockholm, Borås, Gothenburg, Denmark and Helsinki, so your location can be flexible based on your needs and life situation.
   

  

**Your competence** 
 📓
   

  

 We are looking for someone with an IT technical developer background. Experience and knowledge in identity security are highly valued but not a requirement. We prefer if you have worked in teams/projects with customers as consultants and are unafraid to take on new technical challenges. Understanding of information flows, system integration, and basic programming skills are advantageous. You can communicate fluently in both Swedish and English, both spoken and written. A major merit if you have other language skills.
   

  

**Your qualities** 
**⭐️**
 You enjoy working in teams with colleagues and customers, and you like to develop advanced technical solutions that require a broad technical understanding. We prefer that you are solution-oriented and interested in learning how to implement solutions with new products. Are eager to learn and develop your skills and competence. We value your personal qualities highly and are looking for someone who is attentive, has good social skills, and is easy to collaborate with others, both colleagues and customers.
   

  

**We offer** 
 🚀
   

  

 A strong and pleasant company at the forefront of our field, where our expertise and experience give us a competitive position. We offer development opportunities, and you will be surrounded by specialists. All day every day! At ID North, you have good employment benefits, and you will become a key person for us in our delivery. We enjoy each other’s company and take the opportunity to go on trips, adventures, and have fun together on our journey to the top.
   

  

 Does this sound like a position for you? We have an immediate need, so you should not hesitate to apply or send your application. Are you IN?
   

  

 Welcome- Chief Human Resources Officer Linda Öhlin

title: Development Lead
description:
**Position Summary**
 The Development Lead at Tacton is a
 **hands on** 
 operational leader who defines and drives the technical direction and priorities of their team. While you won’t have direct reports, you’ll play a vital role in ensuring your team’s success. This role suits a seasoned developer eager to grow into a potential manager role in the future. With many exciting changes underway, Tacton offers opportunities to take on new challenges and responsibilities.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities** 
  

  

* Act as a "playing coach" by actively contributing to development tasks as a senior developer, while providing operational leadership and guidance to the team
* Define and prioritize team tasks, ensuring alignment with business objectives and technical strategies.
* Architect and implement high-quality features, ensuring scalable and efficient solutions.
* Mentor developers and act as a technical advisor, fostering professional growth and excellence.
* Clearly describe and document software solutions, ensuring alignment across teams and stakeholders.
* Foster teamwork and celebrate milestones.
* Drive and contribute to continuous improvement in both code and ways of work.


**Skills And Qualifications**
**Required:**
* 10+ years of experience in software development, with expertise in building and maintaining software systems.
* Proven ability to translate functional specifications into creative, user-focused software solutions.
* Strong backend development skills, with experience in building robust and efficient solutions.
* Familiarity with frontend technologies, with a willingness to adapt and contribute across the stack.
* Experience in software design and architecture, delivering high-quality features.
* Self-driven and proactive, able to manage tasks independently with minimal supervision.
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken, with strong communication skills; Swedish is a plus.
* We believe in real-time collaboration and prefer you to be on-site most weekdays at our Stockholm office to foster knowledge sharing and innovation.


**Preferred:** 
  

  

* Experience in SaaS product development and cloud technologies (Kubernetes, Docker, AWS).
* Interest in growing into a people management role with direct reports.
* Experience with Java, developing robust and efficient backend solutions.
* Familiarity with test automation and best practices.


**What We Offer**
 🏆
 **Stabili** 
**ty & Industry Leadership** 
 – Over 20 years of experience as a globally recognized CPQ leader.
   

  

 💡
 **Exciting Technologies & Collaboration** 
 – Work with cutting-edge tools in a highly skilled and supportive team.
   

  

 🚀
 **Growth & Impact** 
 – Opportunities to take on new responsibilities and shape our transformation.
   

  

 🎯
 **Comprehensive Benefits** 
 – A competitive package designed to support your well-being and work-life balance.
   

  

 📚
 **Learning & Development** 
 – Collaborate with senior developers and architects in an environment that fosters continuous growth.
   

  

**The Recruitment Process Consists Of**
* Screening call with Talent Acquisition
* First interview with our hiring manager
* Technical interview
* Interview with our CPO
* Reference check


**Our Culture and Why You Belong**
 Collaborative, Engaged, Trustworthy, Customer-Oriented, Visionary—if these values resonate with you, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 At Tacton, we celebrate diversity and strive to create an inclusive environment where everyone feels welcome. Our team consists of people from all over the world, and we believe this diversity makes us stronger.
   

  

 As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we’re committed to fostering an environment where everyone can thrive. With our comprehensive onboarding program, you’ll be set up for success from day one.
   

  

 We look forward to your application—apply soon as we review candidates on a rolling basis.
   

  

**About Tacton**
*Tacton is a leading Software as a Service company trusted by global manufacturers. We got started in the late 1990’s when six computer scientists figured out a revolutionary way to help Manufacturers overcome their most business-critical, product configuration challenges. Since those early days, we have grown to support global manufacturers seeking to thrive in a changing world.*
*We invite you to find out more about us @* 
*www.tacton.com/about*
 Tacton is a leading SaaS company within CPQ and Design Automation making sales simple for complex products.

title: Concept Artist
company_industry: Computer Games, Artists and Writers, and Gambling Facilities and Casinos
description:
***Do you want to be part of creating fantastic, unique and entertaining iGaming experiences in a competitive global market? We are looking for a talented 2D Concept Artist with a strong passion for bringing life, expression and excitement to our growing games portfolio.***




  





***ELK is a leading developer in the iGaming industry, known for our innovative, visually stunning, and critically acclaimed game titles and IPs. We push the boundaries of gameplay and visual fidelity, setting new standards in the iGaming world.***




  





***At ELK Studios we believe working together onsite is a big part of our success. It allows us to work efficiently across teams and it keeps innovation and creativity high.***




  





**ABOUT THE ROLE:** 




  





 We’re seeking a talented 2D Concept Artist to join our game studio to help shape the visual identity of our upcoming titles. As a key member of the pre-production team, you’ll define the look and feel of our games by creating captivating and unique concepts and help shape the narrative that will inspire and guide our team throughout the production process.
 



  





 Working as a concept artist at ELK offers a similar setting as the broader gaming industry, with one key difference: the opportunity to explore a wide variety of game styles and themes within shorter development cycles. This dynamic environment allows for constant creativity and fresh challenges.
 



  





**A TYPICAL WORK WEEK AS A CONCEPT ARTIST AT ELK STUDIOS CAN CONSIST OF:** 




  





 ▫️
 **Concept Art Creation:** 
 Craft 2D concept art for a variety of assets, including characters, environments, props, and more. Your work may range from quick sketches that explore ideas to fully rendered pieces that set the standard for the game’s visual style while also having in mind to create designs that fit gameplay needs.
 



  





 ▫️
 **Explore styles** 
 : Together with the Art Director you will work across a variety of art styles to match the unique vision of each project. At ELK no game looks the same and we take pride in pushing the boundaries of storytelling and visuals within iGaming. At ELK we innovate and make new games but you will also work within existing IPs and adapt your style to it.
 



  





 ▫️
 **Teamwork:** 
 Collaborate closely with the Creative Director, Art Director, and Project Manager to make sure your designs align with the game’s artistic direction, theme, and gameplay.
 



  





  





**WHO YOU ARE:** 




  





 We believe you are motivated by the opportunity and freedom to sketch broadly and that you are unpretentious and comfortable with the fact that much of what you create may not make it into the final game production. It is important that you are organized and solution-oriented with the ability to tackle challenges and solve problems and proactively request feedback from relevant stakeholders.
 



 You have strong graphic skills focused on concept design and an excellent ability to draw in a variety of styles. As a Concept Artist, you will explain concepts and artistic decisions to the team responsible for production. Therefore, the role requires you to be versatile and possess strong communication skills, both spoken and written. You are self-driven, and responsible and strive to develop your skills and others constantly. You also possess a strong sense of ownership and deliver on deadlines.
 



  





  





**WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?** 




  





 ▫️Previous experience in a gaming studio and a strong passion for games
 



 ▫️Strong foundational skills in drawing, painting, and solution oriented design
 



 ▫️Expertise in creating a variety of assets, from quick exploratory sketches to fully rendered characters, gameplay storyboards and game-ready designs
 



 ▫️A strong portfolio showcasing your artistic range, creativity, and ability to create both quick concepts and polished artwork.
 



  





**SKILLS** 




  





 ▫️ Versatility to adapt to a wide range of art styles, including fantasy, sci-fi, historical, and stylized
 



 ▫️Proficiency with industry-standard software such as Photoshop or Procreate
 



 ▫️Experience in collaborating with cross-functional teams, including game designers and animators
 



 ▫️ The ideal candidate will possess excellent English language skills, both in written and verbal communication, as this is essential for daily tasks and collaboration. Proficiency in Swedish is a plus but not required.
 



  





  





**WE OFFER** 




  





 We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, where everyone is respected, valued, and empowered to succeed. We work on-site at our awesome office, 2 minutes from T-Centralen in Stockholm.
 



 For the right candidate, the recruitment process includes: interviews (digitally and at our studio), as well as a work assignment. We will fill the position as soon as we have found the right candidate, so do not hesitate to submit your application as soon as possible!
 



  





  





**For this role we are only considering candidates already residing in Sweden!**

title: Sr. Growth Manager - Scandinavia
job_function: Business Development, Marketing, and Product Management
description:
**Who We Are**
 At OKX, we believe that the future will be reshaped by crypto, and ultimately contribute to every individual's freedom.
   

  

 OKX is a leading crypto exchange, and the developer of OKX Wallet, giving millions access to crypto trading and decentralized crypto applications (dApps). OKX is also a trusted brand by hundreds of large institutions seeking access to crypto markets. We are safe and reliable, backed by our Proof of Reserves.
   

  

 Across our multiple offices globally, we are united by our core principles:
 *We Before Me* 
 ,
 *Do the Right Thing* 
 , and
 *Get Things Done* 
 . These shared values drive our culture, shape our processes, and foster a friendly, rewarding, and diverse environment for every OK-er.
   

  

 OKX is part of OKG, a group that brings the value of Blockchain to users around the world, through our leading products OKX, OKX Wallet, OKLink and more.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Develop and implement the company's marketing and growth strategy aligned with the company’s overall business objective.
* Develop and manage a multi-channel, integrated marketing plan, including digital marketing, PR, content marketing, SEO/SEM, social media, affiliate/KOL marketing and offline activation.
* Identify and track key metrics to measure the effectiveness of marketing efforts; making adjustments as necessary to ensure goals are met.
* Lead all user communication efforts, ensuring clear, consistent, and effective messaging across all channels and touchpoints, and tailoring communication strategies to specific user segments.
* Own the entire user lifecycle management process, including acquisition, engagement, retention, and reactivation strategies, driving growth of our user base.
* Prepare for regulatory compliance in marketing strategies, ensuring that all marketing efforts are compliant and effectively positioned to leverage potential opportunities arising from regulations.


**What We Look For In You**
* Experience in Marketing/Growth in the Crypto industry.
* Exceptional communication skills in English and Swedish.
* Inspire and motivate the team and external stakeholders, including partners and investors.
* Strong interpersonal skills.
* Entrepreneurship mentality.
* A passion for crypto and digital assets.
* Organized and experienced with project management or equivalent.


**Nice to Haves**
* Relevant experience at a crypto exchange.
* Ability to effectively communicate with local regulators, public agencies, and government representatives.
* Global exposure and cross-culture mindset.


**Perks & Benefits**
* Competitive total compensation package
* L&D programs and Education subsidy for employees' growth and development
* Various team building programs and company events
* More that we love to tell you along the process!

title: ServiceNow-utvecklare
description:
Är du en erfaren utvecklare i ServiceNow och vill jobba som konsult med att hjälpa våra kunder med din expertis? Är du redo för en ny spännande utmaning och gillar att bygga nytt? Då kommer du passa perfekt hos oss i rollen som ServiceNow-utvecklare! Vi har kunderna och du kompetensen - låt oss bygga vidare på vårt vinnande koncept tillsammans!
 



  





**Din roll** 




 I rollen som ServiceNow-utvecklare arbetar du nära våra kunder tillsammans med dina kollegor i ett agilt och engagerat team. Du hjälper våra kunder på deras digitala resa genom att skapa och implementera flöden och integrationer, scripta och arbeta med stories i projekt och förvaltning. Tillsammans bildar vi ett svårslaget team som inte bara inspirerar och utmanar våra kunder utan även levererar de bästa lösningarna för kunden och vidareutvecklar vårt erbjudande.
 



  





**Ditt team** 




 I rollen som ServiceNow-utvecklare kommer du tillhöra ett team med placering i Stockholm. Dina närmsta kollegor är systemutvecklare, verksamhetsutvecklare och lösningsarkitekter och är alla specialiserade inom plattformen ServiceNow. Din närmsta chef, Marcus Aleson, är Konsultchef inom vårt affärsområde Information Management och HÄR kan du höra hur han beskriver Atea som arbetsplats.
 



  





 Så här säger Hesron Alem, ServiceNow-utvecklare, om hur det är att arbeta på Atea:
 



 ”Ateas starka relationer med sina kunder gör att jag som ServiceNow-konsult får möjlighet att ta en värdefull roll i mina uppdrag. Vi arbetar alltid för våra kunders bästa, vilket gör mig mycket stolt. Kombinationen av detta och att kompetensutveckling uppmuntras i högsta grad gör det till en fantastisk arbetsplats för mig.”
 



  





**Vad vi söker hos dig** 




 Vi tror på dig och dina personliga egenskaper som är viktiga för att lyckas och trivas hos oss. Vi tror att du gillar att arbeta tillsammans med andra i team. Du är självgående och har sinne för att hitta nya lösningar. Du uppskattar möjligheten att möta nya kunder och arbeta i en varierande vardag. Du sätter höga mål för dig själv och söker aktivt utmaningar samt utvecklingsmöjligheter. Att dela med dig av din kunskap till både kollegor och kund är en självklarhet för dig.
 



  





 För att lyckas i tjänsten som konsult inom ServiceNow ser vi att du har med dig:
 


* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av en liknande roll som exempelvis utvecklare eller lösningsarkitekt
* God kompetens inom kravanalys, design och implementation av ServiceNow-plattformen
* Goda kunskaper om nyckelteknologi som är relevant för integrationslösningar inom ServiceNow
* Mycket goda kunskaper i att konfigurera och skripta i ServiceNow
* Förståelse och kunskap om nyckelteknologi som är relevant för ServiceNow-integrationslösningar
* Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* Svenskt medborgarskap



  





 Meriterande:
 


* Certifieringar inom ServiceNow & ITIL



  





**Vårt löfte till dig** 




 Hos oss får du vara med att bidra till ett smartare, effektivare och mer hållbart samhälle. Med fokus på utveckling, laganda och personligt ansvarstagande ser vi till att göra skillnad. Vi uppmuntrar och stöttar varandra, och tar vara på våra individuella förmågor, perspektiv och erfarenheter. Det är därför du är viktig för oss. För att du är du, för att du är nyfiken och för att du vill växa professionellt - och som människa. Tillsammans skapar vi laget som bygger Sverige med it.
 



  





**Har vi väckt ditt intresse?** 




 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Marcus Aleson, konsultchef, via marcus.aleson@atea.se. Ansökningar hanteras löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, ansök därmed redan idag!
 



 Som ett kvalitativt led i vårt rekryteringsarbete genomgår våra slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om våra framtida medarbetare.
 



 Atea vill vara The Place To Be, den självklara platsen, för alla människor då vi värdesätter och jobbar aktivt med mångfald och inkludering.
 



  





**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!** 




  





**Följ oss i sociala medier**

title: Senior .NET utvecklare till AML-tjänsten CM1
description:
Till vår AML-tjänst CM1\* söker vi en senior .NET-utvecklare som vill säkerställa att produktens långsiktiga vision och marknadsposition efterlevs. Vår produkt CM1 är en SaaS-tjänst för att motverka penningtvätt som är marknadsledande i Norden.
   

  

 Som anställd i CM1 får du möjlighet att arbeta med kunder i olika verksamhetsområden och att jobba i ett sammansvetsat team med engagerade medarbetare som är specialiserade inom vår SaaS-tjänst. Ansök idag – urval sker löpande.
   

  

 Läs mer om produkten CM1.
   

  

**Om rollen och arbetsuppgifter**
 Som .NET-utvecklare är du en del av utvecklingsteamet och tillsammans med de andra teamen utvecklar vi produkten CM1.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter innefattar bl a att;
   

  

 – Utveckla SaaS-tjänsten i C#, JavaScript och SQL samt arbeta i Jira som arbetsverktyg
   

  

 – Implementera och driftsätta ändringar i både nya- och befintliga tjänster
   

  

 – Samarbeta med både kunder, kravställare och dina kollegor i utvecklings- och produktteamet
   

  

 – Identifiera förändringsbehov och bidra med idéer till SaaS-tjänstens framtida utveckling
   

  

**Vi tror att du:**
 – Har eftergymnasial utbildning inom system- eller datavetenskap, alternativt motsvarande relevant utbildning
   

  

 – Minst 3 års erfarenhet av C# .NET
   

  

 – God förmåga att kommunicera i både svenska och engelska i tal såväl som skrift
   

  

**Meriterande:**
 – Erfarenhet av relationsdatabaser/Microsoft SQL Server
   

  

 – Goda kunskaper om databaser
   

  

 – Erfarenhet av JavaScript
   

  

 – Förståelse för produkter från Atlassian, exempelvis Confluence och Jira
   

  

 – Branschspecifika kunskaper, t.ex. AML, KYC eller bank
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 – En omväxlande arbetsroll där ingen dag är den andra lik
   

  

 – Individanpassad karriär- och kompetensutveckling
   

  

 – Möjlighet till hybrid arbetsplats
   

  

* ) Om CM1 Softronic CM1 AB är ett dotterbolag till Softronic AB – en trygg och stabil arbetsgivare som funnits sedan 1984. På CM1 och Softronic värdesätts livsbalans där vi satsar på gemenskap, kunskapsdelning och kompetensutveckling genom exempelvis aktiviteter och nätverkande av olika slag.


 Vi hjälper våra kunder utveckla tjänster som förenklar människors liv och arbeten. “GoodTech – ledande teknik som gör gott i samhället” är den kraft vi bidrar med för att vässa affärer och samhällsservice med innovation, säkerhet och hållbarhet i alla lösningar.
   

  

 Arbetet och arbetsplatsen ska skapa lust och energi och vi odlar aktivt en kultur där brädspelskvällar, löprundor med kollegor och en fika i solen får ta plats. Våra värdeord är Transparens, Entreprenörskap, Ansvar, Mod (TEAM). Värdeorden genomsyrar vår vardag – hur vi jobbar och förhåller oss till varandra. I teamet arbetar vi även proaktivt och lösningsorienterat för att hjälpa kunderna i sin förﬂyttning.
   

  

 Kontaktperson är Sandra Madstedt, sandra.madstedt@softronic.se
   

  

 Vi har gjort vårt medieval, säljsamtal undanbedes.
