You will also have the chance to travel occasionally to our other locations, gaining valuable exposure to our diverse teams, global operations and high-impact projects.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Perform financial reviews and reporting ensuring accuracy and transparency
* Conduct ad-hoc financial data analysis and track key performance indicators (KPIs)
* Support tasks related to market expansion as we enter new countries
* Set up new and improve existing financial reporting structures
* Assist in the implementation of new financial systems and processes


**Qualifications**
* Advanced analytical skills and experience working with data analysis tools
* Ability to independently conduct financial analyses with a business-driven mindset, offering proactive insights and recommendations
* A flexible and adaptable attitude with ability to work in a fast-paced environment
* A service minded and collaborative approach
* A higher academic or professional qualification relevant to the job
* At least 3 years of experience in a similar role, ideally within a large multinational company
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken


**Additional Information**
 Exiting opportunity to our Stockholm Head office. Join our dynamic international team and be a part of a vibrant work environment where innovation thrives.
   

  

**Our Benefits Are**
* Competitive pension, health and medical insurance
* 30 paid vacation days
* Fitness benefit (Friskvårdsbidrag)
* Professional growth


 We welcome a diverse range of applicants and believe that different perspectives drive success. This is a 100% on-site position based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 If you want to be part of one of the most exciting industries in the world, then apply now and be a key player in our success story!

title: Recruitment Business Manager
description:
**Om tjänsten** 




 Xameras Stockholmskontor söker nu en driven och engagerad Recruitment Business Manager (RBM) som vill vara med och forma framtidens matchningar mellan unga ingenjörer och Sveriges mest innovativa företag!
 



  





 Som RBM är ditt ansvar att leda hela rekryteringsprocessen och säkerställa att både kunder och kandidater får en förstklassig upplevelse. Du bygger starka och långsiktiga kundrelationer, arbetar aktivt för att öka inflödet av nya uppdrag och skapar matchningar som verkligen gör skillnad. Genom att förstå kundernas behov och kandidatens potential stärker du Xameras position på marknaden. Du coachar och utvecklar dina konsulter och säkerställer en trygg och stimulerande arbetsmiljö. Dessutom representerar du Xamera i externa sammanhang och samarbeten för att sprida vår vision och bygga vårt varumärke.
 



  





**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Driva rekryteringsprocesser från urval och intervjuer till färdig matchning och uppföljning.
* Coacha och utveckla konsulter genom regelbundna avstämningar, coachning och hantering av arbetsrättsliga frågor för att skapa en trygg och utvecklande arbetsmiljö.
* Bygga och underhålla kundrelationer, identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter och arbeta aktivt med merförsäljning för att öka affärsvolymen och kundnöjdheten.



  





**Vi söker dig som:** 




  




* Har erfarenhet inom rekrytering, försäljning eller konsultbranschen och vill ta nästa steg i din karriär.
* Relevant eftergymnasial utbildning.
* Är affärsdriven och har en naturlig förmåga att bygga starka kundrelationer och se möjligheter där andra ser utmaningar.
* Har erfarenhet av rekrytering eller tjänsteförsäljning – en stark merit.
* Är en skicklig kommunikatör som gillar att skapa kontakt med nya människor och har förmågan att förstå både kundens och kandidatens behov.
* Är resultatinriktad, tävlingsinriktad och trivs med att arbeta i en miljö där ditt driv och engagemang gör skillnad.



  





**Vilka är vi?** 




 Xamera är en ledande aktör inom matchning av unga ingenjörer och studenter inom IT, teknik och ekonomi. Vår vision är att lösa kompetensbristen inom svensk industri- och techsektor genom att tänka nytt. Vi utmanar traditionella rekryteringsmetoder och fokuserar på att skapa rätt matchningar från början. Detta tillvägagångssätt har gjort oss till Årets Rekryteringsföretag 2024.
 



  





**Vad erbjuder vi?** 



* Engagerade kollegor som delar ditt driv och din passion.
* En spännande utvecklingsresa där du växer både professionellt och personligt.
* Ett stort nätverk av kunder, kandidater och branschkollegor.
* Ett dynamiskt arbete där ingen dag är den andra lik.
* En positiv och inkluderande arbetsmiljö där vi har roligt på jobbet och stöttar varandra att nå nya höjder
 **.**



  





**Startdatum:** 




 Intervjuer sker löpande med start våren 2025.

title: Senior nätverkskonsult Fortinet
description:
Tillsammans med 14 andra nordeuropeiska IT-företag har vi bildat itm8, ett nytt powerhouse inom digital transformation. Vi söker nu dig som vill vara med på resan och som trivs i situationer där alla svar inte redan är givna, men du kommer att ta dig an att finna dem tillsammans med ambitiösa och drivna kollegor.
 



 Som nätverkskonsult hos itm8 är du central i att säkerställa att våra kunders nätmiljöer fungerar smidigt. Du hanterar självständigt kundärenden både remote och via besök för att felsöka och lösa kundens utmaning. Du är långt ifrån ensam, för inom konsultteamet har du ett nära samarbete med tekniska nätspecialister inom operationsteamet för att ta fram den bästa lösningen för kunden. Du kommer också att stötta kollegor vid tekniska problem och du deltar regelbundet i interna communitymöten, där du delar med dig av dina erfarenheter och lär av andra. Närheten till våra säkerhetskonsulter som också arbetar med Fortinet är självklar då dessa lösningar väldigt ofta går hand i hand. Du kommer även delta med din nätverkskompetens i uppstartsmöten för nya projekt där du tidigare varit med och designat lösningsförslag och implementerar näten.
 



 Du har stor möjlighet att själv planera dina arbetsdagar och kundprojekt. Samtidigt är det en dynamisk och varierad roll som kräver flexibilitet och en förmåga att snabbt anpassa sig till nya situationer och kundbehov.
 



 I den här konsultrollen trivs du som gillar stort eget ansvar och frihet att planera och genomföra projekt såväl självständigt som i team. Du hanterar allt från kundkontakt till att presentera lösningsförslag och genomföra driftsättningar för att sedan lämna över till vår Operation. Det är en dynamisk roll där du utvecklas ständigt genom att lära dig nya saker och ta ytterligare certifieringar för att du ska få vidareutvecklas hos oss. Trots att arbetet kan vara intensivt i perioder, finns alltid stöd från hjälpsamma och trevliga kollegor, vilket skapar en stark teamkänsla och stort kundfokus.
 


 Vad vi erbjuder dig
 
**Fokus på balans** 
 ; våra nätverkskonsulter trivs med variationen mellan att i perioder ha mycket att göra, som efterföljs av återhämtning. Perioder av lägre arbetsbelastning ägnas åt såväl kompetensutveckling som att bidra till nya affärsmöjligheter och till tjänsteutveckling.
 



**Du inkluderas från dag ett** 
 : Vi erbjuder dig en lyhörd atmosfär där allas åsikter räknas. Dina itm8s är stödjande och snabbt inkluderande, vilket gör att nya medarbetare snabbt känner sig som en del av teamet.
 



**Sociala aktiviteter** 
 : Vi har regelbundna gemensamma luncher och frivilliga aktiviteter inom teamet för att stärka trivsel och känsla av sammanhang. Samtidigt har vi även interna kompetensforum som säkerställer att vi hela tiden utvecklar våra skills.
   





**Flexibilitet** 
 : Stor möjlighet att skapa din egna balans mellan att jobba remote, från kontoret eller hos kunden. 
 


 Dina kompetenser och erfarenhet
 
 Vi letar efter dig som kan brandväggar, switching, routing och trådlösa nät som din egen ficka. Vi ser gärna att du brinner lika mycket som oss gällande Fortinet. Du kan dessutom verifiera det med certifieringar som du tagit under din tid som nätverkskonsult. Har du erfarenhet inom Azure Network är det värdefullt. Eftersom du kommer att ha mycket kundkontakt tror vi att du redan är etablerad som konsult och trivs med att vara det. Du behärskar både svenska och engelska flytande.
 



 Hos oss kommer du att trivas om du är självgående och bra på att hantera flera projekt samtidigt. Vi gillar en lösningsorienterad attityd och att du snabbt kan anpassa dig till nya situationer. Vi är ett inkluderande och stödjande gäng, så det är viktigt att du är en lagspelare. Att kunna kommunicera effektivt och samarbeta bra med både kollegor och kunder är superviktigt för att trivas i rollen.
 


 Creating the Difference – today, tomorrow, together
 




 itm8 är en av de ledande nordiska aktörerna inom specialistconsulting och managerade IT-tjänster för privata företag och den offentliga sektorn. Itm8 består idag av 14 företag som i en stor fusion under 2023 bildade ett powerhouse med över 1800 specialister. Tillsammans säkerställer vi de bästa tjänsterna för att bli Nordens ledande digitala transformationspartner inom Cloud, Infrastructure & Security, Digital Transformation och Application Services. itm8 finns representerat på 26 platser i Danmark, Sverige, Filippinerna samt Tjeckien.
 







 Hos oss finns inga stora egon eller magiker. Vår superkraft är att lyssna noga, lösa kundernas 1000-bitars pussel och kavla upp ärmarna för ett seriöst dedikerat arbete. Vi ifrågasätter det förväntade och utvecklar lösningar som tar våra kunder, och oss själva, flera steg längre.
 



 Läs gärna mer om vår story, kultur och våra erbjudanden www.itm8.se. Du är också varmt välkommen att lära känna oss mer på Instagram @itm8inside.
 


 Redo att utmana(s) med itm8?
 
 Varmt välkommen att ansöka till tjänsten nedan. Om du inte är redo att ansöka än och har frågor, skriv till oss i meddelanderutan nedan så följer vi upp med dig. Alla ansökningar och kontakter behandlas konfidentiellt. Vi kontaktar kandidater löpande så vi rekommenderar att du ansöker till tjänsten så snart du kan.
 



 På itm8 är vi övertygade om att mångfald berikar oss och driver innovation framåt. Vi välkomnar därför sökanden av alla kön, bakgrunder och livserfarenheter. Hos oss hittar du en arbetsgivare som värdesätter och uppmuntrar unika perspektiv och idéer. Oavsett vem du är eller varifrån du kommer, om du delar vår passion för teknik och kundrelationer, vill vi höra från dig. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan och chansen att möjligen välkomna dig till vårt team!

title: CyberSecurity Manager/Coordinator
description:
We at Scania’s Powertrain Control System are looking at expanding our team with a Cybersecurity Manager/Coordinator to meet future challenges in the automotive industry.
   

  

 We need to supply industry-leading performance and functionality to keep our position as a leader in the heavy-duty market. Currently, we are delivering our control system to several companies within the TRATON Group that are based in Sweden, Germany, and the U.S.
   

  

**The team**
 The team consists of 14 engineers with different roles such as System Owners, Functional Safety Managers, Safety Engineers, Requirement Engineer, Cybersecurity Manager and Cybersecurity Engineer for the Engine and Aftertreatment Control Systems, which are one of Scania’s most advanced real-time control systems. We are responsible to make sure that we meet Functional Safety standards and comply Cybersecurity legislations in different markets such as EU, China and US.
   

  

 Our group consists of experienced and outgoing people, with different cultural and educational backgrounds, as we see strength in diversity. We prioritize personal development, helpfulness, and collaboration in the team.
   

  

**Your work assignments**
 No day is the other alike here is a list of examples of work assignments for the role:
   

  

  

* Plan and deliver Cybersecurity activities for multiple ongoing projects including TARA (Threat analysis and Risk assessment)
* Responsible for integrating the Cybersecurity processes in the normal development process for the systems
* Support the Cybersecurity specification (Cybersecurity concept) and requirements
* Maintain Cybersecurity process for sourcing and maintenance of components
* Lead CSMS (Cybersecurity Management System) compliance (ISO21434, UNR155, GB44496, etc.)
* Interface with other parts of organization like cybersecurity monitoring, CSMS work group,
* Organize, support, and participate in periodical external audit of Cyber Security Processes.


**Your profile**
 You are passionate about the topic, and you are a curious person who finds it easy to cooperate with others. You are motivated by responsibility and enjoy solving problems in a structured way. To succeed in this role as Cybersecurity Manager/Coordinator you have some of the following: You have a BSc or MSc in engineering or similar knowledge gained from work experience.
   

  

  

* Previous experience from working with either Cybersecurity in automotive industry (ISO21434, UN ECE R155/156), functional safety (ISO26262) or other regulation-based standards (like GDPR, ISO 27001, NIST, etc) are meriting.
* Certifications such as CISSP, CISM, or CEH are meriting
* You are patient and methodical approaching the administrative tasks that exist in the role
* You have an improvement mindset and find efficient ways for us to continuously improve our way of working.
* You are comfortable with taking lead in the work and enjoy involving your colleagues.
* You have good problem solving skills and your capacity to adapt to changing circumstances will be your best asset in this position.
* We are a large organization with a great deal of cross-functional collaboration and your skills in communication and building relationships will be appreciated.


 Strong analytical skills, including the ability to analyze complex systems, identify security risks, and develop effective solutions.
   

  

 Understanding of software security principles, secure coding practices, and application lifecycle management
   

  

 Good knowledge of English is required, and Swedish is a merit.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We offer you a fun workplace with diverse and challenging tasks in a hybrid work setup, meaning you can work from home or at our remote office at Scania Sergel a few days a week if the job allows. Scania offers many opportunities to develop your career and the professional development of our employees is a priority for us.
   

  

 In addition, we can offer you other benefits such as free training at Scania's health center Gröndal, or a wellness allowance. You will also be offered an occupational pension, flexible working hours, and much more. If you live in Stockholm, we also offer a direct bus service between Stockholm and Södertälje with Scania Job Express.
   

  

**For more information**
 If you would like to learn more about the position or group, please do not hesitate to contact Elisabet Larsson Landström, Manager, ENESX, elisabet.larsson.landstrom@scania.com.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV, personal letter, and education certificate. Please apply as soon as possible. Ongoing selection and competency-based interviews will take place after the application period. A background check may be conducted for this position.
   

  

 Welcome to apply!

title: Lösningsarkitekt Datacenter och kommunikation
description:
**Vill du vara med och designa framtidens nätverkslösningar för en av Sveriges största myndigheter? Vi söker en nätverksarkitekt som vill arbeta med design och utveckling av vår IT-infrastruktur, med fokus på hög tillgänglighet och stabilitet. Hos oss får du möjlighet att påverka, samarbeta med experter och leverantörer samt bidra till samhällsnyttan genom tekniska lösningar i framkant.** 
**Tillsammans får vi Sverige i arbete. Vill du bli en av oss?**
 Sektionen Datacenter och kommunikation
   

  

 Vi är 14 st som ansvarar för myndighetens nätverk, datahallar, WAN/LAN kommunikation. Vi arbetar med både utveckling och drift inom området och har höga krav på tillgänglighet och stabilitet av våra tekniska komponenter. Vår sektion tillhör enheten IT-infrastruktur som bland annat hanterar, server, container, AD, Databas, mail och lagring/backup, tillsammans skapar vi Arbetsförmedlingens it-infrastruktur.
   

  

**Beskrivning av tjänsten**
 Du kommer ingå i ett av våra designteam som jobbar tvärfunktionellt inom enheten IT-infrastruktur där vi tillsammans hjälper våra applikationsteam. Designteamet består av andra arkitekter inom enheten samt vår områdesarkitekt. Du kommer ansvara för design av nätverk, WAN/LAN, datahallar och ingående hårdvara inom detta. Du kommer driva tekniska krav och träffa våra leverantörer, samt ha samarbeten internt med andra arkitekter samt teamleads och byggstensansvariga. Du kommer fungera som expertstöd för implementation, problemlösning och kontinuerlig förbättring kopplat till datacenter och nätverk.
   

  

 Tjänsten kräver att du har en stark förståelse för verksamhetsbehov och kan översätta dessa till tekniska lösningar med kostnadsmedvetenhet.
   

  

**Vårt erbjudande**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid som kan komma att inledas med sex månaders provanställning. Placeringsorten är Solna.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder dig möjligheten att arbeta på en arbetsplats där vi värdesätter balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Du får tillgång till ett generöst semesteravtal, flexibla arbetstider samt möjlighet att arbeta på distans upp till 49 procent på årsbasis. Hos oss ingår även friskvård under arbetstid och ett förmånligt friskvårdsbidrag.
   

  

 Som anställd på Arbetsförmedlingen har du också tillgång till kompetensutveckling och karriärmöjligheter inom myndigheten. Genom vårt arbete bidrar vi till ett inkluderande och hållbart samhälle, där du får möjlighet att göra en verklig skillnad för individer och för samhället i stort.
   

  

 Mer om att jobba hos oss
   

  

**Grundläggande krav för tjänsten**
* Minst 5 års aktuell erfarenhet som lösningsarkitekt eller liknande roll inom IT- och datacenterlösningar hos stora organisationer
* Minst 5 års aktuell erfarenhet av att designa, implementera och underhålla nätverksinfrastruktur och datacenterlösningar
* Är väl förtrogen med teknologier som Cisco med fördel CISCO ACI, WAN/LAN, kubernetes, virtualiserings server och liknande
* Goda kommunikationsfärdigheter på svenska och engelska både i tal och skrift


**Övriga meriter för tjänsten**
* Certifieringar liknande Cisco CCNP/CCIE eller motsvarande
* Erfarenhet av automation och orkestrering av IT-infrastruktur för att eftersträva molntjänster
* Erfarenhet av Agila arbetsmetodiken


 Den statliga värdegrunden guidar oss i vårt dagliga arbete. Som anställd hos oss förväntas du arbeta rättvist, opartiskt och med hög integritet, samt bidra till att upprätthålla och stärka förtroendet för vår myndighet.
   

  

 Mer om statliga värdegrunden
   

  

 Utöver dessa kvalifikationer har du personlig förmåga och fallenhet att arbeta i enlighet med Arbetsförmedlingens medarbetarskap:
   

  

 Medarbetare på Arbetsförmedlingen:
   

  

* Tar ansvar för sina arbetsprestationer och sitt bidrag till helheten
* Anpassar sig till förändring och oförutsedda händelser
* Tar initiativ till utveckling och bidrar till förbättring


**Ansökan**
 Låter det här som en tjänst för dig? Välkommen med din ansökan
 **senast 2025-04-20** 
 .
   

  

 Bifoga ditt CV där du specificerar årtal, månad och arbetsuppgifter för varje anställning, samt intyg som styrker kraven om utbildning och/eller arbetslivserfarenhet i din ansökan.
   

  

 Det är viktigt att du besvarar urvalsfrågorna detaljerat och sanningsenligt, för att vi ska få en tydlig bild av din erfarenhet. Om efterfrågad information inte framgår riskerar du bli bortsållad i urvalet. Du behöver inte skicka in ett personligt brev.
   

  

 En säkerhetsprövning kommer genomföras på slutkandidaten innan beslut om anställning fattas.
   

  

 Under rekryteringsprocessen kan urvalstester förekomma. Vi kommer att hålla dig informerad genom hela rekryteringsprocessen. Mer om vår rekryteringsprocess.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter kontaktar du den rekryteringspartner som finns namngiven i annonsen så får du hjälp med att skicka in din ansökan.
   

  

 Vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en myndighet fri från diskriminering. Det är viktigt för oss att all kompetens tas tillvara och vi välkomnar alla sökande. Vi ser positivt på om du har kunskaper i något av våra nationella minoritetsspråk.
   

  

**Välkommen till jobbet som får Sverige i arbete! Här arbetar du på regeringens uppdrag för en arbetsmarknad som hjälper människor framåt. Vi frigör möjligheter så att arbetssökande hittar sysselsättning och arbetsgivare sin nästa medarbetare. För att nå målet behöver vi samarbeta, i myndigheten men också med olika externa aktörer i hela landet. Tillsammans driver vi förändring, utvecklar nya arbetssätt och skapar lösningar som gör att Sverige kan fortsätta framåt.**
 Mer om vår organisation och vårt uppdrag.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Solna | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: Af-2025/0028 0784 | Kontakt: Susanne Blomlöf, Enhetschef susanne.blomlof@arbetsformedlingen.se, Moa Christner, Rekryteringspartner moa.christner@arbetsformedlingen.se, | Facklig företrädare: Roberto Lindmark, Saco-S roberto.lindmark@arbetsformedlingen.se, Per Samuelsson, ST per.samuelsson@arbetsformedlingen.se, Tobias Persson, Seko tobias.x.persson@arbetsformedlingen.se, | Publicerat: 2025-03-26 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-04-20

title: Experienced Seniors to our IT & Specialized Assurance team
description:
**Company Description**
 Deloitte is a leading global provider of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, and Consultative Services. With more than 457,000 professionals in over 150 countries, we help our clients and society to solve complex problems and achieve ambitious goals. We are driven by one purpose: to make an impact that matters. To us, this means lasting results for our clients and their businesses, ideas and actions that contribute to a greater good. It also means empowering our people and supporting them in their growth journey.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Deloitte’s IT & Specialized Assurance team is currently looking for
 *Seniors* 
 who thrive in a dynamic and challenging environment.
   

  

**Who are we?**
 You will join as a member of our IT & Specialized Assurance team. We help clients transform the ways in which they leverage people, technology, processes, and controls to address their financial and operational risks and drive performance within their business operations. IT audit work can include assignments relating to the provision of assurance or advice. An IT audit typically evaluates and reports upon the procedures and control environment around the IT systems in place within an organization with a view to achieving more effective management of the risks to which the entity is exposed. We do so in the following ways:
   

  

* We identify risks and weaknesses, thus enabling the development of solutions for introducing controls over processes supported by IT.
* We help organizations take advantage of new and innovative technologies and better manage their risks through advisory and managed services.
* We advise on general IT controls and audit application controls within the area of I T audit and support financial auditing tasks.
* We provide clients with assurance reports on several topics, including general IT controls in an outsourcing environment; application and process controls; and protection of personal data, as well as the GDPR.
* We support and transform internal audit functions to provide relevant and timely insights to Executive Management and the Board on a wide range of risks.
* We work across functions within Deloitte to provide our clients with the right set of skills.


**Our team**
 The team consists of different nationalities with varied backgrounds and therefore embraces diversity of thought. We strive to foster an inclusive culture founded on collaboration, curiosity, and high ambitions. We offer you a strong and often life-long professional network allowing you to unfold your full potential. You will become part of a large team, and your development will take place in a truly social environment, which is of high importance to us.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**To be successful in this role, we expect that you:**
* Have completed a university degree in audit, risk management, business administration, economics, accounting, finance, mathematics, or information technology; but not limited hereto.
* Have 2-4years of full-time professional work experience, preferably within IT-audit, or related fields such as information technology systems, business and financial controls, process management.
* Are proficient in either written and spoken Swedish or have a high proficiency in written and spoken English, and the right to live and work in Sweden.
* Able to identify and assess IT risks and controls to relate them to business processes and to express opinions in a clear manner.
* Assume responsibility for the overall engagement output, including scoping, financial management, quality assurance, and review of deliverables.
* Strong project management and coordinating skills, including the skill to manage multiple engagements simultaneously; manage teams effectively; and deliver engagements on time and in compliance with the budget.


 Additional Information
   

  

**What you can expect from us:**
 If you choose IT & Specialized Assurance as the next step in your career, you can expect that we:
   

  

* Give you excellent opportunities for personal and professional development
* Let you work in a dynamic and international environment
* Do our utmost to integrate you well in our team and give you the opportunity to get to know your colleagues well.


**How To Apply**
 Submit your application online as soon as possible, your application should contain your:
   

  

* CV
* Cover letter including a motivation why you are interested in Deloitte and this position. You can upload the cover letter as a document.
* University grades


 If you have any questions regarding the position or recruiting process, please contact Rasmus Öhman, Recruiter, rohman@deloitte.se.
   

  

*As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The process for background checks is carried out in collaboration with ToFindOut. https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/.*
**What impact will you make?**
 Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

title: Account Executive
description:
**Description** 




 Automat-it is an all-in AWS Premier partner that empowers startups with DevOps and FinOps expertise and hands-on services. We guide and support hundreds of startups leveraging AWS smarter throughout their growth journey. We save our customers significant time to market and optimize their cloud performance and cost-effectiveness.
 



 Automat-it operates in more than seven countries across EMEA. We provide a dynamic environment where you can expand your professional expertise and make a significant impact.
 



 We’re seeking an Account Manager to drive Automat-it business growth in the North EMEA territory of Greenfield accounts while assuring a great customer experience. You’ll be responsible for the sales process, from prospecting to closing a deal.
 



 📍 Work location - Remote from Sweden or Amsterdam
 



**Responsibilities** 



* Develop and execute successful targeted territory development plans to help achieve or exceed growth, revenue, and margin targets
* Develop and manage all phases of the territory’s business development cycle, including managing proposal negotiations, the statement-of-work, and completion of all contract details
* Demonstrates breadth and depth of knowledge in aligning Automat-it capabilities to client business and positioning relative to competitors
* Prospect new customers and communicate with the AWS reps regularly
* Maintain and develop strategic vendor relations with AWS
* Regularly attend business events to promote and educate prospective clients on the benefits of Automat-it
* Work collaboratively with Marketing, Operations, Delivery, and Solutions Architects
* Commitment to regular business travel locally and abroad



**Requirements** 



* 4+ years of experience in direct IT sales and business development from a complex cloud or software solutions
* Experience selling IT professional services (consulting/managed/staff services) or SaaS solutions designed for R&D or DevOps teams
* Ability to articulate the value proposition of professional services to technical and business stakeholders
* Proven successful track record of meeting and exceeding sales quotas
* Experience with selling AWS-based solutions
* Network and relationships with North EMEA-based digital native/ISV/startup companies
* Demonstrated ability to engage and influence C-level executives
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
* Excellent presentation and organizational skills
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
* AWS cloud certificated - advantage
* Working experience with Salesforce or Hubspot - advantage



**Benefits** 



* Professional training and certifications covered by the company (AWS, FinOps, Kubernetes, etc.)
* International work environment
* Referral program – enjoy cooperation with your colleagues and get a bonus
* Company events and social gatherings (happy hours, team events, knowledge sharing, etc.)
* Wellbeing and professional coaching through Oliva Health
* English classes.
* Soft skills training



 Automat-it is committed to fostering a workplace that promotes equal opportunities for all. We firmly believe that fostering a diverse workforce is crucial to our success. Our recruitment decisions are grounded in your experience and skills, recognizing the value you bring to our team.

title: Manager - Product Management - Security Solutions, Commercialization Nordics & Baltics-R-242667
company_industry: Financial Services, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Our Purpose**
*Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.*
**Title And Summary**
 Manager - Product Management - Security Solutions, Commercialization Nordics & Baltics
   

  

 Who is Mastercard?
   

  

 Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential.
   

  

 Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.
   

  

**Overview**
 The Services organization is a key driver of growth for Mastercard providing cutting-edge services that help our customers grow. Bringing together our unique and proprietary data, technology, insights and expertise into a single organization, Services relentlessly focuses on meeting the needs of our customers and is a key differentiator for Mastercard driving our business growth. Within Services, the Security Solutions Product Line is responsible for Mastercard’s safety and security related product development efforts to protect the integrity of payments, digital payments and cybersecurity. Its products and platforms encompass cyber security, identity, financial crimes & resiliency, experience & disputes, and fraud domains.
   

  

 We are looking for a Security Solutions Commercialization Lead for Nordics and Baltics, reporting to the Commercialization Lead for Continental Europe.
   

  

 The ideal candidate is passionate about leveraging state of the art products and platforms to drive customer value. He is objective-driven and autonomous, comfortable leading both strategic and operational aspects of a broad product portfolio.
   

  

 Role
   

  

 The Security Solutions Commercialization Lead for Nordics and Balticsrepresents the product line in the market and provide subject matter expertise and sales support to drive customer value and business growth for both Mastercard and our customers.
   

  

**The Main Responsibilities Are The Following**
* Manage Security Solutions product portfolio in the market: own Security Solutions Go To Market Strategy to enable market product relevance, understand customer and market needs, as well as the competitive landscape for revenue attainment
* Execute our Global initiatives to improve the Security and Resilience of Mastercard transactions, in line with the regulatory environment (DORA, PSR, MICA, …)
* Maximize the value Mastercard deliver to its customers by leading solution optimization and usage by our customers, leveraging on our Customer Success organization
* Participate to new product developments by leading initial customer engagement and facilitating customer tests and early deployments, with the contribution of Security Solutions European team
* Support Services Business Development effort to generate incremental growth by contributing to the sales process with industry and domain expertise
* Demonstrate Mastercard thought leadership and expertise by participating in community and industry events
* Partner with the other Services and Products organizations to bundle initiatives and demonstrate a customer-focused, unified and differentiated value proposition
* Collaborate closely with the account management team to support Security Solutions products performances and evolutions, and drive initiatives with customers


**All About You**
* Proven experience in driving product development and commercialization efforts, aligning with new product requirements, and implementing consistent processes to accelerate time-to-market and improve business outcomes
* Ability to act as a subject matter expert and product champion by presenting compelling product propositions to senior stakeholders including at demonstrations and industry events
* Proven success in synthesizing products and services from multiple functional areas into global value propositions that meet customer needs
* Highly collaborative and self-driven individual who will need to manage relationships across multiple functional areas, with limited supervisory support
* Cross-functional team leadership experience managing multiple complex projects concurrently and delivering timely results under tight timelines
* Expertise in the payment ecosystem, understanding of competitive landscape and industry trends. Knowledge in the following domains: cyber security, identity, financial crimes & resiliency, experience & disputes, and fraud


**Corporate Security Responsibility**
 All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
   

  

* Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
* Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
* Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
* Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.


 R-242667

title: Communications Manager
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 As a Communications Manager at Tobii Dynavox, you will play a key role in supporting our company vision (a world where everyone can communicate) through effective communication initiatives. Your efforts will be directed towards key target groups, including media, investors, customers, and internal audiences.
   

  

 If you are an approachable, collaborative and reliable networker who enjoys building internal relationships and is enthusiastic about all kinds of communication and storytelling work, we have the perfect opportunity for you where you can use your proactive and creative mindset to develop new compelling stories for both external and internal audiences!
   

  

**Please note:** 
 This is a full-time, permanent and
 **hybrid** 
 role with 2-3 days per week at our office in Stockholm city. This role also includes occasional (10%) international travel, which would be communicated weeks in advance.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Develop and execute comprehensive communication plans that align with our business strategy and goals.
* Create engaging content for various internal and external audiences and platforms, including financial communication.
* Collaborate with internal teams to ensure consistent messaging across all channels.
* Support community engagement initiatives, helping to foster brand loyalty and maintain active relationships with target audiences.
* Work closely together with People and Sustainability team on ongoing internal communication and employer branding initiatives.
* Manage the intranet platform to ensure effective internal communication.
* Monitor and analyze communication metrics to optimize our strategies.


**What We're Looking For:**
 We are looking for someone that has:
   

  

* Equivalent of a Bachelor’s degree in Communications, Public Relations, journalism, or a related field.
* Ability to create and execute on communications plans, with a minimum of 5 years of experience in Communications-related roles.
* Advanced writing, editing, and verbal communication skills in both Business English and Swedish.
* Experience from working with financial communication in a publicly listed company.
* Strong understanding of social media and other digital communication channels.
* Experience from working with platforms for collaboration, digital asset management and publishing such as SharePoint, Teams, Favro, Bynder and Sprout.
* Excellent stakeholder management skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment with a service-minded, hands-on approach.


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Regional asset manager - Sweden and Finland
description:
Siemens Real Estate Services (SRE) is the real estate service provider of Siemens AG and is responsible for the company's global real estate business. We manage the portfolio, operate the real estate including all real estate-related services, are responsible for its exploitation and carry out all Siemens-wide construction projects. We are currently in an exciting phase of transformation, undertaking many large-scale projects, and we would love for you to join us on this journey.
   

  

**We are looking for a** 
**regional asset manager!**
 To strengthen and support our ongoing journey, we are looking for a regional asset manager to join our team. You will be responsible for the management of real estate assets including external lease business in Sweden and Finland with a focus on Siemens space and service requirements within the existing portfolio including full budget and personnel responsibility. You will be based in preferably in Solna (Stockholm) but Mölndal (Göteborg) is also possible, but the portfolio includes locations in all of Sweden and Finland consisting of approximately 50 locations (approx. 40,000 sqm of office space).
   

  

 You will join our Real Estate Services (SRE) team in the Nordics, and work in close cooperation with the RAM head for the Nordics. You will also be a manager for the SRE team in Sweden and Finland.
   

  

**You’ll make an impact by:**
* Manage the real estate portfolio in Sweden and Finland—overseeing strategic planning, operations, and adherence to SRE standards, processes, and budgets—while implementing management-driven real estate strategies.
* Secure excellent Customer Relationship Management and Stakeholder Management (predominantly internal) and be a contact partner for real estate related topics within your area of locations
* You will be responsible for managing projects within the portfolio, coordinating the execution of Siemens Real Estate (SRE) M&A (Mergers & Acquisitions) initiatives in alignment with Siemens' M&A strategy.
* Driving continuous improvement of real estate costs for internal customers.
* Sourcing of Real Estate related services as well as steering and controlling of Suppliers
* Contribution to the HQ business lines, e. g. Project management (PM), Maintenance & Technology (MT), Transaction Management (TM), and Portfolio Management & Markets (PMM)
* Ensure legal ownership representation to local authorities and total adherence to local statutory regulations and local laws.
* Support to the HUB in regional initiatives in close cooperation with the Regional Business Management.


**You excel in:**
 We are looking for a candidate with an educational background in Economics or Engineering, with a focus on real estate. You have a couple of relevant professional experience in responsible roles within the real estate sector, and possess a solid understanding of Facility Management, Procurement of Real Estate Services, and Legal aspects and you also have experience working with lease agreements for commercial properties. You have a strong understanding and overview of the real estate market developments and ensure your portfolio is in line with the market.
   

  

 You also have leadership experience in a managerial role, with a consistent track record in building a high-performance culture showcasing the ability to hire and develop your team to excellence. As a person you are driven and motivated to collaborate with customers seeking the best possible business solutions. You have ability to influence and think “out of the box”.
   

  

 Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) in English and Swedish are a requirement.
   

  

**You’ll benefit from:**
* Flexible ways of working to encourage your work-life balance
* Individual development opportunities
* Inclusive culture where you are welcomed to be yourself
* We celebrate the fearlessness to think differently and to break new ground
* Be a part of a collaborative team with high ambitions


**Are you up for the challenge?**
 We are looking forward to receiving your application no later than 01-4-2025. But as we are interviewing continuously, we encourage you to apply as soon as you can. For questions about the position, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner ellen.ahlberg@siemens.com.
   

  

 Warm welcome with your application
   

  

 About us:
   

  

*Siemens is a focused technology company, pioneering intelligent solutions that transform the everyday in manufacturing, grids, buildings, and transportation. Our technology addresses real problems that affect the future of humanity: climate change, secure power, urbanization, and an aging population. With cooperation of more than 300,000 people and presence in more than 200 countries, we make a truly global impact. We build a better future for cities, societies, and industries to change the lives of billions of people for the better. We have a lofty goal in sustainability, to become climate neutral by 2030. Read more and join our family, [1] Siemens.*
 Our people make it happen.
   

  

 To read more about the life at Siemens follow us on:
   

  

**LinkedIn**
**Instagram**
*Transform the every day with us*

title: Customer Support Representative - Temporary
description:
**Norwegian-speaking Customer Support Representative (Temporary role)**
 Would you like to work in an international environment where you’ll make a difference every day? We are looking for game-changers to join us as we innovate for individuals and develop the world’s most advanced assistive solutions.
   

  

 At
 **Permobil** 
 , the people who use our products come first. Our purpose is to create advanced assistive solutions that make the lives of adults and children living with disabilities more enriching. Our people are passionate about pushing the boundaries of technology to deliver innovations that improve lives. We are a sustainable and responsible business committed to continuous improvement, and our customers can trust us to provide market-leading solutions driven by insights-based clinical data.
   

  

**Position Overview**
 We are looking for a
 **Norwegian-speaking Customer Support Specialist** 
 to join our Customer Support team. In this role, you will play a key part in providing exceptional support to our customers, ensuring their inquiries are handled efficiently and professionally. You will collaborate closely with internal teams to enhance customer experience and contribute to the overall success of our support operations.
   

  

 This is a
 **temporary role (approx. 1 year)** 
 based on-site at Permobil's brand new cutting-edge innovation center in Birsta, Sundsvall, or at our office in Stockholm (Spånga).
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Handling general Customer Enquiries from Customers, Users or other relevant stakeholders internally and externally, such as order management, claims and returns, warranty, tracking of orders, invoicing and cash collections in one or several markets,
* Order Management,
* Conduction of other administrative work in alignment with the EMEA Customer Support,
* Support process improvement and implementations withing the area,
* Sales activities where applicable.


**Role**
**To succeed in this role you have:**
* Degree in Business Administration, Engineering, Finance or other relevant educational background,
* Experience from similar position; medtech industry experience is meriting,
* Good IT-skills; experience from D365 would be an advantage,
* Fluency in English and Norwegian; additional languages besides local language would be an advantage,
* Passion for Customers and delivering outstanding customer service,
* Clear communication skills and ability to show empathy and use a positive language.


**Who Are You**
 You are a proactive and results-driven professional with a strong sense of responsibility. You have a proven track record of identifying opportunities and turning them into action. In a complex, international environment, you excel at structuring and prioritizing tasks while managing various stakeholders effectively. Your flexibility allows you to navigate fluctuating workloads with ease, ensuring that challenges are met with resilience and adaptability.
   

  

**Why is Permobil the next step for you?**
* You’ll make a difference. Every day. Everything we do leads to understanding and improving the lives of our users. Through our evidence-based innovation, we make a difference to people’s lives.
* You’ll make your mark as part of our future. We collaborate with colleagues across borders to Innovate for Individuals. The impact you make personally could lead change around the world.
* You’ll feel welcome from day one. We’re known for being great colleagues, who are collaborative, fun and at the cutting-edge. Everyone at Permobil cares as much as you do about making a positive difference.


**Application Process**
 We will conduct selection continuously so send us your application today or before
 **April 20th** 
 at the latest!
   

  

 Permobil is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals.
   

  

 For more information about the position, please contact Andreas Sjölander, Customer Support Manager, andreas.sjolander@permobil.com
   

  

 For information about the recruitment process, please contact Zivile Mitkute, Talent Acquisition Partner, zivile.mitkute@permobil.com
   

  

**Please respect that we do not wish recruitment assistance or advertising, we decline calls from recruitment and advertising providers.**
**More About Permobil**
 Permobil founder Dr. Per Uddén believed that helping people achieve the greatest level of independence is a basic human right and, for over 50 years, Permobil has held fast to that belief. Permobil is a global leader in advanced rehabilitation technology, passionate about better understanding our users’ needs and improving their quality of life through state-of-the-art healthcare solutions. Today, those solutions include power wheelchairs, seating and positioning products, power assist, and manual wheelchairs.
   

  

 Permobil is part of Patricia Industries, a subsidiary of Investor AB, and is headquartered in Sweden. Permobil has 2 000 team members in 18 countries around the world. For more information regarding the company’s storied history and complete product line, visit permobil.com.

title: Business Development Manager - Fintech
description:
**Description**
**Who we are**
 Etraveli Group is the globally leading company for tech solutions and fulfillment capabilities for online sales of flights. We are here to solve complexity, by connecting millions of flights and travelers across the globe. We hold consumer online travel agency brands like Mytrip, GoToGate & Flight Network and serve Booking.com with flights. Etraveli Group has also established strategic partnerships with companies like Skyscanner, Google Flights, TUI, etc.
   

  

 Every day we strive to make the world smaller for our customers and bigger for our people. Our diverse team of more than 2500 passionate professionals is what makes us the industry’s tech wonder and the best in the world at what we do. Our major offices are in Sweden (HQ), Canada, Greece, India, Poland with the Athens office being one of the largest, hosting around 600 employees working from the center of Athens for the rest of the world.
   

  

**Position Summary**
 The PRECISION Business Development Manager role at Etraveli Group is responsible for driving B2B sales initiatives, promoting PRECISION within the travel industry, and supporting the go-to-market strategy.
   

  

 PRECISION is a unique fraud prevention solution with a 100% travel DNA—built from travel to serve the travel industry. PRECISION does the heavy lifting by delivering a straightforward decision with a unique 360° approach which results in lower costs, more sales, and a smooth customer experience—so merchants can focus on growing their business.
   

  

 The role reports to the Head of Business Development of PRECISION.
   

  

 This role is open to all of our existing European locations so the right candidate can be based in UK, Spain, Netherlands, Finland, Switzerland and Sweden. Depending on the candidate's location, it is a hybrid or remote position.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Develop and execute sales strategies, identifying new business opportunities, and nurturing relationships with key stakeholders to drive revenue growth.
* Ensure a continued healthy pipeline of new business.
* Manage end-to-end sales cycle from prospecting to live customer and beyond.
* Close collaboration with internal teams, including product development, marketing, and customer support, to ensure alignment between client needs and fintech solution offerings.
* Stay updated on industry trends ,challenges, and emerging opportunities to identify areas for business growth.


**Requirements**
* Degree in Business, Tourism, or a related field.
* 3-5 years of experience in sales, business development, or a customer-facing role (experience in Payments, Travel, or Fraud Prevention is a plus).
* Proven track record of identifying, building, and managing successful relationships with prospects, customers, and partners.
* Strong interest in the travel and airline industry and understanding of industry-specific challenges.
* Good understanding and discipline regarding sales pipeline management.
* Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills in English. Other languages are a plus.
* A proactive, self-motivated, and goal-oriented mindset, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* A willingness to learn and grow in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills with the ability to handle multiple accounts simultaneously.
* Ready to embody and exemplify our company’s values: Playing to win; Sense of Urgency to be Excellent; and Accountability and Cooperation.


**Benefits**
 Working with us means both laughter and colleagues who take their work very seriously. In short, we are a big team at a big company with the ambition to become the best on the global stage! In addition to working with an amazing group of people, you’ll also enjoy several great benefits as part of our team.
   

  

 Since this role can be based in multiple locations, the benefits package will vary depending on the candidate’s country of residence. You can expect:
   

  

* A competitive salary aligned with market standards
* Flexible working hours with hybrid or remote options, depending on location
* A comprehensive benefits package in line with local regulations


 At Etraveli Group we value diversity; we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds. During hiring, we are committed to ensure equality and promote diversity in the workplace at every selection stage. As such, we provide the same opportunities for all candidates regardless of race, religion or belief, gender, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, or any other characteristic protected under any anti-discrimination law or regulation.
   

  

 Welcome to Etraveli Group!

title: CRS Platform Owner & Business Analyst
description:
*We are Strawberry. With over 245 hotels, 120 restaurants, 20 spas and more, we create thousands of experiences every day. With urban Comfort Hotel®, warm Quality Hotel™, stylish Clarion Hotel® and cosy Home Hotel and more than 40 unique independent hotels, our guests can pick and choose. Our team of 20,000 passionate individuals from more than 120 countries is what makes us grow! Strawberry is built on our core values: energy, courage and enthusiasm.*
 This role, will from the start, be a combined role where you will work both as our CRS platform owner & as a Business Analyst for the Group Applications department at Strawberry. For the potential future, this role might evolve to also take technical ownership of Synxis CRS (Sabre) & Channel manager system RateTiger (eRevmax)
   

  

 On the CRS part you will work closely with internal stakeholders to understand their requirements & needs towards our Central Reservation System “Choice Edge” - owned and developed by our franchiser Choice Hotels International (CHI) based in the US.
   

  

 Your most important stakeholders will be our Revenue department, Sales organisation, Distribution department, Solution architects and our Digital engineering department
   

  

 You will be the one writing, driving and securing technical & functional requirements towards CHI to secure that Strawberry can be competitive in the digital market. You will have technical ownership & responsibility towards CHI and you will lead joint initiatives & projects together with internal stakeholders towards CHI and the CRS area. You will gather and collect business requirements to be able to increase operational excellence and revenue income in our digital channels connected to the CRS.
   

  

 On the Business Analyst part you will work closely with our other platform owners within Group Applications and their stakeholders to review and analyze key business metrics to be able to propose improvements and present potential findings to both our platform owners and their key stakeholders within the organisation.
   

  

 Areas of responsibility for our platform owners are today:
   

  

* Finance Platform
* CRM & Loyalty Platform
* MarTech Platform
* HR Platform


 This role will give you an opportunity to be responsible for your own domain and drive development and innovation together with your stakeholders, at the same time you will also be able to work on your analytical skills by working cross functional within the Group Applications team helping the other platform owners with key insights on development & process improvements, this to be able to deliver on business strategic goals.
   

  

 You will report to Director of Group Applications & other Platform Owners
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
**CRS Platform:**
* Keep up to date with trends & technologies within the CRS domain
* Assist in negotiations with CRS vendor
* Lead, drive & plan meetings with CRS vendor
* Work closely with internal stakeholders to understand their business needs
* Have a clear overview of connected 3rd party channels and how they work from a technical standpoint.
* Secure timeline and delivery on new development items for both the functional & technical roadmap towards the CRS vendor
* Gather requirements from internal stakeholders such as Revenue, Distribution, Sales, Digital Engineering etc. align on priorities & write functional & technical requirement specifications
* Work closely with solution architects to set and secure the future architectural landscape for the CRS
* Initiate and oversee system improvements, development process, but leave the configuration, setup & rollout to others.


**Business Analyst:**
* Identify and communicate with key stakeholders
* Gather, review and analyze business processes & data, including KPIs & other key metrics using your analytical skills.
* Liaise between various business departments and stakeholders
* Assess options for process improvements, including business process modeling
* Create & update documentation regarding various projects, processes and business operations
* Collaborate with platform owners, project managers and cross-functional teams
* Build business cases and present to management.


**Qualifications and Skills:**
* Deep technical & functional knowledge around Central Reservation Systems (CRS´s) within the hospitality industry
* Experience in operational work within any CRS
* Experience from working with functional & technical requirement towards CRS vendors
* Technical understanding on how CRS´s communicate with online distribution channels, fulfillment systems & other related 3rd party channels/systems
* Proven success in stakeholder management
* Confidence and ability to communicate and influence key stakeholders to support proposed strategies, process improvements and operational decisions
* Technical skills & background in working with HR,- CRM & Loyalty,- MarTech & Finance platform systems
* Good problem solving skills
* Proficiency in Swedish and English
* Ability to work collaboratively in a diverse team environment.
* Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
* Experience in business analytics, gather business information and present insights
* Familiar with industry technologies to be able to gather & present relevant data


**NB!** 
 This role is to be based in Stockholm, Sweden

title: Product Owner - Identity & Personalization
description:
**Product Owner – Identity & Personalization**
**Electrolux Group:**
 At the Electrolux Group, a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.
   

  

 If your values align with following, we will get along! You will be part of a team that place the consumer at heart of everything and your deliveries will have a direct impact on the consumers experiences. Challenge and be challenged is encouraged and fast is better than slow while having trust and a safe space.
   

  

 Join us to create change and have an impact in homes around the world.
   

  

**The Organization and The Role:**
 The Consumer Direct Interaction - Experience Organization (CDI XO) consist of a Digital Commerce and Digital Post Purchase domain with several Product Areas. We are seeking an experienced and motivated Product Owner to join the Consumer Engagement Product Area, delivering cross domains, by setting the strategic direction based on CDI XO vision. The Consumer Engagement Product Area includes Identity & Personalization who is responsible for the
   

  

* Identity strategy that revolves around delivering great login and sign-up consumer experience globally while keeping standardization high and maintenance efficient, enabled by Agile and DevOps practices. The goal is to drive customer retention and satisfaction while managing information about the identity of users and user consent and is a crucial element in maintaining a persistent marketing technology landscape.
* Personalization strategy that revolves around personalizing the experiences in the different consumer touchpoints, such as websites and outbound communications, enabled by personalization tools with the use of consumer data. The goal is to be relevant for the consumer to build loyalty and drive conversion.


**Who you are:**
* Curious and analytical with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to make informed decisions in a fast-paced environment.
* 3+ years of experience in product management, IT consulting or management consulting.
* Extensive knowledge and understanding of consumer data, identity management and personalization concepts, including technology trends and consumer expectation trends. Ideally experienced with platforms: SAP CDC, Dynamic Yield and BlueConic.
* Broad skillset within stakeholder management, technology, consumer data, and user experience design.
* Exposure to agile methodologies and product management tools (e.g. Jira, Confluence).
* Demonstrated ability to take ownership, lead initiatives, and deliver results.
* Bachelor's degree in information technology, business & economics, computer science, or similar field is a plus.


**Where you’ll be:**
 This is a full-time position, based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**Benefits include:**
* Flexible working hours/hybrid work environment.
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services.
* Family-and-friends discounts and benefits such as parental leave top-up.
* Insurance policy plan.
* Learning opportunities and flexible career path.


**Find out more on:**
 Electrolux Group: https://www.linkedin.com/company/electrolux/life/lifeatelectrolux

title: Process Improvement Manager
description:
**Är du vår nya affärsorienterade Manager för Process & Innovation?** 




  





  





**Som ett marknadsledande kredithanteringsföretag har Intrum en bred kompetens inom inkassotjänster och vi gör affärer i 20 länder i Europa. Vi har mer än 10 000 erfarna medarbetare i vår grupp** 




  





 Vår verksamhet handlar om att hjälpa andra. Hjälpa skuldsatta individer att ta sig ur svåra situationer. Hjälpa företag att få betalt så att de kan växa, anställa och blomstra. Vilket i sin tur är positivt för hela ekonomin. Du blir en väsentlig del av denna krets hos oss, vilket ger ditt jobb på Intrum en djupare mening. Oavsett din roll eller titel.
 



  





**Att ligga i framkant är allas jobb** 




 Som marknadsledare är det upp till oss att ligga i framkant. Att forma branschen. Att sätta nya standarder. Och vart än i världen din Intrum-karriärväg tar dig, vilken roll du än spelar, kommer du att bidra till tillväxt, innovation och inverkan som gör verklig skillnad.
 



  





**Rollen** 




 Rollen kommer att rapportera till Operations Director Sverige och ha ett nära samarbete med övriga avdelningar inom Operations liksom andra funktioner såsom IT, Sales och Commercial. Plats för denna position: Stockholm eller Göteborg
 


* Du har ett övergripande ansvar för företagets processer och att de innehåller innovativa lösningar med ny teknologi
* Du blir en nyckelperson för att utveckla teamet och verksamheten både på en operativ och strategiskt nivå och har personal-, budget- och lönsamhetsansvar
* Vi är i en spännande fas där många förbättringsprojekt pågår – både på lokal och global nivå – för att säkra vår position som marknadsledare även i framtiden
* Du kommer spela en viktig roll i detta förändringsarbete och att skapa morgondagens erbjudande
* För att trivas och vara lyckosam i rollen ska du vara en person med starkt eget driv som trivs med att snabbt skifta mellan operativa och strategiska frågor och att arbeta i ett högt tempo


- 


  





**Ditt huvudansvar blir att:** 



* Ansvara för att säkerställa effektiva processer för vår verksamhet
* Leda och fördela det dagliga arbetet i teamet
* Utveckla dina medansvariga som du har fullt personalansvar för
* I nära samarbete med andra funktioner utveckla vår affär, vårt erbjudandet och våra processer
* Arbeta proaktivt, driva förändringsarbete samt ökad effektivitet
* Säkerställa god lönsamhet och nyckeltal och vid behov vidta korrigerande åtgärder



  





  





**Dina kvalifikationer** 




**Vi tror att du har:** 



* En relevant universitetsexamen, gärna en magisterexamen
* Flerårig erfarenhet från senior chefsroll med budgetansvar
* Flerårig erfarenhet att arbeta i ledningsgrupp på strategisk nivå
* God erfarenhet av att arbeta med processer
* Har passion för att utveckla individer och arbetssätt
* Tycker om att arbeta med såväl operativa som strategiska frågor
* Är en relationsskapande person som trivs med- och har lätt för att samarbeta med olika typer av personer och funktioner
* Har en känsla för att finna innovativa lösningar med ny teknologi
* Goda kommunikationsförmågor, skriftligt och muntligt på svenska och engelska
* Vi förväntar oss att alla våra sökande har en ordnad ekonomi
* Tidigare erfarenhet av inkasso och tekniska processlösningar är starkt meriterande








**Vem är du** 




 Vi på Intrum vill bidra till ett inkluderande och mångsidigt arbetsliv. Vi accepterar våra olikheter och vet att detta är en styrka. Vi vet att vi alla är en resurs för samhället, oavsett ålder, funktionsförmåga, kön, religion, etnicitet eller sexuell läggning. Därför uppmanar vi alla att söka jobb hos oss.
 **Kom som du är.** 




  





  





**Du agerar enligt våra värderingar. Våra värderingar är inte ord. De är allt.** 




 Bakom vår globala expansion och stora digitala transformation ligger fyra enkla men kraftfulla värden. Etik. Hängivenhet. Lösningar. Empati. Det är värderingarna som driver vår vardag, oavsett hur stora vi blir. Andra kanske tycker att de är små saker. Men för oss, är de allt.
 



  





**Som chef kan du känna igen dig i våra ledarskapsprinciper** 



* **Du bygger förtroende.** 
 Vi strävar efter att bli betrodda och respekterade av alla som ger och tar emot krediter. Förtroende byggs inifrån organisationen och gör det möjligt för team att vara samarbetsvilliga, kreativa och flexibla. Detta är nyckeln till att driva prestanda.
* 
* **Du skapar klarhet.** 
 Vi har en ambitiös strategi och höga förväntningar på att hållbart leverera resultat. Det är därför vi behöver ledare som skapar tydlighet och högpresterande team.
* 
* **Du leder förändring.** 
 Vi leder vägen till en sund ekonomi. För att göra det, måste vi ständigt transformera oss genom att ständigt anamma förändring. Det är därför vi behöver ledare som kan leda och stimulera denna förändring.
* 
* **Du möjliggör tillväxt.** 
 Vi verkar i en ständigt föränderlig värld. Kontinuerligt lärande är nyckeln till att skapa motiverade och högpresterande team. Vi tror att alla kan utveckla sin talang, men det måste drivas av individen.








**Är du nyfiken och har frågor?** 




 Du är välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef för mer information om tjänsten: Operations Manager SE, Anna-Karin Gustafsson, anna-karin.gustafsson@intrum.com. Kontakta den primära rekryteraren, HR Business Partner, Maja Fransson, maja.fransson@intrum.com för mer information om ansökningsprocessen.
 



  





 Endast ansökningar som tas emot via vårt onlinesystem kommer att beaktas. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande.

title: Nordic Operations Excellence Manager
description:
**About The Opportunity**
**Are you ready to drive operational excellence in the Nordics’ fastest-growing dark store business? We’re looking for a hands-on problem solver with sharp people skills and a passion for continuous improvement. As our Nordic Operations Excellence Manager, you’ll be on the ground where the magic happens—identifying opportunities, implementing routines, and ensuring real impact. Working closely with both local and regional teams, you’ll play a key role in shaping the future of our operations. If you thrive in a fast-paced, global environment and love making things better every day, this is your chance to join the ride!**
**Your Mission**
* Identify areas of operational improvement for our dark stores, solve and own this process to the end
* Operations project lead for all new and existing operational improvement projects
* Nordic POC on product topics, overseeing and creating tickets on bugs
* Creating training materials for our staff in our Sana training portal
* Be a role model and a natural enforcer of foodora values and culture


 We are looking for a true foodorian who enjoys working in a fast paced environment and dares to go further. To thrive in this role we believe that you have strong
 **problem- solving abilities** 
 and enjoy taking on new challenges. If you also have a
 **hands- on** 
 approach you will come far in this role! Since you will be in contact with many different internal and external stakeholders, your
 **communication** 
 skills will be crucial to achieve results.
   

  

 Our selection process is continuous and the ad may close before the recruitment process is completed, if we’ve moved forward to the screening or interview phase.
   

  

 Our recruitment process will include the following:
   

  

 📞 Telephone interview - Let’s cover the basics!
   

  

 💡 Psychometric tests via Alva Labs - We use science-based methodology.
   

  

 🤝 First interview - Time to know each other a bit better!
   

  

 💼 Case interview - Do your magic and show us your skills!
   

  

 ✔️ Reference- & background check - Final step before we’ll become colleagues.
   

  

 Start date: Upon agreement
   

  

**What you need to be successful**
* High executional performance
* Both operational and technical background is an advantage, hands on mentality is a must
* Experience in project lead
* Meticulous with an eye for details
* Good English skills in speech and writing, as well as fluent in Swedish, both in speech and writing


**Note: This position requires flexibility and frequent traveling in Sweden and Norway**
 Studies have shown that women and some minorities are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every qualification. If you are interested in this role and you have most of the skills we’re looking for, we encourage you to apply anyway!
   

  

**Who we are**
 foodora is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience—fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide. Headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index.
   

  

**What's in it for you**
* Wellness allowance topped with the opportunity to participate in many work/life balance initiatives at foodora such as reduced price on massage.
* Employee discount at foodora (woho!) and awesome friday breakfasts!
* Occupational pension, incl. premium exemption insurance, accident insurance and life insurance.
* foodora Learning - Monthly learning sessions about different topics, such as the q-commerce industry, negotiation techniques and project management combined with a structured onboarding and inspiring courses within our learning tool Sana
* Great deals at Benify (for e.g. gym membership, e-bikes hotels, audiobooks, streaming services, clothes, kitchen supplies… and so much more!
* Awesome AW’s and (pink) parties!

title: Strategic Transformation Associate – Structural Cost PMO
description:
Are you interested in driving Swedbank’s continued transformation by taking a leading role in key initiatives?
   

  

* The financial industry is facing disruptive changes in terms of technology, innovation, and fierce competition. Consequently, it has become even more important for Swedbank to strengthen our foundation by transforming ourselves into the next generation bank. Therefore, the Swedbank Group Strategy explicitly states the importance of transformation the upcoming years to reach our Strategic Direction.
* To drive Swedbank’s group transformation, Structural Cost PMO plays a key role. Structural Cost PMO acts as internal management consultants, leveraging the consultancy toolbox to deliver exceptional results in terms of increasing Swedbank’s overall profitability. This could include taking the role as project/program managers in initiatives within the categories company structure, process efficiency or sourcing/outsourcing with the ambition to increase achieve tangible bottom-line P&L results. To continue doing this, we are now seeking a new talent to strengthen our small team of ambitious professionals.


 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Be part of a small team that will invest in your development, gain immediate visibility with Swedbank’s top management and play an active role in Swedbank’s most interesting initiatives across the entire group, e.g.:
+ Personalized onboarding throughout your first years at Swedbank, ensuring that you can deliver and develop in Swedbank’s complex environment
+ Dedicated and close coaching to ensure you develop further and deliver the top-notch results we strive for
+ Be empowered to take responsibility for deliverables and key initiatives of strategic importance across all parts of the bank and get recognized for your contributions right from the start


  

  

* Utilize the management consultancy toolbox and an ambitious mind-set to support and drive Swedbank’s transformation to increase profitability and accelerate operational efficiency, e.g.:
+ Act as program/project manager in structural cost initiatives
+ Initiate programs/projects including suggesting scope, suitable setup and workstreams, and required cross functional team resources and expertise
+ Build fact base foundation to create a common understanding of current way of working, establishing baseline and business cases, identify improvement potentials and conduct market analysis
+ Follow-up status and progression of multiple workstreams and cross-functional teams to reach common objectives and targets
+ Lead change management involving many stakeholders across large parts of the Swedbank organization
+ Prepare implementation of new solutions and transformations related to initiatives within company structure, process efficiency and/or sourcing/outsourcing


  

  

* Participate in driving the optimization of Swedbank’s outsourcing/insourcing set-up and transformation plans, e.g.:
+ Map outsourcing/insourcing opportunities to suggest and develop strategies and plans (what to do differently) based on facts
+ Build, develop and maintain outsourcing/insourcing and transformation plans to increase operational efficiency
+ Proactively suggest and realize improvements and amendments to the bank’s strategies and transformation plans


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

- Two to three years’ experience within one the following areas:

* Experience from advanced and complex analytical work e.g., management consultancy at top tier firm or similar
* Experience from business development and/or driving change/improvements from start to end
* Educational degree – Master’s degree in Engineering/Science (and preferably a second degree in Business, Economics or similar)
* Fully fluent in written and oral English
* Genuine interest in technology (Swedbank’s transformation always has an element of IT into it)
* Advanced user of the consultancy toolbox, e.g. presentations and analysis
