title: iOS Developer • Product Library
company_industry: Software Development, Financial Services, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**The Company**
 PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.
   

  

 We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.
   

  

 We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.
   

  

 Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.
   

  

**Job Description Summary:**
 As PayPal continues its mission to revolutionize commerce, we are looking for a passionate iOS Developer with an agile mindset to join one of our teams at the forefront of shaping innovative solutions and creating modern digital products that have a positive impact on people's lives across our organization and beyond. If this sounds exciting, keep reading – the best is yet to come!
   

  

**Job Description:**
 PayPal in Sweden originated from Zettle, focusing on commerce services targeting small and medium businesses, and is now expanding to contribute to the wider PayPal portfolio.
   

  

**Meet Your Team**
 Our Product Library Team's mission is to create a scalable and reliable catalog service that serves the entire PayPal ecosystem, delivering seamless solutions to help businesses grow. If you’re passionate about solving complex challenges, working on high-impact projects, and driving innovation, our team is the perfect fit for you.
   

  

**Your way to Impact**
 As an iOS Developer with us, you’ll be part of a diverse team focused on building and enhancing the Zettle experience. Taking ownership of designing and implementing key features, you'll work independently while collaborating closely with mobile and backend engineers across the organization to ensure sustainable product development through strong engineering practices.
   

  

**Your day to day**
* Collaborate regularly with iOS, Android, and Backend engineers to understand and address technical challenges.
* Develop native iOS apps by transforming ideas, designs, and requirements into stable, production-ready builds.
* Create reusable frameworks, interfaces, and services that can be easily extended for future needs.
* Promote clean code practices and ensure high coding standards through thoughtful code reviews.
* Mentor and influence peers both within your team and across Zettle/PayPal.
* Work as part of a cross-functional team to deliver products on time that solve real customer problems.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams and QA to resolve bugs and ensure product quality.
* Adhere to industry standards, technical processes, and best practices across the organization.


**What You Need To Succeed**
* Solid experience in iOS native development with Swift and Objective-C, and familiarity with open-source and commercial iOS libraries.
* Proven problem-solving skills, a proactive attitude, and the ability to take ownership while collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams.
* Experience developing, maintaining, and enhancing medium to large-scale mobile apps, with a deep understanding of iOS memory management, performance, and design patterns (e.g., MVVM, Protocol-Oriented Programming).
* Proficiency in working with REST-based services, multi-threaded asynchronous code, and familiarity with frameworks like RxSwift, Combine, or SwiftUI is a plus.
* Skilled in writing clean, maintainable code, unit/automation tests, and experienced with CI/CD pipelines and tools like Jenkins or Fastlane.


**We Believe in You**
 Interested? Don't hesitate to apply or/and let's talk – we'd love to get to know you!
   

  

 For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.
   

  

**Our Benefits:**
 At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.
   

  

 We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com
   

  

**Who We Are:**
 To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx
   

  

**Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.
   

  

**Belonging at PayPal:**
 Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.
   

  

 Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.
   

  

 We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to apply.
   

  

 REQ ID R0123954

title: Senior Site Reliability / Gitops Engineer
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a
 **Senior Site Reliability / Gitops Engineer** 
 to our Information Systems (IS) team. This role is an opportunity for an "automation-first" senior technologist with a passion for Linux to build a career with Canonical and drive the success with those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have experience of IT operations automation, Infrastructure as Code and a passion for technology, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 The IS team at Canonical supports and maintains all of Canonical's IT production services. The team is in charge of running services used by over 60 million Ubuntu users.
   

  

 As an Senior SRE & Gitops engineer you'll be in a unique position to drive operations automation to the next level, both in our own private clouds as well as in the public clouds. We do this by utilizing the best of open source infrastructure as code software, software development practices such as CI/CD pipelines, and Canonical's leading products for software operation automation.
   

  

 In addition to defining the infrastructure as code, you will improve Canonical products and the open-source technologies they're based on by providing critical feedback to developers on how their products operate at scale. This is done by submitting bugs (and sometimes writing pull requests) and collaborating on design and implementations with other teams within the company.
   

  

 You'll be part of a global team of SREs that work together and support each other to provide the best possible services to our company, Canonical's customers and the Ubuntu Community.
   

  

**As a Senior Site Reliability / Gitops Engineer you will**
* Drive the development of automation, Gitops in your team as an embedded tech lead
* Closely collaborate with the IS architect to align your solutions with the IS architecture vision
* Design and architect services that IS can offer to the organization as products
* Apply your experience of IaC to develop infrastructure as code practice within IS by constantly increasing automation and improving IaC processes
* Automate software operations for re-usability and consistency across private and public clouds, taking into consideration the complexities of distributed systems
* Maintain operational responsibility for all of Canonical's core services, networks, and infrastructure
* Develop skills in troubleshooting, capacity planning, and performance investigation, Setting up, maintaining and using observability tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, and Elasticsearch; design, implement and maintain monitoring and alerting for various systems and services
* Provide assistance and work with globally distributed engineering, operations, and support peers
* Be given uninterrupted development time to focus on larger projects and automation of manual tasks
* Share your experience, know-how and best practices with other team members in design sessions, mentorship and 'doing work together'
* Carry final responsibility for time-critical escalations


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* A modern view on hosting architecture, driven by infrastructure as code across both private and public clouds.
* A product mindset thriving to develop products rather than solutions.
* Python software development experience, with large projects
* Experience working with Kubernetes or other container orchestration systems.
* Proven exposure to manage and deploy cloud infrastructure with code.
* Practical knowledge of Linux networking, routing, and firewalls
* Affinity with various forms of Linux storage, from Ceph to Databases
* Hands-on experience administering enterprise Linux servers
* Extensive knowledge of cloud computing concepts and technologies
* Bachelor's degree or greater, preferably in computer science or related engineering field
* Able to communicate clearly and effectively in English over email, chat, video or voice calls and in-person
* Motivated and able to troubleshoot from kernel to web, and willing to ask others when appropriate
* A willingness to be flexible and able to learn new things quickly
* Be inspired by the needs of fast-changing environments
* Happy to work within distributed teams
* Be passionate and familiarized about open-source, especially Ubuntu or Debian


 What we offer colleagues
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Sr. Enterprise Account Manager, AWS Enterprise Sales
description:
**Description**
 Would you like to be part of a talented team of experienced technical sales professionals focused on working with some of Sweden's largest Enterprises as they transform their business? As an Amazon Web Services (AWS) Senior Enterprise Account Manager, you will have the exciting opportunity of driving digital transformation across the strategic accounts you manage, promoting the entire AWS products and services portfolio.
   

  

 AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology, and unwavering support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud. Join us and help us grow.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As an AWS Senior Enterprise Account Manager, you are driving digital transformations through effective engagement with C-level executives, business development executives, IT leaders, architects, developers, and various lines of businesses. You are establishing AWS as the key cloud technology provider across the strategic accounts you manage, promoting the entire AWS products and services portfolio to Enterprise Customers.
   

  

 On a daily basis you empower your customers to solve challenges while attaining both their operational and innovation goals. You deliver business outcomes while guiding them to become more agile, innovative, and efficient. With AWS, our customers benefit from the fastest pace of innovation, the broadest and deepest functionality, the most secure computing environment, and the most proven operational expertise.
   

  

 Do you look around corners for ways to engage and service customers? Are you passionate about using technology to solve business problems that have big customer impact?
   

  

 Come build the future with us.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience as a quota carrying technology enterprise field sales or business development account manager, including complex account management
* The ideal candidate will have experience developing relationships across industry verticals, including: Financial Services Industry (FSI), Manufacturing, Media & Entertainment and/or Retail/CPG.
* Experience increasing technology adoption and creating long term transformational account strategies
* Demonstrated success in identifying, developing, negotiating, and closing large-scale technology projects to Enterprise Customers, including working with and presenting to C-level executives, IT, and other lines of business
* University degree or a technical background in business, engineering, or computer science, BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience


**Preferred Qualifications**
* 10 years+ of technology field sales or business development experience, ideally selling cloud solutions
* Experience developing long term customer relationships, with multiple lines of business, including senior CxO stakeholders
* Active listener and effective communicator with demonstrated success in effective deal closing skills on large, complex deals
* Extensive working knowledge with CRMs (e.g. Salesforce), forecasting, account plan creation and ownership
* Demonstrated success in identifying, developing, negotiating, and closing large-scale technology projects to Enterprise customers
* A passionate, self-starter, ready to take AWS Sweden Enterprise customer experience to the next level


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A2896449

title: Projektledare inom produktion | Stockholm
description:
*Gillar du teknik och ledarskap? Utveckla din expertis hos oss på Chief och skapa något unikt inom ledarskap och konsultverksamhet!* 
*Som konsult hos Chief är du vårt ansikte utåt och levererar värde till våra många kunder. Här får du möjligheten att kombinera ditt teknikintresse med dina ledarskapsförmågor!*
**Rollen som konsult**
 Som
 **projektledare** 
 har du en central roll med överblick över projektet, resurserna och budgeten. Du har förståelse för tekniken och samarbetar med människorna i projektet för att tillsammans nå uppsatta mål. Du är ansvarsfull och har erfarenhet av att arbeta med projektledning och produktionsmiljöer.
   

  

 Dina arbetsdagar kommer att bestå av allt från ledning och organisering till att säkerställa att projektet genomförs enligt gällande standarder, kvalitet, tidsplan och budget.
   

  

 Vi arbetar brett inom
 **olika branscher, och du kan förvänta dig en roll inom försvar, automotive, energi eller medtech** 
 , med projekt inom hållbar energi, fordonsindustrin, IT och industri.
   

  

 Vi banar också väg för din personliga utveckling genom mentorskapsprogram, utbildningar och individuell coaching, och vi lägger stor vikt vid vem du är och vilka mål du har.
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
 Vi söker dig som är ansvarstagande, bra på att samordna och leda. Du trivs med att arbeta tillsammans med människor och har god kommunikationsförmåga.
   

  

 Du är
 **ingenjör** 
 i grunden och därmed en problemlösare. Du har ett
 **starkt driv** 
 och erfarenhet av att arbeta i produktionsmiljö. Du är en teamspelare som är lätt att samarbeta med.
   

  

 Du har ett
 **tekniskt intresse** 
 och förstår hur man får människor att arbeta mot gemensamma mål. Dina vänner beskriver dig som social och engagerad.
   

  

**Vi Ser Att Du**
* Har en ingenjörsexamen.
* Har 3-10 års erfarenhet
* Har tidigare erfarenhet från projketledning/koordinering inom produktion.
* Talar och skriver obehindrat på både svenska och engelska.


**Vilka är Chief?**
 Vi Är Ett Entreprenörsdrivet Konsultbolag Med Fokus På Teknik Och Ledarskap – Oavsett Bransch. Vi Erbjuder Dig Ett Familjärt Sammanhang Där Fokus Ligger På
   

  

* Valfrihet & anpassning: Som ett personligt bolag anpassar vi oss efter dig som individ, i allt från anställningserbjudande till din framtida karriärutveckling. Vi erbjuder skräddarsydda utbildningar och certifieringar samt tre olika förmånspaket där vi anpassar förmåner och lön efter just din livssituation.
* Gemenskap & utveckling: Personlig- och ledarskapsutveckling i form av mentorskapsprogram, Chief Academy samt andra spännande interna initiativ.


**Tror du att vi är en bra match?** 
**🤝**
 Skicka in din ansökan med CV och personligt brev, eller något annat innovativt som uppfyller samma syfte. Intervjuer och återkoppling sker löpande så skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om Chief och rollen så kontakta gärna mig så berättar jag mer!
   

  

 Sasha Schagerström, BUM
   

  

 Mail: Sasha.Schagerström@chief.se
   

  

 0736329308

title: Testledare med erfarenhet av testautomation
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vill du vara med och utveckla system för en samhällsviktig verksamhet? CGI i Stockholm behöver vi förstärka med en testledare med erfarenhet av testautomation till ett av våra team. Har du flera års erfarenhet inom IT-branschen och vill vara med och förbättra samhället vi lever i? Då tycker vi att du ska söka dig till oss! På CGI får du möjlighet att utvecklas i dina befintliga kompetenser men ges även möjlighet att prova på nya utmaningar.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som testledare kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i att säkerställa kvaliteten i våra kunders system och tjänster. Du kommer att ansvara för att planera, leda och följa upp testaktiviteter i nära samarbete med utvecklingsteam, projektledare och andra intressenter. Rollen innebär även att driva arbetet med testautomation för att effektivisera och kvalitetssäkra testprocesserna.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi försöker framför allt finna dig som uppskattar att dela med dig av din kunskap, är ödmjuk och enkel att samarbeta med och som värdesätter teamwork. Vi hoppas och tror att du respekterar och värdesätter dina kollegor samt äger förmågan att vid behov själv hitta kreativa och smarta lösningar på problem.Vi söker dig som har minst fem års erfarenhet av arbete inom testledning/testautomatisering. Du behöver ha en god förståelse för systemutveckling och utvecklingsprojekt inom IT och har kommit i kontakt med någon form av testverktyg.Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att arbeta som testledare i komplexa projekt.
* God kunskap inom testautomation och verktyg.
* Grundläggande förståelse för systemutveckling och kodgranskning.
* Erfarenhet av testmetodik och kvalitetssäkring i agil utveckling.
* Förståelse för och erfarenhet av att arbeta inom offentlig sektor är meriterande.
* Certifiering inom testning, exempelvis ISTQB


 Du kan obehindrat svenska i tal och skrift. För den här rollen tillkommer även bakgrundskontroller.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer?
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! Ansökningarna kommer hanteras löpande. Skicka gärna dina funderingar till Lena.Lundgren@cgi.com.
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Compensation & Benefits Specialist
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 We are looking for an experienced
 **Compensation & Benefits Specialist** 
 who wants to work strategically and operationally with compensation matters, salary processes, and benefits strategies. In this role, you will play a key part in developing and implementing competitive compensation solutions to attract and retain talent within the organization.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Salary Review & Compensation Strategy – Plan and execute salary reviews and analyze compensation levels.
* Benefits Strategy & Benchmarking – Evaluate and develop benefits programs based on market best practices.
* Union Relations & Collective Agreements – Participate in negotiations and ensure compensation packages comply with current agreements and regulations.
* Data Analysis & Reporting – Analyze compensation data, salary trends, and benefits packages to support strategic decisions.
* HR Systems & Process Improvement – Ensure efficient systems and processes within Compensation & Benefits.


**Who You Are**
* Has at least 5 years of experience in Compensation & Benefits.
* Is experienced in working with salary reviews and union negotiations.
* Possesses strong analytical skills and experience working with HR data and benchmarking.
* Has experience with collective agreements and labor law issues related to compensation.
* Has worked with Teknikavtalet or has knowledge of industry-specific agreements.
* Is a team player with strong communication skills and a business-oriented mindset.


**This Is Us**
 If you are passionate about labour law and ready to take on a challenging and rewarding role, we would love to hear from you!
   

  

 You will be part of Corporate HR’s Labour Law & Compensation & Benefits team, a specialized group that combines legal expertise with compensation strategies to support key business decisions.
   

  

 Our team is uniquely positioned close to senior decision-makers, where we proactively drive legal and compensation strategies that align with both business needs and employee relations. We work cross-functionally, supporting each other across different responsibilities – whether it’s handling union negotiations, advising on complex employment law cases, or developing compensation models.
   

  

 We believe in collaboration, knowledge-sharing, and practical solutions to ensure a strong and compliant workplace environment. If you thrive in a dynamic setting where you can make a real impact, you’ll fit right in with us
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible but no later than April 8th. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Oscar Ericsson
   

  

 Group Manager: oscar.ericsson@scania.com
   

  

 If you are passionate about labour law and ready to take on a challenging and rewarding role, we would love to hear from you!
 **We look forward to your application!**

title: Software Manager - Sensor Core Applications
description:
Are you passionate about leading teams and developing cutting-edge software for world-class radar solutions? Do you thrive in an inclusive, innovative environment where your leadership can make a real impact? At Saab, we believe in fostering a supportive workplace where diverse perspectives drive success. If you’re ready to grow as a leader while contributing to a safer society, this could be the perfect opportunity for you.


Your Role


As Software Manager for the Sensor Core Application software section, you will lead skilled engineers in embedded software development and signal processing. Our teams work in agile, product-focused groups where collaboration and decentralized decision-making are key to achieving speed and quality. Your role will include both technical and strategic leadership, ensuring our software solutions meet the highest standards for mission-critical applications.


Key responsibilities:

* Drive technical excellence in software engineering, ensuring high-quality solutions.
* Lead and support your teams, fostering a culture of collaboration and continuous learning.
* Own the design responsibility for Sensor Core signal and data processing software.
* Implement DevOps best practices tailored for embedded and mission-critical software.
* Collaborate closely with internal and external stakeholders.
* Oversee recruitment, budgeting, and strategic growth within your section.


Your Profile


We are looking for a leader who believes in empowering teams and driving innovation. You are passionate about technology and thrive in an environment that values collaboration, learning, and inclusion.


Your experience and skills:

* 5+ years of professional experience in software development.
* 3+ years of leadership experience, with a strong interest in coaching and developing people.
* A solid background in modern software engineering practices and experience of agile methodologies.
* Strong business acumen and a customer-focused mindset.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to engage and inspire.
* Relevant academic qualifications or equivalent experience.

*This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.*


What you will be a part of


Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.


Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.


Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 25,500 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.


Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here


If you are interested in what benefits you can take part of as an employee at Saab in Sweden, you can read more about them here

*Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement.*
company_description: Saab serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions from military defense to civil security.

title: Systems Engineer
description:
Join Telavox as a Systems Engineer
  
We are looking for a Systems Engineer to join our Infrastructure Engineering team. This is an exciting opportunity for someone passionate about infrastructure who enjoys collaborating with diverse teams and is eager to contribute to a fast-growing, innovative company in the telecom industry. We'd love to hear from you if you’re excited about designing scalable solutions, implementing cloud-native technologies, and driving automation in infrastructure operations!
  
About the job
  
As a Systems Engineer at Telavox, you will be a vital part of our infrastructure team, responsible for transforming abstract requirements into robust, automated solutions using modern DevOps practices. You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure high-quality infrastructure solutions that support our global communication services.
  
  

**A typical day in this role involves:**  

Improving scalability, security, and accessibility of our platform, focusing on virtualization, container environments, storage, and automation.
  
  

Building and improving developer-facing APIs for on-prem hardware resources to enhance self-sufficiency for application teams.
  
  

Developing and refining monitoring and tooling to ensure high reliability and efficient maintenance.
  
  

Collecting requirements and feedback from colleagues across teams to build the best possible solutions.
  
  

Identifying challenges and proposing strategic solutions to improve infrastructure efficiency and effectiveness.
  
  

This role is based in our Malmö office, where you’ll join a collaborative work environment with opportunities to influence our infrastructure engineering practices.
  
About you
  
To thrive in our team, we value your 5+ years of experience in a similar role with experience in infrastructure engineering, cloud-native technologies, and automation. You thrive in a technical role, have a strong grasp of infrastructure principles, and are dedicated to delivering exceptional results.
  
  

**Competencies:**  

Experience with Linux, Kubernetes, on-prem Ceph, container technologies, and virtualization
  
  

Proficiency in compute, storage, and networking intricacies
  
  

Understanding of cloud-native architecture concepts such as microservices, event-driven architecture, and observability
  
  

Strong background in software development and automation
  
  

Passion for learning, sharing, and engaging in insightful discussions
  
  

**Good-to-have skills:**  

Experience in telecom or voice streaming is a plus
  
  

Relevant certifications in cloud or infrastructure technologies are a plus, but not mandatory
  
  

Experience setting up and managing on-prem Kubernetes clusters
  
  

You’ll fit right in with a collaborative mindset, a passion for technology, and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
  
Join us at Telavox
  
Since Telavox's journey started in 2002, we have strengthened our position as the leading forward-thinking communication platform for businesses. As a digital mobile operator, we develop and own our all-in-one communication platform, which integrates telephony, PBX, messaging, meetings, and contact centers, giving businesses a smarter way to connect. Today, we’re a thriving company with 1.9 billion SEK in revenue and 500+ Telavoxers across nine countries. We embrace AI and automation to push the boundaries of business communication. We offer flexible work options and adaptable hours, giving you the freedom to balance life and career while staying connected to our vibrant Telavox culture.
  
How to apply! At Telavox, we don't focus on fitting in; we focus on making room for everyone. We’re always on the lookout for great talent, so applications are reviewed continuously. If you're ready to be part of an innovative, AI-driven telecom company, apply today with your CV and cover letter in English.
  
For any questions, feel free to reach out to Talent Acquisition Partner Ami Faraguna at ann-marie.faraguna@telavox.com or Engineering Manager Emil Nilsson at emil.nilsson@telavox.com
  
Learn more about what we do!

title: Business Analyst - Requirements and test manager
description:
Main tasks
  
To produce and document requirements for InLane together with relevant stakeholders.
  
Work in close collaboration with developers and other people within the project to ensure that developed requirements are realizable at a reasonable cost.
  
Ensure that developed requirements maintain a sufficiently high level of quality, which implies that it should be possible to start the implementation based on these.
  
Participate in tests (functional, regression and system tests) by creating test cases as well as performing verifications and logging test results.
  
Participate actively in acceptance tests with relevant stakeholders.
  
Participate in daily stand-up meetings together with other project members.
  
Participate in sprint planning with other project members.
  
Production of user documentation and possibly also training material and possibly carrying out training courses.
  
The work will be done in close collaboration with other business analysts, developers and testers.
  
  

Skills
  
We are assuming that the applicant has the following competencies and areas of experience to be able to perform the work in question:
  
Experience as business analyst for IT systems.
  
Experience from software testing and quality verification.
  
Experiences in producing and managing test cases and test plans.
  
Is accurate and has a genuine interest in requirements as well as in quality assurance.
  
Good understanding of software development and its related activities.
  
Accustomed to working independently and taking own initiative to ensure that progress is made in accordance with set time schedules.
  
Well-developed communication skills and finds it easy to collaborate.
  
Be able to express oneself well orally and in writing in Swedish as the work will also include the production of user documentation and possibly training of new users of the system.
  
Experience of Document Management systems is meritorious.
  
Experience of agile working methods is advantageous, as the project works SCRUM-based to some extent.
  
Experience of Azure DevOps or similar requirements/test case/issue reporting tools is desirable.
  
Familiar with Word and Excel
  
  

Assignment scope
  
The assignment consists of working within the BADA project with requirements management, testing and to a certain extent also producing user documentation.
  
  

Surely this sounds like an exciting mission?
  
Apply today and we'll tell you more. We need an application including a CV that matches our client's wishes. Selection and interviews take place continuously, so do not wait with your application as we need to supplement with more information and the tender period is short.
  
  

NXT Interim and NXT Rekrytering is a niche and innovative company that operates in the consulting and recruitment industry. We are active in HR, Business, IT, Marketing and Sale and have 20 years of experience in the industry. We offer our consultants, among other things, health insurance, remote workplaces and several other benefits that brighten their everyday life. For project employment, we apply collective agreements.

title: Project leader
description:
Vi söker en erfaren projektledare för ett integrationsprojekt där du kommer att leda utvecklingen av en standardiserad integrationslösning för att ansluta flera HRPlus-system mellan olika samhällen. Målet är att säkerställa att alla identifierade dataobjekt (t.ex. Anställningsdata, Löneuppgifter, Tidsdata, Finansiell data) blir tillgängliga för andra applikationer i standardiserade format (t.ex. API, meddelanden, filer). Projektet ska också möjliggöra att andra applikationer kan uppdatera HRPlus-data genom denna integrationslager.
  
Projektledaren kommer att ha ansvar för att leda 1-2 utvecklare som arbetar med HRPlus-integrationsutvecklingen. Omfattningen av projektet inkluderar att implementera grundläggande processer, rutiner och systemstöd för alla anställdas, linjekonsulters och resurskonsulters identiteter samt systemkonton, administrativa konton och resurskonton mellan systemen och lösningarna.
  
  

**Krav på kompetenser:****Projektledningskompetens:**  

Bevisad erfarenhet av att leda komplexa IT-projekt med flera intressenter.
  
Projektledarcertifiering (t.ex. PMP, PRINCE2) är meriterande.
  
  

**Tekniska färdigheter:**  

**Stark förståelse för IT-integrationslösningar, inklusive API:** er, händelsestyrda och meddelandebaserade arkitekturer.
  
Erfarenhet av lågt-kod/no-kod-plattformar är en fördel.
  
  

**Projekt- och riskhantering:**  

Stark organisatorisk förmåga att hantera budgetar, tidsramar och resurser.
  
Erfarenhet av att använda projektledningsverktyg (t.ex. Jira, Azure DevOps) och samarbetsplattformar (t.ex. Microsoft Teams, SharePoint).
  
Expertkunskaper i riskidentifiering, bedömning och riskhantering.
  
  

**Branschspecifik erfarenhet:**  

IT-erfarenhet från miljöer med hög transaktionsvolym (t.ex. detaljhandel).
  
Kännedom om outsourcade IT-leveransmodeller och samarbete med outsourcingpartners.
  
Erfarenhet av att genomföra organisatoriska förändringar och främja nya arbetsmetoder.
  
Kunskap om HR-processer och system är meriterande.
  
  

**Önskvärda personliga egenskaper:**  

Samarbetsinriktad ledare med starka beslutsförmågor.
  
Förmåga att balansera strategiska visioner med praktisk genomförandeförmåga.
  
Analytisk med problemlösningsförmåga och lösningsorienterat tänkande.
  
Anpassningsbar till förändringar och proaktiv i att utforska nya lösningar.
  
Högdriven och engagerad, även när uppgifter är repetitiva.
  
Stark kommunikationsförmåga på både svenska och engelska, med förmåga att kommunicera effektivt med olika målgrupper.
  
  

**Startdatum:** Så snart som möjligt
  
**Slutdatum:** 31 oktober 2025
  
**Omfattning:** 50%
  
**Plats:** Stockholm
  
**Språk:** Svenska och Engelska
  
**Ansökning:** Vi behandlar ansökningar löpande och annonsen kan stängas innan sista ansökningsdatum.
  
  

**För ansökan, vänligen inkludera:**  

Ett uppdaterat CV
  
Timpris (inkl. omkostnader)
  
Information om tillgänglighet för att påbörja uppdraget
  
En kort motivering där du beskriver varför du passar för uppdraget, samt relevanta referensuppdrag.
  
  

Om Rasulson Consulting
  
Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
Techster Solutions befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst 12+ års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
  
Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
  
  

**Rollbeskrivning:**  

The team you will be working with is a DevOps team with high autonomy and freedom to operate. You are encouraged to find improvements in all areas of SW development and to spend the time to make things right from the start. The backlog for those teams is brought up from our stakeholders, feedback from the developers in Volvo Group. You will help your team to evolve and to deliver a highly efficient CI pipeline with a strong DevOps mindset and the main goal is to improve the developer experience. The team is working according to the Agile/SCRUM principles with recurring sprint planning’s and a product backlog. The team is an integral part of the larger Software Factory group, also including a Continuous Integration support team in Bangalore. Your role will be to take a senior developer role in this team, you will be helping the team to deliver on commitments that will support our way to a highly efficient toolchain for our software developers at Volvo Group Trucks Technology. This role requires a broad technical knowhow and the ability to build a good network to work with as we will provide solutions to many different stakeholders. \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ As a DevOps Engineer, your mission is to design, develop, and maintain our continuous integration and deployment toolchain. What You’ll Do • Build & Maintain CI/CD Pipelines – Design and improve the toolchains that enable continuous integration, testing, and deployment of embedded software. • Automate Everything – Drive automation for software testing, deployment, and infrastructure management. • Collaborate & Innovate – Work closely with developers and testers to create efficient and scalable solutions. • Monitor & Optimize – Ensure reliability, speed, and security in our build and deployment processes. \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ Who You Are • A team player who iterates solutions and shares knowledge with colleagues. • Someone who lives and breathes agile, DevOps, and test-driven development—and most importantly, puts these concepts into action. • Excited about working with technologies like Jenkins, Kubernetes, Docker, Cloud, and CI/CD tools. • Eager to learn new technologies to continuously grow and improve. • Extensive Coding experience. • Experience as architect/technical lead or similar • Previous Experience in Automotive software development toolchains will be highly valued
  
  

Ansökan Tror du att du är Techster Solutions nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
  
Arbetsplats och kulturVi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.
  
Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Processledare
description:
Vill du vara med och göra skillnad i samhället samtidigt som du får utvecklas i din karriär? Hos oss får du stora möjligheter att påverka vårt och ditt arbete, allt för att vi ska kunna leverera säkra och kvalitativa lösningar till vår kärnverksamhet. Vi jobbar i team och ansvarar för att erbjuda verksamheten digitaliserade lösningar som förenklar och effektiviserar deras vardag. Vi använder nya tekniker där det går men jobbar även mycket med förvaltning av våra befintliga lösningar.
  

  

Som processledare ansvarar du för att utveckla Kriminalvårdens utvecklingsprocess genom att bidra i det operativa och strategiska arbetet och säkerställa att processen används i det dagliga arbetet på myndigheten. Du kommunicerar och informerar om utvecklingsprocessen, mäter och följer upp processeffektivitet och rapporterar till processägare. Genom samarbete med Gruppchefer, FL IT/IKT och andra processledare säkerställer du att processerna hanterar tjänsterna optimalt.
  

  

I din roll kommer du leda och styra arbetet inom ditt processansvarsområde samt stödja gruppchefer med att leda olika typer att uppdrag. Vidare samverkar du med andra processledare som ansvarar för ITIL-processerna och samverkar med Infrastruktur, It-support och it-planering för att öka förståelsen inom modern IT-utveckling. I dina arbetsuppgifter ingår också att utmana och utveckla arbetssätt inom IT-avdelningen med fokus på ständiga förbättringar.
  

  

Rollen innebär att vara framåtdrivande och engagerad med en god förankring och förståelse för olika IT-områden.


**Kvalifikationer:**
För rollen som processledare söker vi dig som arbetar bra med andra människor och relaterar till dem på ett lyhört och smidigt sätt. Du är lugn, uppmärksam och tillmötesgående i ditt bemötande och kommunicerar på ett tydligt sätt samt säkerställer att budskapet har nått fram. Vidare skapar du kontakter och underhåller relationer i arbetet samtidigt som du ser helheter och tar hänsyn till det större perspektivet.
  

  

För oss är det viktigt att du delar Kriminalvårdens grundläggande värderingar om en human människosyn, respekt för individen samt tron på människans vilja och förmåga att utvecklas. Du är även medveten om och har förståelse för hur bakgrund, kultur och grupptillhörighet påverkar dig själv och andra. Vidare förväntas du med ditt förhållningssätt bidra till att alla blir likvärdigt bemötta. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
  

  

Vi söker dig som har:
  

* Akademisk examen inom systemvetenskap, civilingenjör eller högskoleingenjör inom data alternativt annan utbildning i kombination med erfarenhet som Kriminalvården bedömer relevant.
* Erfarenhet av arbete med metoder för processkartläggning. processutveckling och förändringsarbete inom IT-området.
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt.
* Förmåga att uttrycka sig väl i tal och skrift på svenska.


  

Det är meriterande om du har:
  

* Erfarenhet av att leda uppdrag/projekt.
* Erfarenhet av tvärfunktionellt arbetssätt.
* Erfarenhet av att jobba i stora offentliga organisationer eller komplexa organisationer.
* Erfarenhet av förändringsledning.
* Erfarenhet som agil coach.
* Erfarenhet av att genomföra och leda User Story Mapping.
* Certifiering inom processledning.
* Certifiering inom Scrum eller SAFE.
* Kunskap om DevOps.
##### **Erfarenhet:**


Ingen erfarenhet krävs


**Övrigt:**
Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetande. För att arbeta hos oss behöver du genomgå en säkerhetsprövning i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen. Befattningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass och en säkerhetsprövning innefattande en säkerhetsprövningsintervju med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas. Vid säkerhetsprövningen utreds du som person, din bakgrund och dina relationer ur ett säkerhetsperspektiv. Du behöver vara svensk medborgare, men får gärna ha utländsk bakgrund. I samband med din anställningsintervju får du mer information om säkerhetsprövning. Läs mer om säkerhetsprövningen på: https://www.kriminalvarden.se/jobba-hos-oss/rekryteringsprocessen/sakerhetsprovning-vid-rekrytering/
  

  

Befattningen kan innebära krigsplacering vid Kriminalvården. Läs mer om krigsplacering på: https://www.kriminalvarden.se/jobba-hos-oss/rekryteringsprocessen/krigsplacering/
  

  

Kriminalvården strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och ökad mångfald.
  

  

Provanställning kan komma att tillämpas.
  

  

För att skicka in din ansökan, klicka på ansökningslänken i annonsen. Frågor om hur du ansöker och lägger in ditt CV ställer du direkt till Visma Recruit. Frågor om specifika jobb besvaras av den kontaktperson som anges i annonsen.
  

  

Vi undanber oss vänligen men bestämt direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av rekryteringsannonser. Kriminalvården har upphandlade avtal.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
We are looking for an experienced Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join our team and lead the development of AI/ML software products and solutions. The primary focus of this role will be to explore large datasets, perform feature engineering, build data pipelines, test and evaluate model outputs, deploy solutions for production, and scale them to ensure maintainability within a complex network.


Key Responsibilities:

* Design, develop, and maintain large-scale data infrastructure needed for AI/ML projects.
* Build and implement AI/ML solutions by exploring large datasets, performing feature engineering, and creating data pipelines.
* Ensure that solutions are well-designed, scalable, and maintainable in a production environment.
* Contribute to architectural decisions and technical roadmap planning, writing scalable, maintainable, and future-proof code.
* Develop solutions for common needs in AI/ML projects such as feature reuse, model traceability, monitoring, A/B testing, versioning, and serving both online and batch inference endpoints.
* Collaborate with a cross-functional, agile team of engineers, data scientists, and business stakeholders to build an AI ecosystem.
* Ensure product quality, cybersecurity, and performance requirements are met throughout the development lifecycle.


Required Skills and Experience:

* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
* At least 5 years of professional experience in a senior-level Machine Learning Engineer role, preferably in supply chain and demand forecasting domains.
* Strong software engineering skills with hands-on experience in coding and applying software engineering practices, including DevOps, testing, and Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) principles to machine learning and AI projects.
* Proven experience in developing and deploying software products to production and scaling them within a large organization.
* Extensive experience with Python programming (4+ years), especially in developing backend services, and familiarity with frameworks like FastAPI.
* Hands-on experience with cloud technologies for ML development, particularly Google Cloud Platform, including Vertex AI.
* Solid experience in MLOps, building ML pipelines, data pipelines, and deploying machine learning models to production.
* A strong foundational background in data science and practical experience with a variety of AI/ML techniques and frameworks.
* Experience in handling high-volume heterogeneous data (batch and stream), including hands-on development with SQL and DBT.
* Strong understanding of cloud data storage technologies and data quality management.
* Proven ability to analyze and align requirements, drive solution design, break down tasks, and communicate effectively with stakeholders.
* Experience working in agile environments, fostering collaboration, and supporting team members to adhere to organizational standards and best practices.


This is an exciting opportunity for a driven, hands-on individual passionate about leveraging their software engineering expertise to build and scale AI/ML solutions in a dynamic and growing organization. If you thrive in fast-paced, data-driven environments and have a strong background in cloud technologies, machine learning, and software engineering, we want to hear from you!

**About** **Rasulson Consulting**

Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you’ll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

title: Azure-konsult / Azure-arkitekt
description:
Arbetsuppgifter
Vi tror att tekniken ger oss oanade möjligheter – för att utveckla människor, skapa bättre affärer och bygga hållbara samhällen. Vi letar efter dig som vill arbeta tillsammans med Sveriges härligaste kollegor och vill vara en del av ett kompetent team som har roligt tillsammans och levererar värdeskapande lösningar till Forefronts kunder.


***Det här är Forefront***  

Vi – Forefront – är ett verksamhets- och IT-konsultbolag som föddes 2008. Idag är vi över 500 anställda, eller Frontiers som vi hellre kallar oss. Vi har som ambition att bli Sveriges bästa arbetsplats. Det gör vi genom att uppskatta varandras olikheter, ständigt blicka framåt och skapa en organisation som är lika modig som klok. Tillsammans är vi förenade av delade visioner och drivna av större ambitioner. Med kontor och Frontiers över hela Sverige strävar vi efter att få teknik och människa att gå hand i hand.


***Vem är du?***  

Du drivs av att vara i teknikens framkant, arbeta i team mot gemensamma mål, och tillsammans leverera hög kvalitet och värde till Forefronts kunder. Du är prestigelös, vetgirig och tycker om att dela med dig av dina kunskaper och erfarenheter. Du tycker det är viktigt att få och ge feedback.  

  

***Kvalifikationer***  

Vi tror att du har erfarenhet av:


* Azure hands-on i minst 3 år
* Ansvar för arkitektur i Azure (nätverk, Azure landing zone)
* Molnmigreringar
* Cloud Adoption Framework
* Lift and Shift
* Azure PowerShell & CLI
* Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
* Bicep
* Microsoft Entra ID (tidigare Azure AD)
* Azure DevOps (tidigare Visual Studio)


Kvalifikationer
***Vad kan du förvänta dig?***  

Spännande uppgifter som Azure-konsult / Azure-arkitekt hos Forefront:

  

* Hjälper och agerar rådgivare i Forefronts kunders molnresor
* Bygger och implementerar högkvalitativa tekniska lösningar och har kul tillsammans
* Verkar i nära samarbeten och relationer med våra kunder och med Microsoft
* Jobbar med moderna tekniker och arbetssätt
* Är med i hela leveransen, från design till användarupplevelse
* Du har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i såväl tal som skrift


**Vi lovar dig!**


* Sveriges härligaste kollegor!
* Kompetensutveckling anpassad till dig som individ
* Du får jobba med de senaste teknikerna
* En härlig och harmonisk arbetsmiljö
* Tillgång till ett enormt nätverk av experter och möjligheter
* Tätt partnerskap med Microsoft

Om företaget
Forefront Consulting är ett verksamhets- och IT-konsultbolag med drygt 550 anställda. Med kontor på 11 orter i Sverige och USA, guidar vi företag och organisationer i det digitala landskapet och övriga transformationer.



Oavsett om uppdraget avser affärsverksamhet, teknologiska plattformar eller designlösningar är utgångspunkten alltid att först skapa en samsyn kring nödvändiga förändringar för att sedan kunna realisera dessa på bästa sätt för avsedd effekt.


.Våra värderingar är vårt DNA


AvsiktAvsikten är motorn i vårt arbete och medvetenheten om var målet ligger. Den ger oss styrkan att ifrågasätta det till synes uppenbara, lägger kraft bakom våra påståenden och motiverar våra beslut.


AvtryckAvtryck säger något om vår starka ambition att skapa förändring. Att göra verklig skillnad. Både i aktuella kundprojekt och i vår omvärld i stort. Vi är stolta över att våra kunder talar väl om oss. Och vi blir glada när vår verksamhet ses som en positiv förebild av kollegorna i branschen.


InsiktDet är i insikten som vårt arbete börjar. För att nå dit krävs tålamod, empati och ödmjukhet, samt nyfikenhet nog att kunna ta in flera olika perspektiv och väga samman informationen. Insikt handlar om att verkligen förstå problemet innan vi försöker lösa det.


TillsammansTillsammans är den väg vi väljer för att nå de mål vi siktar mot. Ordet ger uttryck för vårt sökande efter mervärdet i en gemensam strävan. Det handlar om att befinna sig jämsides med kunder och kollegor. Utan prestige och onödiga hierarkier, men med delaktighet, ansvar och arbetsglädje.


UtsiktUtsikt beskriver både en position och den medvetna ansträngning som är nödvändig för att ta sig dit. Begreppet påminner oss också om att goda rådgivare är öppna och ödmjuka. Det handlar om att se och att särskilja, med fokus på kundens affärsnytta.


Om företaget
Forefront Consulting är ett verksamhets- och IT-konsultbolag med drygt 550 anställda. Med kontor på 11 orter i Sverige och USA, guidar vi företag och organisationer i det digitala landskapet och övriga transformationer.



Oavsett om uppdraget avser affärsverksamhet, teknologiska plattformar eller designlösningar är utgångspunkten alltid att först skapa en samsyn kring nödvändiga förändringar för att sedan kunna realisera dessa på bästa sätt för avsedd effekt.

title: Cloud DevOps Engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**


Are you a highly dedicated person who’s not afraid of operating production cloud environment and digging into the data and problem solving? Do you love open source projects and cloud native technologies? Ericsson is this place, and we have an exciting opportunity for you in a fast-paced, highly collaborative technical environment.

  

If you don't think you meet all the criteria but still are interested in the job and willing to take the challenge and learn, please apply.

  

The DevOps team at Ericsson is responsible for building and operating full stack cloud native infrastructure using Ericsson own data centers targeting for cloud native IoT and 5G applications.  

If you’re passionate about scalability, reliability, automation, uptime and availability, building and maintaining mission-critical infrastructure and tools as a platform that enables developers to use the cloud more optimally, would like to be involved in the open-source community, and love working with and developing the latest technologies, then we’re eager to talk to you.

 **What you will do:**

* Design, develop, test, operates high quality failure resistant private cloud
* Automate and build best-in-class continuous integration, continuous deployment pipeline
* Create meaningful monitoring, logging, alerting, and responses to issues proactively
* Network, scaling, performance tuning and trouble shooting
* You get to work with the best in class local and global teams
* You could influence and drive exciting, ambitious projects

 **The skills you bring:**

* Competence on Kubernetes cluster deployment and debugging
* Continues learning habit and thirsty with open source technology
* Capability to work as a team in start-up pace, open minded and hard-working
* Ability to solve problems, establish facts and draw valid conclusions
* Motivation to constantly seek new ways to improve system performance
* Pride in customer relation and exceeding customer expectations
* Passion about seamless uptime and infrastructure resiliency to failures
* Delight in building tools to automate routine tasks, organized, diligent
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Flexible working hours to handle on-call duty
* Education: MS in Electrical and Computer Engineering or equivalent

 **You might also have at least one of below:**  

  

* Multi Data center management, replication, scaling, performance tuning
* Problem-solving/troubleshooting skills, automation and programming
* Familiar with Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery and Deployment tooling
* Knowledge in software design and development for complex platforms
* Knowledge in IP/networking technologies
* Experience with open source and proprietary cloud and virtualization technologies (Kubernetes, VMWare, OpenStack, Azure, AWS, GCP, etc.)
* Comfortable with Go, Python, bash scripts, etc.
* Experience with Git, GitLab, Docker, Rancher, Jenkins, ELK, Redis, Ansible, Terraform, Spinnaker, GitOps, Kubeflow
* Fluent in Linux: CentOS, or Ubuntu
* Stay on top of CNCF landscape: https://www.cncf.io
company_description: Do you want to be part of shaping the future? From making connectivity more accessible to the latest IoT solutions, you have an opportunity to be where it begins.

title: Team Lead till Craton
description:
**Vill du vara med och bidra till ett säkrare samhälle som Team Lead?**


Basalt är ett av branschens ledande säkerhetsföretag med expertis inom IT-säkerhet, informationssäkerhet, krisberedskap och totalförsvar samt systematiskt säkerhetsskyddsarbete. Vi har även marknadens säkraste IT-plattform/PaaS, Craton, för organisationer med de högsta skyddskraven.  

  

Just nu befinner vi oss i en stark tillväxtfas och behöver därför förstärka vårt team med dig som vill arbeta som Team Lead och utveckla nästa generation av Craton.  

  

**Om rollen**
  

Som Team Lead kommer du att ha ett övergripande ansvar för ett team på 6–8 personer som arbetar med utveckling eller produktion av Craton. Du kommer att ha en ledande funktion, där du både leder teamet och aktivt deltar i det operativa arbetet som systemutvecklare. I rollen ingår att analysera, fördela och följa upp arbetsuppgifter inom teamet och säkerställa att alla medlemmar arbetar mot gemensamma mål och deadlines. Du kommer att samarbeta nära med andra Team Leads och projektledare för att säkerställa att alla team är synkroniserade och att vi levererar enligt våra kunders behov och förväntningar. I rollen ingår även att representera ditt team i möten och rapportera framsteg, risker och resultat. Vi söker en person som kan leda i tekniska frågor, utan att ha personalansvar.  

  

Vi arbetar agilt och hos oss får du möjligheten att utvecklas i nära samarbete med kunniga kollegor som brinner för att utveckla nästa generation av Craton. Craton är byggd som en private cloud-lösning för hela systemmiljöer och är mer metod än teknikval. Vi arbetar med integration av system, orkestrering, helautomatiserade miljöer samt microservices med mera.  

  

**Din bakgrund**

  

Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av:

* Att arbeta i en tekniskt ledande roll, där du både har coachat och varit aktiv i det operativa arbetet.
* DevOps och utveckling i komplexa och automatiserade IT-miljöer.
* Goda kunskaper i Linux.
* Programmering i ett modernt språk.
* Att uttrycka dig väl på både svenska och engelska, såväl i tal som skrift, eftersom dokumentation är en central del av vårt arbete.
* 

För att trivas i rollen ser vi att du har ett intresse för:

* Infrastruktur, systemintegrationer samt nätverk och kommunikation, eftersom Craton erbjuder helhetslösningar
* Att diskutera och lösa tekniska problem samt bidra till tekniska lösningar

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**  

För att ge dig trygghet och stabilitet erbjuder vi ett förmånspaket som inkluderar en av marknadens bästa pensionslösningar, omfattande försäkringar, förstärkt föräldralön, och ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kr/år. Du får även tillgång till Benifex, där du kan hitta extra förmåner och vi erbjuder kontinuerliga möjligheter till kompetensutveckling.  

  

Vi värnar om balansen mellan arbete och fritid. Med flexibla arbetstider, 5-timmars arbetsdag innan helgdagar och ledigt på klämdagar ser vi till att du har tid för både ditt jobb och ditt privatliv. Dessutom anordnar vi gemensamma aktiviteter, såsom skidresor, träningspass och sociala luncher, för att stärka sammanhållningen och göra arbetsplatsen ännu trevligare.  

  

Vi strävar efter att du ska känna stolthet och trivsel hos oss på Basalt. Du kan läsa mer om våra förmåner och om hur det är att arbeta på Basalt här!  

  

**Din ansökan**
  

Ansök med ditt CV och beskriv kort vad du söker i din nästa roll. Vi gör löpande urval och intervjuer, så ansök gärna redan idag! Vill du veta mer om rollen? Kontakta gärna Kajsa-Stina Åkerblom på 076 763 99 97 eller på kajsa-stina.akerblom@basalt.se  

  

Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetande. Våra anställda är placerade i säkerhetsklass i enlighet med de krav som finns i Säkerhetsskyddslagen då våra kunders verksamhet kräver detta, vilket medför att svenskt medborgarskap är ett villkor för tjänsten.  

  

**Mer om oss**
  

Basalt är experter inom verksamhets- och säkerhetsskydd, med djup kunskap inom systematiskt säkerhetsarbete och utveckling av säkra IT-lösningar. Vi stödjer företag, myndigheter och kommuner i att skydda sin mest värdefulla information från både interna och externa hot. Grundat 2009 och med cirka 120 medarbetare, blev vi en del av Omegapoint Group 2022.  

  

Vår vision är att Basalt ska vara det självklara valet för att skapa ett säkert och robust samhälle. Våra värderingar bygger på att vara både vassa och snälla, vi kombinerar hög prestation och expertis med en kultur där vi bryr oss om varandra och skapar en positiv, stöttande miljö.  

  

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**Who We Are** 




 Wimt is on a mission to Open Up Sports by creating a platform where athletes, clubs, fans, sponsors, and enthusiasts come together to share experiences, forge new connections, and unlock sustainable revenue streams for sports communities.
 



  





 As a DevOps Engineer you’ll be part of the technology team, building infrastructure to support a smooth user experience on mobile and web platforms.
 



  





**What We’re Looking For** 




**Requirements** 



* B.Sc. in computer science, or equivalent knowledge acquired through work experience
* Infrastructure/PaaS/SaaS management
* High-performance server optimizations (rate limiting, caching)
* Cloud computing administration (AWS)
* Hands-on experience with Linux/Unix
* Scripting & automation
* Managing CI/CD pipelines
* Containerization & orchestration for testing and deployment purposes
* Monitoring & logging for security and reliability
* Network configuration and/or network stack software development
* Software and user management security best practices
* Collaborative work with Git/GitHub (branching, reviewing, automated flows)



  





**Nice to Have** 



* 3+ years of work in software development
* User management and authentication



  





**Who Thrives at Wimt** 




 You thrive in a fast-paced, evolving start-up environment. You’re open-minded, proactive, and resourceful, willing to step into new challenges and responsibilities as needed. You excel at openly communicating, solving problems creatively, and fostering collaborative relationships across teams.
 



  





**Work Arrangement** 




 This role offers flexibility between on-site and hybrid working arrangements. Candidates should be comfortable working on-site part-time to facilitate collaboration and building team culture.
 



  





 Ready to help Open Up Sports? Send your application or questions to jobs@wimt.com. Let’s redefine how the world engages with sports—together!

title: Systems Engineer
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 We're evolving our data center environments into a consumption-based Private Cloud, delivering world class Hybrid Cloud to our internal and external customers. To support this transformation, we're looking for a hands-on Systems Engineer to join our Private Cloud Infrastructure Team in Stockholm, Sweden (hybrid role).
   

  

 As a Systems Engineer, you'll play a vital role in designing, deploying, migrating, and maintaining key infrastructure components, including AWS, VMWare, HPE, VMAX, SAN (primarily Brocade), RHEL and Windows AD, all while ensuring 99.999% uptime. Once our technology refresh is complete, you'll help shape our private cloud landscape, in Kubernetes and other emerging technologies. You'll also represent the Private Cloud team as an SME, collaborating with application teams, developers, DevOps, and stakeholders.
   

  

* Manage and maintain Linux and Windows systems, ensuring security, performance, and reliability.
* Oversee virtualization platforms (VMware ESXi, vCenter) and public cloud environments.
* Administer SAN and NAS Storage, including Fiber Channel SAN switching.
* Collaborate with software engineers, DevOps, and operations teams to optimize, maintain, and secure systems with 99.999% uptime, ensuring 24/7 global availability for enterprise customers.
* Maintain Servers, operating systems, and storage across global data centers.
* Automate and configure systems with Ansible and SaltStack.
* Provide Tier-3/4 on-call support for production infrastructure and fault management on a rotating 24/7 schedule.
* Design, plan, and implement systems security infrastructure.
* Support compliance efforts for ISO 27001 certification.


**Requirements**
 We believe you're proactive, structured, and methodical in your approach to work. You communicate effectively, value documentation and planning, and thrive in collaborative environments and balance independent initiative with strong teamwork. Problem-solving comes naturally to you and you can adapt quickly to deliver secure, resilient, and scalable, quality solutions to the dynamic and rapidly evolving IT landscape and associated technologies.
   

  

* Hands-on experience in Linux server administration.
* Strong VMware administration skills in a data center environment, as well as infrastructure maintenance.
* Expertise in SAN storage systems and NAS storage administration, including SAN switching, zoning, and LUN creation/presentation.
* Experience with automation tools such as Ansible, SaltStack, Python, or PowerShell.
* Networking experience, including TCP/IP, OS network stacks, bonding/teaming, IP Tables, network virtualization, application sockets, LAN switching, and end-to-end client-server communication models.
* Design and deployment experience with Docker and/or Kubernetes is a plus.
* Cloud platform experience (AWS, Azure, or GCP) is a plus.
* Knowledge of ITIL and change management best practices.


 Our corporate language is English, please submit your application in
 **English** 
 .
   

  

****OUR HIRING PROCESS****
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!
