title: Juniora Analysts till Engineering, AI & Data (Stockholm) - Aug 2025
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**
-----------------------

Deloitte är en globalt ledande leverantör av Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal och Consultative Services. Med mer än 457 000 medarbetare i över 150 länder hjälper vi våra klienter och vår omvärld att lösa komplexa problem och nå högt uppsatta mål. Det som definierar Deloitte är vår strävan efter att göra en meningsfull skillnad. För oss innebär det långsiktig utveckling och resultat för våra klienter och deras företag, idéer och handlingar, som också bidrar till en positiv samhällsutveckling. Det handlar även om att stärka våra medarbetare och främja deras utveckling.


**Om rollen**
-------------

Operations, Engineering, AI & Data stödjer våra klienter i att driva strategiska förändringsprojekt där vi implementerar affärsstrategier och utvecklar deras operationella förmågor för att hjälpa dem nå sina affärsmål. Vi arbetar med verksamhetsförändring där vi använder våra industrispecifika lösningar och tekniska kunskap för att transformera, modernisera och optimera våra klienters processer och tekniska plattformar.


**AI & Data:**

AI & Data-teamet hjälper våra kunder att förbättra beslutsfattande genom datadrivna insikter och skapa insiktsdrivna organisationer. I teamets tekniska spår arbetar vi med implementering av lösningar inom AI, GenAI, cloud data platforms, data warehouse, BI/analytics. Vi har starkt fokus på data science, där kompetenser inom maskininlärning, statistisk analys och modellering är centrala för att leverera avancerade insikter och affärsvärde. Vår modell är on-the-job-training där du växer in i mer ansvarsfulla roller, men du kommer också att vidareutbilda dig i olika tekniska plattformar, t.ex. Google Cloud Platform, AWS, Azure, Snowflake och/eller Databricks.


Vårt rådgivande spår i teamet jobbar med data management, data governance och datastrategi. Här ser vi gärna att du har en mer traditionell managementkonsultutbildning kombinerad med data och teknik samt ett intresse för att arbeta med rådgivning. AI & Data-teamet verkar i en nordisk organisation med mycket kunskapskapital och kompetens så du kommer också att medverka i projekt, communities och utbildningar tillsammans med dina nordiska kollegor.


**Engineering:**

Hos Engineering-teamet kommer ditt fokus ligga på att hjälpa våra kunder att transformera sin affär genom planering och implementation av kritiska verksamhetssystem och molnplattformar. Teamet kombinerar teknik- och affärsexpertis inom systemutveckling och molnplattformar med bred projektledningsförmåga samt djup branscherfarenhet inom flera sektorer. Därmed kan vi stödja våra kunder genom hela sin system- och affärstransformationsresa från början till slut oavsett vilken fas de befinner sig i. Vårt erbjudande inkluderar bland annat utveckling av strategier, skräddarsydda plattformar, modernisering av applikationer, alla aspekter av molnteknik samt rådgivning kring alla delar av en systemimplementation.


Som Analyst i vårt team kommer du vara en del av våra kunders resa genom att stötta med roller inom t.ex. kravställning, systemutveckling, testning & projektledning. Du kommer att skaffa dig erfarenhet både genom kundprojekt men även genom att delta vid branschevent, specialiserad utbildning och certifieringsprogram.


**Kravspecifikation**
---------------------

Vi söker dig som är nyexaminerad ingenjör eller systemvetare med en masterexamen inom management eller data/data science/analytics eller finans. För att trivas bra i rollen bör du även vara utåtriktad och initiativrik samt drivs av nya utmaningar.


Vidare ser vi gärna att du innehar:


* Goda studieresultat, internationell erfarenhet och relevant engagemang vid sidan av studierna
* Relevant arbetslivserfarenhet – erfarenhet från konsultbranschen är meriterande
* Mycket goda språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift
* Förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och tillsammans i ett team, med målmedvetenhet, engagemang och driv
* Intresse för hur digitalisering och ny teknik kan utveckla verksamheter och branscher

Om du är osäker på om du uppfyller ovan kvalifikationer uppmuntrar vi dig att skicka in en ansökan ändå.


**Ytterligare information**
---------------------------

**Vi erbjuder**

Som en del av Deloitte får du tillgång till världens största konsultnätverk med kollegor världen över som du kan nyttja för att utveckla både dig själv, våra klienter och vår verksamhet. Du får arbeta med spännande, komplexa uppdrag, både på global och nordisk nivå, i ett team som alltid värderar ditt perspektiv och som är i framkant av digitaliseringen. Vi lägger stor vikt vid att erbjuda dig möjligheter att driva din personliga utveckling. Vi erbjuder dig praktisk erfarenhet, en personlig coach som långsiktigt stöttar dig i din karriär samt kontinuerlig feedback och support från mer erfarna kollegor.


Du får möjlighet att arbeta i ett företag som hjälper andra aktörer i deras resa mot en mer hållbar organisation, samtidigt som vi arbetar målmedvetet med våra egna ambitioner inom både klimat, miljö och socialt ansvar. Vi ser ett värde i att våra medarbetare har olika erfarenheter vilket främjar nytänkande och bidrar till fler perspektiv.


**Ansökan**

Du ansöker online. Din ansökan ska bestå av:


* CV
* En motivering till;
	+ Varför du är intresserad av Deloitte och rollen
	+ Vad du tror att du kan tillföra i rollen
* Betygskopior från högskola/universitet - De betyg som du laddar upp bör inte vara utdragna senare än 2 månader tillbaka i tiden.

Ladda gärna upp din motivering och dina betyg som ett dokument. CV laddas upp i första steget och de övriga dokumenten som efterfrågas laddas upp när du går vidare till nästa steg (ej i kommentarsfältet). Notera att du behöver ladda upp samtliga dokument för att din ansökan ska ses som fullständig. Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt då vi arbetar med löpande urval. **Om du söker flera tjänster hos oss ber vi dig att i dina ansökningar tydliggöra vilken roll du är mest intresserad av.**

Som ett kvalitativt led i Deloittes rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om våra framtida medarbetare, trygga arbetsmiljön för våra medarbetare och möta regelkrav. Processen för bakgrundskontroller genomförs i samarbete med ToFindOut. https://tofindout.se/sv/faq/ . För de tjänster som Deloitte efterfrågar universitetsbetyg genomförs en verifiering som en del i rekryteringsprocessen. För frågor hänvisar vi till ansvarig rekryterare i processen.


**Frågor**

Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller om rekryteringsprocessen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Johanna Aspegårdh ( jaspegardh@deloitte.se ).


Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!


**What impact will you make?**

På Deloitte gör ditt arbete en meningsfull skillnad, varje dag, medan du växer i en inkluderande företagskultur av samarbete och hög prestation. Utöver att skapa lösningar strävar vi efter att göra en positiv och avgörande skillnad för andra i vår omgivning, våra klienter och samhället. På Deloitte hittar du tidigare dolda möjligheter att lyckas och inser din fulla potential.


**Arbetsplats**
---------------
company_description: We’re a leading professional services firm, but what makes working at Deloitte unique? When you join us, you become connected. To inspiring people. To meaningful work with fascinating clients.

title: Sales Enablement Manager
description:
About the role
  
Are you a rebel at heart, who loves creative solutions to thorny problems? At one.com, we’re looking for a Sales Enablement Manager who thrives on thinking outside the box and overcoming obstacles to get results at scale. In this role, you'll be navigating between high-level strategy development and hands-on execution to drive scalable business growth. This role requires both strategic vision and operational expertise, ensuring the successful design of service fulfilment processes, development of lead generation strategies, and continuous optimisation of revenue-driving initiatives.
  
**Key Responsibilities:** You will work closely with leadership to define the growth strategy while collaborating with teams on the ground to execute and refine processes effectively. If you’re passionate about crafting data-driven experiments and finding innovative ways to drive growth and intake of quality customers, we want you on our team. Bring your critical thinking, creativity, and relentless dedication, and let's redefine what success looks like—together.
  
**Strategic Growth & Business Alignment:** Develop and refine scalable growth strategies, leveraging data insights while collaborating across all levels of the organization.
  
**Service Fulfillment Optimization:** support cross-functional teams with improving service delivery processes, identifying bottlenecks and enhancing efficiency, quality, and profitability.
  
**Lead Generation & Sales Enablement:** Drive multi-channel lead generation strategies, optimize inbound and outbound sales efforts, and implement automation for better conversion.
  
**Hands-On Execution & Collaboration:** Work cross-functionally to execute and refine growth initiatives, balancing strategic planning with hands-on contribution to projects and process improvements.
  
**Qualifications:** 5+ years of experience in growth, revenue operations, sales enablement, or service fulfillment roles.
  
Ability to work at both strategic and operational levels, from high-level planning to hands-on execution.
  
Strong analytical skills with experience using CRM tools (Such as HubSpot, Pipedrive, and Salesforce) and lead generation platforms.
  
Proven track record of developing, implementing, and optimizing scalable growth initiatives.
  
Excellent cross-functional collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to balance creative strategic thinking and tactical execution across teams in a fast-paced environment.
  
A data-driven mindset, a passion for experimentation, problem-solving, and continuous improvement.
  
**Nice to have:** Background in SaaS, subscription models, or other tech-driven industries
  
Startup or early scale-up experience
  
Familiarity with product-led growth strategies
  
About us
  
one.com is a part of group.one is a leading European provider of online presence, cloud hosting, and digital marketing services. Over 2 million customers trust us with their online success. Our global team consists of 1 500+ employees operating from nearly 20 locations across 15 countries, with our headquarters in Sweden. Thanks to the support of our partners Cinven and Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan, we are steadily expanding the group's service portfolio and geographical footprint.
  
When you join group.one, you become a part of a global network that values collaboration, growth, and excellence. Join us in creating online success stories!
  
We don't care whether you are female, male or diverse, where you come from, how old you are, what colour your skin is or what you believe in. For us, the focus is on mutual respect, personal appreciation as well as fun and motivation at work. Develop yourself - your personality - because we focus on you as a person and team member.
  
We want to continue to grow with you. That's why we look forward to getting to know you.

title: Corporate Communications Manager
description:
We are seeking a skilled and proactive Corporate Communications Manager to join our team at group.one, a portfolio of brands specialising in web hosting, website building, and domain name registration. This operationally focused role will report to the Head of Corporate Communications and will have a primary focus on internal communications, employer branding, sustainability and crisis communication. The ideal candidate will have a strong ability to manage day-to-day communication operations, engage employees through compelling messaging, and act quickly and effectively during crises.
  
As part of a growing, private equity-backed company, the Corporate Communications Manager will play a critical role in shaping the internal narrative, fostering a positive work environment, and ensuring timely, transparent communication with our employees. This role will also contribute to strengthening group.one’s employer brand and support effective communication during periods of change or crisis.
  
**Your Key Responsibilities Internal Messaging & Engagement:** Oversee daily communication to ensure alignment with company culture, values, and goals. Create and distribute clear and engaging content including for emails, newsletters, and intranet updates to keep employees informed and engaged.
  
**Employee Communication Channels:** Manage internal channels (intranet, newsletters, town halls, Slack) to ensure clear and consistent messaging. Assist leadership in communicating organizational updates and maintaining transparency.
  
**Employer Branding Strategy:** Collaborate with HR and talent acquisition to develop an employer branding strategy that highlights company culture, values, and benefits. Create content (employee stories, testimonials) for career sites and social media, positioning the company as an employer of choice.
  
**Crisis and Change Communication Management:** Work with leadership to manage organisational change and crisis communications, ensuring messages are clear and empathetic. Prepare the company for crisis communication with resilient channels and processes. Support external crisis communication efforts when needed.
  
**Sustainability:** work closely with the head of communications and head of sustainability on regular ESG communications for all audiences, and with the annual Sustainability Report.
  
Qualifications 5+ years of experience and relevant qualifications in corporate communications or internal communications in an international environment.
  
Proven experience in creating and executing on internal communication and employer branding strategies within a fast-paced organization.
  
Experience with working closely with senior leadership on sensitive issues such as change and crisis.
  
  

You possess exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to tailor messages for diverse internal audiences and varying situations. Your strong project management abilities allow you to prioritize and manage multiple tasks efficiently. As a creative thinker, you have a passion for producing engaging content in all forms, that resonates with both employees and potential candidates. Additionally, you have excellent interpersonal skills and collaborate effectively with colleagues at all levels, including senior leadership.
  
You are proficient in using internal communication tools such as Microsoft 365, Slack, Confluence, SharePoint and other intranet platforms, as well as creative tools such as Canva or Adobe. You are also well-versed in leveraging social media platforms like LinkedIn and Glassdoor for employer branding purposes and to extend stakeholder reach. Your expertise extends to media relations, content management, and applying crisis communication best practices.
  
The position is located in Stockholm.
  
About us
  
group.one is a leading European provider of online presence, cloud hosting, and digital marketing services. Over 2 million customers trust us with their online success. Our global team consists of 1 500+ employees operating from nearly 20 locations across 15 countries, with our headquarters in Sweden. Thanks to the support of our partners Cinven and Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan, we are steadily expanding the group's service portfolio and geographical footprint.
  
When you join group.one, you become a part of a global network that values collaboration, growth, and excellence. Join us in creating online success stories!
  
We don't care whether you are female, male or diverse, where you come from, how old you are, what colour your skin is or what you believe in. For us, the focus is on mutual respect, personal appreciation as well as fun and motivation at work. Develop yourself - your personality - because we focus on you as a person and team member.
  
We want to continue to grow with you. That's why we look forward to getting to know you.

title: Head of Corporate Communications
description:
We are seeking an experienced Head of Corporate Communications to lead both internal and external communications for group.one, a portfolio of brands specialising in web hosting, website building, and domain name registration. This is a high-impact role within a private equity-backed environment, growing both organically and with M&A, where we focus on helping small businesses succeed online. We are seeking an individual who can operate strategically with executive stakeholders and lead tactical execution across multiple communication channels.
  
The Head of Communications will work closely with the C Suite to develop and implement communication strategies targeting investors, talent, partners, potential acquisition targets, and media. In addition, this role will collaborate with HR and other key functions to lead the internal communications strategy, ensuring clear, consistent, and engaging messaging across the organization. A Communications Manager will report to this position to focus on internal communications, complementing the Head of Communications’ broader scope of responsibilities.
  
The ideal candidate is equally comfortable with strategic thinking as they are with hands-on execution, and capable of managing both high-level corporate messaging and day-to-day communication activities that drive employee engagement, customer satisfaction, and shareholder value.
  
**Your Key Responsibilities Investor Relations:** Craft transparent messaging for investors, working closely with the CEO and CFO on reports, presentations, and updates.
  
**Media & PR:** Enhance brand visibility through media strategies, thought leadership, and crisis communication. Manage press releases, corporate social media, and major announcements.
  
**Employee Engagement:** Develop internal communication strategies that inspire, inform, and align employees. Oversee execution and performance on relevant channels.
  
**Leadership Communications:** Partner with HR and executives to ensure clear, engaging communication at all levels.
  
**Crisis:** Lead communications during key company transitions or challenges, including coaching and supporting leaders.
  
**Content Creation:** Oversee the development of corporate materials, presentations, speeches, and reports.
  
**Performance Metrics:** Track and analyze media coverage, LinkedIn growth, employer brand perception, and employee feedback.
  
Qualifications 10+ years of experience in corporate communications, public relations, or related fields, with at least 5 years in a leadership role.
  
Proven track record of managing both internal and external communications for a fast-paced, growth-oriented organization. Experience working in private equity-owned companies or other environments that emphasize shareholder value is highly regarded.
  
Demonstrated success in media relations, investor relations, and strategic corporate messaging in an international environment.
  
  

The position is located in Stockholm.
  
About you
  
You bring a strategic mindset with the ability to execute hands-on, delivering high-quality and impactful communications. Your exceptional written and verbal communication skills allow you to craft clear, compelling messages tailored to diverse audiences. Comfortable working with senior leadership, you provide expert guidance on communication strategies and best practices.
  
With strong organisational skills, you excel at managing multiple projects within deadline. Your deep understanding of digital communication tools, internal systems, media outreach, and social media strategies ensures effective messaging across all platforms.
  
A natural collaborator, you work seamlessly across functions—including executives, HR, product teams, and marketing—to drive integrated communication efforts. As a leader, you have experience mentoring and developing teams, fostering professional growth and high performance.
  
About us
  
group.one is a leading European provider of online presence, cloud hosting, and digital marketing services. Over 2 million customers trust us with their online success. Our global team consists of 1 500+ employees operating from nearly 20 locations across 15 countries, with our headquarters in Sweden. Thanks to the support of our partners Cinven and Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan, we are steadily expanding the group's service portfolio and geographical footprint.
  
When you join group.one, you become a part of a global network that values collaboration, growth, and excellence. Join us in creating online success stories!
  
We don't care whether you are female, male or diverse, where you come from, how old you are, what colour your skin is or what you believe in. For us, the focus is on mutual respect, personal appreciation as well as fun and motivation at work. Develop yourself - your personality - because we focus on you as a person and team member.
  
We want to continue to grow with you. That's why we look forward to getting to know you.

title: Content Manager (föräldravikariat)
description:
Är du en kreativ Content Manager med passion för att skapa engagerande innehåll?


Vill du vara med och stärka Westers varumärke genom inspirerande och genomtänkt content? I rollen som Content Manager får du möjlighet att utveckla och skapa innehåll som lyfter vårt varumärke och når ut till våra kunder på ett sätt som engagerar och inspirerar.


Detta är ett föräldravikariat på ett år.

 **Om rollen**

Som Content Manager ansvarar du för idé, produktion och publicering av innehåll i våra olika kanaler. Du skapar content som stärker Westers identitet och ser till att all kommunikation har en röd tråd. Du jobbar självständigt och målinriktat för att säkerställa att våra budskap når ut på rätt sätt, i rätt tid och till rätt målgrupp.

  

Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter består av att:

* Idéa och producera content i form av text, grafiskt, ljud, foto, video/animation.
* Uppdatera, skapa och distribuera innehåll i våra kanaler: webb (menyer, artiklar etc), nyhetsbrev, podcast och sociala medier (i dagsläget främst Linkedin och Instagram).
* Skapa och uppdatera innehåll internt i form av presentationer, pitchar och övrigt material.
* Agera beställare av diverse innehåll från partners och leverantörer, ex. print, profilprodukter, video och foto.
* Arbeta mot budget och rapportera till VD.

 **Din profil**


Vi söker dig som brinner för att skapa engagerande och högkvalitativt content. Du är kreativ, nyfiken och vågar testa nya idéer, samtidigt som du analyserar vad som fungerar bäst för att optimera och utveckla innehållet. Med din starka visuella känsla skapar du material som både inspirerar och ger effekt.


Du har ett genomtänkt och långsiktigt perspektiv i ditt arbete, kombinerat med ett stort intresse för sociala medier. Du trivs med att arbeta självständigt men är också en lagspelare med en positiv inställning och god samarbetsförmåga. Din kreativa ådra och din förmåga att anpassa innehåll efter olika kanaler och målgrupper gör dig till en värdefull tillgång i teamet.


Vi ser gärna att du även har ett intresse för event och upplevelser – och att du tar dig an ditt arbete med energi, engagemang och rätt mindset!

  

Vi tror att du:

* Har arbetat i en liknande roll i några år, antingen på byrå eller inhouse.
* Har relevant utbildning inom marknad, kommunikation eller design.
* Kan skapa och redigera texter, bilder, video/animation, ljud (krav) och gärna kan fota och filma själv (meriterande).
* Har goda kunskaper i Adobe Creative Suite/Cloud (krav), Wordpress (meriterande), Apsis (meriterande).
* Har stor förståelse och intresse för kommunikation och varumärke.
* Pratar och skriver flytande svenska och engelska.

 **Vi erbjuder**


På Westers drivs vi av att skapa en arbetsplats fylld av trivsel och engagemang, där du som anställd kan växa och utvecklas. Hos oss får du därför ta del av bland annat:

* Kostförmån (lunch från Stockholms bästa cateringkök)
* Friskvård
* Återkommande aktiviteter och event
* Individuell utvecklings-/utbildningsplan
* Regelbundna hälsokontroller
* Sköna och hjälpsamma kollegor!

 **Om Westers**


Westers är ett av Stockholms ledande företag inom catering och event. Vi genomför årligen närmare 800 evenemang för företag och privatpersoner, där vi får vara med och skapa allt från bröllop och födelsedagar till företagsfester och konferenser.


Idag är vi cirka 25 medarbetare fördelat över organisationen, plus en härlig bonusfamilj av skicklig extrapersonal på våra event, många av dem utbildade i vår Westers Academy.


Vi jobbar utifrån värdeorden engagemang, empati och gemenskap. Vi har ett aktivt arbete med Westers Hjärta där hållbarhet, inkludering och socialt engagemang är våra främsta hjärtefrågor.


Är du den vi söker? Välkommen med din ansökan!

As part of a growing, private equity-backed company, the Corporate Communications Manager will play a critical role in shaping the internal narrative, fostering a positive work environment, and ensuring timely, transparent communication with our employees. -----------------------------

Prepare the company for crisis communication with resilient channels and processes. Support external crisis communication efforts when needed.
* **Sustainability:** work closely with the head of communications and head of sustainability on regular ESG communications for all audiences, and with the annual Sustainability Report.

**Qualifications**
------------------

* 5+ years of experience and relevant qualifications in corporate communications or internal communications in an international environment.
* Proven experience in creating and executing on internal communication and employer branding strategies within a fast-paced organization.
* Experience with working closely with senior leadership on sensitive issues such as change and crisis.


You possess exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to tailor messages for diverse internal audiences and varying situations. Your strong project management abilities allow you to prioritize and manage multiple tasks efficiently. As a creative thinker, you have a passion for producing engaging content in all forms, that resonates with both employees and potential candidates. Additionally, you have excellent interpersonal skills and collaborate effectively with colleagues at all levels, including senior leadership.


You are proficient in using internal communication tools such as Microsoft 365, Slack, Confluence, SharePoint and other intranet platforms, as well as creative tools such as Canva or Adobe. You are also well-versed in leveraging social media platforms like LinkedIn and Glassdoor for employer branding purposes and to extend stakeholder reach. Your expertise extends to media relations, content management, and applying crisis communication best practices.

***The position is located in Stockholm.***

**About us**
------------


group.one is a leading European provider of online presence, cloud hosting, and digital marketing services. Over 2 million customers trust us with their online success. Our global team consists of 1 500+ employees operating from nearly 20 locations across 15 countries, with our headquarters in Sweden. Thanks to the support of our partners Cinven and Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan, we are steadily expanding the group's service portfolio and geographical footprint.


When you join group.one, you become a part of a global network that values collaboration, growth, and excellence. Join us in creating online success stories!

**We don't care whether you are female, male or diverse, where you come from, how old you are, what colour your skin is or what you believe in. For us, the focus is on mutual respect, personal appreciation as well as fun and motivation at work. Develop yourself - your personality - because we focus on you as a person and team member.**

**We want to continue to grow with you. That's why we look forward to getting to know you.**

title: Customer Success - Sports Performance (German speaking)
description:
**We are looking for a Customer Success Manager to join the Spiideo team!**


Spiideo is a global leader in automated, cloud-based solutions for sports video analysis and streaming. Trusted by thousands of organizations worldwide, Spiideo serves some of the most renowned professional and collegiate teams, media companies, and leagues and federations.


Join the Customer Success team if you would love the opportunity to manage some of the top sports organizations across Europe.

  

This role is based in Malmö, Sweden and you will report directly to the VP of Customer Success.

**The role:**


You will manage a diverse portfolio of clubs and leagues across Europe with a primary focus on the German speaking markets. Fluency in German is required for this position.

 **Core responsibilities:**

* **Onboarding & Training:** help new customers get onboarded with Spiideo
* **Customer Satisfaction:** delivering exceptional guidance, maximize potential
* **Renewals:** proactive management to achieve company renewal targets
* **Upsell & Expansion:** identify opportunities to maximize and expand usage
* **Churn management:** proactively engage to reduce churn and ensure success
* **Relationship building:** cultivate strong, trusted partnerships with key stakeholders
* **Process development:** ability to coordinate and manage complex implementations

**What type of customers would you manage?**

  

Your customer portfolio will primarily consist of Professional sports clubs across across a variety of sports (Football, Ice Hockey, Basketball, Handball, etc.) using all of Spiideo's products: Spiideo Perform (video analysis), Spiideo Play (streaming), and Spiideo Replay (VAR).

  

* Primary customer type: Sports clubs
* Leagues and Media companies

**What we are looking for:**

  

* Sports background or sports tech industry
* Prior Customer Success or Sales experience (at least 2 years)
* Fluent in German and English
* Very process-driven and structured approach to working
* Self-motivated, takes initiative, positive, team-first attitude
* Excellent ability to train customers via Webinars, 1on1 meetings, etc.
* Strong problem solving skills
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Passion for customer success and get joy out of seeing our customers succeed

**What we can offer:**  



* The chance to make an impact in a growing, international SaaS company
* A friendly and skilled multinational team
* Access to cutting-edge tools and resources to empower your work
* Benefits package that includes an extensive pension & insurance package in line with collective agreements, wellness contribution, parental leave benefits and the opportunity to spend two working hours per week on physical activity.

**Location**: Spiideo's office at Lilla Torg 1 in Malmö

**Remote status:** Office first (Hybrid, minimum 3 days in Malmö office per week)

 **Application**


You will be part of an international team with knowledgable and friendly people from many different nationalities and backgrounds. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds to contribute their unique perspectives, skills, and experiences, fostering a diverse and inclusive workforce across Spiideo.


We believe that when the best people work together in an open environment, magic happens. Apply now and become an integral part of our success story! We review new applications continuously.

title: Senior Enterprise Success Manager
description:
**Location:** Sweden (Hybrid or Home-based)

  

As a Senior Enterprise Success Manager, you will assist our large enterprise accounts and derive maximum value from Solution and Services in achieving business outcomes. Your primary objective will be to ensure that our enterprise accounts are optimizing their investment in our solutions while delivering consistent, sustainable, and value-driven consumption and revenue growth for Bentley.  

By leveraging your industry expertise within the infrastructure sector, exercising your business acumen, relationship management skills, and a comprehensive understanding of Bentley solutions, you will act as a trusted advisor to help our customers succeed in their business endeavours. Your proactive approach will help align our offerings with their specific objectives, driving product adoption and optimizing usage ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction. You will collaborate with a diverse group of business, process, solution specialists, and Sales within Bentley to define and execute account-specific plans that you help develop. Additionally, you will represent our users' interests to enhance their overall experience.  

We are a global team in Enterprise Success Management in EMEA who work with customers engaged in leading projects within the infrastructure and engineering space.

 **Your Day-to-Day:**

* Capture your accounts' desired business outcomes, prioritize their digital workflow improvements, and position technical discoveries to help them plan how they will achieve their outcomes with Bentley's solutions, services, and expertise.
* Track and measure value delivered to accounts through their engagement with Bentley and our solutions.
* Establish trust and articulate the value your accounts are getting from Bentley products and services through successful planning and delivery of Business Reviews.
* Position services that lead to the successful adoption of Bentley technologies that align with an account’s goals and deliver value to their business.
* Drive to increase consumption and advocacy.
* Lead and own aspects of engagements with accounts that include coordination with Account Management, Solutions Engineering, Services, Product Management, and Support.
* Continuously improve and apply your skills in the Success Management practice and your knowledge of how Bentley’s solutions impact the infrastructure industry.
* Communicate with account stakeholders, as well as Managers, peers, and other colleagues of the company in person, and/or by utilizing Microsoft Teams chat, calling, and meeting functions.
* Travel will be required for internal or external events, either in a Bentley office or on-site with accounts.
* This is an individual contributor role, but it involves significant collaboration and coordination with peers, leadership, and other colleagues.
* Requires sitting or standing at will while performing work on a computer (or any other physical requirements).

 **What You Bring to The Team:**

* Minimum of 7 years’ experience within an enterprise customer success role working with large value accounts or relevant training and/or experience.
* Experience in the Infrastructure Engineering space or Software Vendor industries.
* Experience and/or certification in engineering design, construction, project delivery, and asset performance or a deep, proven, Success Management background. Ideally both.
* Fluency in English and Swedish (written as well as verbal) including presentation skills at executive levels essential to the role.
* Experience in an advisory capacity in, or exposure to strategic projects involving software configuration, training, development, testing, and deployment.
* Familiar with organization change management aspects of delivering change programs.
* Strong interpersonal and team-building skills, possessing diplomacy and business judgment. Passionate when advocating and positioning positive change and calm and collected in times of unanticipated situations and (business) disruption.
* Skilled at situation assessment to determine next steps in complex environments and comfortable with confrontation (positive as well as negative, as long as it is constructive).
* Experience at, and being comfortable with, working both independently (remote/self-motivated) and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment as an active contributor is essential.

 **What We Offer:**

* A great Team and culture – please see our Recruitment Video.
* An exciting career as an integral part of a world-leading software company providing solutions for architecture, engineering, and construction.
* Competitive Salary and benefits.
* The opportunity to work within a global and diversely international team.
* A supportive and collaborative environment.
* Colleague Recognition Awards.

 **About Bentley Systems:**  

Bentley Systems (Nasdaq: BSY) is the infrastructure engineering software company. We provide innovative software to advance the world’s infrastructure – sustaining both the global economy and environment. Our industry-leading software solutions are used by professionals, and organizations of every size, for the design, construction, and operations of roads and bridges, rail and transit, water and wastewater, public works and utilities, buildings and campuses, mining, and industrial facilities. Our offerings, powered by the iTwin Platform for infrastructure digital twins, include MicroStation and Bentley Open applications for modeling and simulation, Seequent’s software for geoprofessionals, and Bentley Infrastructure Cloud encompassing ProjectWise for project delivery, SYNCHRO for construction management, and AssetWise for asset operations. Bentley Systems’ 5,200 colleagues generate annual revenues of more than $1 billion in 194 countries.


www.bentley.com

 **Equal Opportunity Employer:**  

Bentley is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers for employment all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, gender/gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, marital status, religion/belief, national origin, caste, age, or any other characteristic protected by local law or unrelated to job qualifications.

  

#LI-AK1  

#LI-REMOTE

title: Head of Strategy and M&A
description:
Sinch is a global Customer Communication Cloud company, powering meaningful conversations at scale across messaging, voice and email to help businesses deliver unified, personalized experiences – no matter the channel. More than 175,000 businesses, including many of the world’s largest tech companies, rely on us for their customer communication needs.
  
With 4,000 employees across 60+ countries, Sinch is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm with revenues exceeding 28 billion SEK. Since our founding in 2008, we’ve completed over 20 acquisitions, expanding our global reach and product portfolio.
  
We are looking for a dynamic Head of Strategy and M&A to lead our strategic agenda, drive organic growth through M&A, and shape the future of our business by taking on diverse, high-impact initiatives across strategy, M&A, and business transformation.
  
  

About the role
  
As the Head of Strategy and M&A, you will lead the development and execution of Sinch’s corporate strategy and M&A strategies. This includes identifying growth opportunities, leading M&A transactions end-to-end, overseeing integration, and supporting ongoing portfolio evaluations to guide investment, optimization, or divestment decisions. You will own Sinch Long Range Planning process (LRP) and yearly business planning process. Additionally, you will lead selected strategic projects and cross functional initiatives that are critical to Sinch’s agenda.
  
Success in this role requires balancing strategic vision with operational execution and building relationships across all levels of the organization. You will work closely with CFO, CEO, CPO, Regional EVPs, the Board of Directors and the founders of Sinch. This is a hands-on leadership role where you will manage a small, skilled team while directly driving strategic initiatives, complex transactions, and acquired businesses performance.
  
You will operate across a wide range of topics, some well-defined, others requiring creativity and adaptability as new challenges and opportunities emerge. This role is highly cross-functional and offers a rare opportunity to influence the trajectory of a global technology leader.
  
This role is based at our HQ in Stockholm, Sweden and reports to our Group CFO.
  
  

Key Responsibilities
  
Lead Corporate Strategy
  
* Lead the development of Sinch’s long-term corporate strategy, working closely with executive leadership and key stakeholders across the global organization.
* Lead the Long Range Planning (LRP) process to define growth priorities, investment areas, and strategic focus.
* Lead the annual business planning process, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives and financial targets.
* Lead selected strategic corporate projects, that’s on the agenda of the group, driving impact on critical priorities.
* Maintain a strong understanding of tech industry trends, market dynamics, and emerging technologies shaping our sector.
* Support ongoing evaluation of Sinch’s core and adjacent businesses, driving decisions on where to invest, optimize, or divest.
* Provide data-driven strategic insights to guide resource allocation and future growth initiatives.


Lead M&A
  
* Provide the Group Leadership team and Board of Directors with strategic recommendations on M&A priorities.
* Define and execute an M&A strategy aligned with Sinch’s growth objectives.
* Identify and evaluate acquisition opportunities with business owners.
* Lead the entire transaction lifecycle: sourcing, evaluation, due diligence, negotiations, execution, and post-merger integration, in tight collaboration with business owners.
* Monitor the performance of acquired businesses to strategic alignment and value delivery.
* Develop and execute plans for, and monitor the development of, non-core assets.
* Lead and support divestiture processes, ensuring non-core assets are exited efficiently and profitably.
* Collaborate with the Finance, Legal, and other key stakeholders on deal structuring and maintain strategic relationships with banks, advisors, and key partners.


Stakeholder Engagement
  
* Build trusted relationships with executive leadership, regional teams and functional heads across the organization.
* Take on special projects or cross-functional initiatives as needed, adapting quickly to evolving business priorities.
* Lead by example – mentoring your team while remaining hands on in analysis, decision-making, and execution.
* Foster a collaborative, inclusive, and results-driven culture that attracts and develops top talent.


**Requirements:**  

You are a strategic, hands-on leader with experience in tech-driven environments, combining corporate development, the full M&A lifecycle, and strategic leadership. You’re energized by variety and thrive in global, fast-paced settings where priorities evolve. You bring strong analytical skills, sound commercial judgment, and the ability to build relationships and influence stakeholders at all levels.
  
* Experience in corporate strategy and M&A, ideally within the technology, SaaS, or communications sectors.
* Strong M&A execution skills with a proven track record leading complex, cross-border deals and integrations.
* Strategic mindset with the ability to assess businesses, drive portfolio optimization, and support divestitures.
* Strong leadership skills with experience building collaborative, high-performing teams while staying hands-on.
* Exceptional relationship-building and stakeholder management skills, including at the executive and Board level.
* Strong project management skills and the ability to juggle multiple initiatives in a dynamic environment.
* Academic background in Finance, Engineering, Business, or a related field (MBA or M.Sc. preferred), though proven experience is valued most highly.


Our hiring process
  
We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
  
We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Vi söker vår nästa Teamchef inom Cloud (GCP/Azure)
description:
Arbetsuppgifter
Vi söker dig som är en erfaren mjukvaruutvecklare och molnarkitekt **inom GCP** eller **Azure** med en passion för att bygga framtidssäkra lösningar och inspirera andra. I rollen kombinerar du arbete som konsult med en roll som teamchef, en roll där du hjälper både kunder och kollegor att bli framgångsrika. Cirka 20% av din tid roll innefattar att växa, inspirera och utveckla ditt team och verksamheten i södra Sverige tillsammans med övriga individer i den lokala ledningsgruppen. Resterande tid möjliggör du våra kunder att bli lyckosamma i sina molntransformationer på olika sätt! En roll för en multikonstnär med starkt självledarskap och erfarenhet av att leda team och leveranser.


**Forefront:**

Sedan 2008 har vi vuxit till över 550 kollegor med en mångfald av erfarenheter och kompetens inom managementkonsulting, design och mjukvaruutveckling. Vi finns på 11 kontor i Sverige och sedan 2024, även i USA.


Vi strävar efter att bli Sveriges bästa arbetsplats genom att uppskatta våra olikheter, ständigt blicka framåt och skapa en organisation som är lika modig som klok. Vår övertygelse är att tekniken ger oss oanade möjligheter – för att utveckla människor, skapa bättre affärer och bygga hållbara samhällen.


Vi drivs av att förena människa och teknik och med gemensamma visioner och större ambitioner, stödjer vi en bred kundkrets på deras digitaliseringsresor. Genom våra nära partnerskap med Google och Microsoft ligger vi i teknisk framkant och erbjuder utmärkta förutsättningar för att hjälpa våra kunder med deras digitaliseringsprojekt.


**Dina ansvarsområden:**

* Designa och implementera skalbara, distribuerade och kvalitativa system som drar nytta av PaaS-tjänster och de unika fördelarna med hyperscalers som GCP och Azure. För att prata klarspråk, du hjälper och möjliggör kunder bli lyckosamma i deras nyttjande av en plattform under olika delar av en molntransformation.
* Säkerställa att våra kunder får rätt lösningar för just deras situation genom att dra nytta av din och vår insyn i Google och Microsofts tekniska utveckling.
* Vara en möjliggörare som bygger vidare på ett erfaret team och stöttar nya förmågor, exempelvis inom vårt traineeprogram.
* Bidra till affärsutveckling och rekrytering i Region Syd (Malmö, Halmstad, Växjö).
* Delta i den operativa ledningsgruppen för regionen och bidra till våra strategiska mål.

**Vi letar efter dig som:**

* Har erfarenhet av att bygga moderna, komplexa och distribuerade system med fokus på kvalitet, prestanda och skalbarhet.
* Har djup erfarenhet av att nyttja PaaS-tjänster och designa lösningar som optimerar fördelarna med hyperscalers som GCP och Azure.
* Vill ligga i teknisk framkant och använda vår nära relation och partnerskap med Google och Microsoft för att skapa innovativa lösningar.
* Är konsultmässig, och därmed nyfiken, positiv, modig, pragmatisk, flexibel, framåtlutad, samt trivs i framåtlutade produktorganisationer. Har ledarerfarenhet eller en stark vilja att utvecklas inom ledarskap.
* Kommunicerar väl på svenska och engelska, sprider energi och skapar trivsel omkring dig.

Kvalifikationer
**Vi erbjuder:**


* Möjligheten att forma kultur och gemenskap i en växande region.
* Stark vidareutveckling av dina nuvarande förmågor inom teknik, affär och ledarskap
* Tillgång till tekniska insikter och innovation genom våra partnerskap med Google och Microsoft.
* Stöd i din personliga och professionella utveckling, med tillgång till coaching, utbildningar och nätverk.
* Flexibla arbetstider och fokus på work-life balance.
* En arbetsplats där vi stöttar, firar och utvecklar varandra.
* En kombination av fast lön och resultatbaserad ersättning.
Vi är ett stöttande, varmt och framåtsträvande team som tror på att göra riktiga avtryck – både för våra kunder och varandra. Är du vår nästa ledare och kollega?

Om företaget
Forefront Consulting är ett verksamhets- och IT-konsultbolag med drygt 550 anställda. Med kontor på 11 orter i Sverige och USA, guidar vi företag och organisationer i det digitala landskapet och övriga transformationer.



Oavsett om uppdraget avser affärsverksamhet, teknologiska plattformar eller designlösningar är utgångspunkten alltid att först skapa en samsyn kring nödvändiga förändringar för att sedan kunna realisera dessa på bästa sätt för avsedd effekt.


.Våra värderingar är vårt DNA


AvsiktAvsikten är motorn i vårt arbete och medvetenheten om var målet ligger. Den ger oss styrkan att ifrågasätta det till synes uppenbara, lägger kraft bakom våra påståenden och motiverar våra beslut.


AvtryckAvtryck säger något om vår starka ambition att skapa förändring. Att göra verklig skillnad. Både i aktuella kundprojekt och i vår omvärld i stort. Vi är stolta över att våra kunder talar väl om oss. Och vi blir glada när vår verksamhet ses som en positiv förebild av kollegorna i branschen.


InsiktDet är i insikten som vårt arbete börjar. För att nå dit krävs tålamod, empati och ödmjukhet, samt nyfikenhet nog att kunna ta in flera olika perspektiv och väga samman informationen. Insikt handlar om att verkligen förstå problemet innan vi försöker lösa det.


TillsammansTillsammans är den väg vi väljer för att nå de mål vi siktar mot. Ordet ger uttryck för vårt sökande efter mervärdet i en gemensam strävan. Det handlar om att befinna sig jämsides med kunder och kollegor. Utan prestige och onödiga hierarkier, men med delaktighet, ansvar och arbetsglädje.


UtsiktUtsikt beskriver både en position och den medvetna ansträngning som är nödvändig för att ta sig dit. Begreppet påminner oss också om att goda rådgivare är öppna och ödmjuka. Det handlar om att se och att särskilja, med fokus på kundens affärsnytta.


Om företaget
Forefront Consulting är ett verksamhets- och IT-konsultbolag med drygt 550 anställda. Med kontor på 11 orter i Sverige och USA, guidar vi företag och organisationer i det digitala landskapet och övriga transformationer.



Oavsett om uppdraget avser affärsverksamhet, teknologiska plattformar eller designlösningar är utgångspunkten alltid att först skapa en samsyn kring nödvändiga förändringar för att sedan kunna realisera dessa på bästa sätt för avsedd effekt.
