title: Head of Corporate Communications
description:
We are seeking an experienced Head of Corporate Communications to lead both internal and external communications for group.one, a portfolio of brands specialising in web hosting, website building, and domain name registration. This is a high-impact role within a private equity-backed environment, growing both organically and with M&A, where we focus on helping small businesses succeed online. We are seeking an individual who can operate strategically with executive stakeholders and lead tactical execution across multiple communication channels.


The Head of Communications will work closely with the C Suite to develop and implement communication strategies targeting investors, talent, partners, potential acquisition targets, and media. In addition, this role will collaborate with HR and other key functions to lead the internal communications strategy, ensuring clear, consistent, and engaging messaging across the organization. A Communications Manager will report to this position to focus on internal communications, complementing the Head of Communications’ broader scope of responsibilities.


The ideal candidate is equally comfortable with strategic thinking as they are with hands-on execution, and capable of managing both high-level corporate messaging and day-to-day communication activities that drive employee engagement, customer satisfaction, and shareholder value.

**Your Key Responsibilities**
-----------------------------

* **Investor Relations:** Craft transparent messaging for investors, working closely with the CEO and CFO on reports, presentations, and updates.
* **Media & PR:** Enhance brand visibility through media strategies, thought leadership, and crisis communication. Manage press releases, corporate social media, and major announcements.
* **Employee Engagement:** Develop internal communication strategies that inspire, inform, and align employees. Oversee execution and performance on relevant channels.
* **Leadership Communications:** Partner with HR and executives to ensure clear, engaging communication at all levels.
* **Crisis:** Lead communications during key company transitions or challenges, including coaching and supporting leaders.
* **Content Creation:** Oversee the development of corporate materials, presentations, speeches, and reports.
* **Performance Metrics:** Track and analyze media coverage, LinkedIn growth, employer brand perception, and employee feedback.

**Qualifications**
------------------

* 10+ years of experience in corporate communications, public relations, or related fields, with at least 5 years in a leadership role.
* Proven track record of managing both internal and external communications for a fast-paced, growth-oriented organization. Experience working in private equity-owned companies or other environments that emphasize shareholder value is highly regarded.
* Demonstrated success in media relations, investor relations, and strategic corporate messaging in an international environment.

**About you**
-------------


You bring a strategic mindset with the ability to execute hands-on, delivering high-quality and impactful communications. Your exceptional written and verbal communication skills allow you to craft clear, compelling messages tailored to diverse audiences. Comfortable working with senior leadership, you provide expert guidance on communication strategies and best practices.


With strong organisational skills, you excel at managing multiple projects within deadline. Your deep understanding of digital communication tools, internal systems, media outreach, and social media strategies ensures effective messaging across all platforms.


A natural collaborator, you work seamlessly across functions—including executives, HR, product teams, and marketing—to drive integrated communication efforts. As a leader, you have experience mentoring and developing teams, fostering professional growth and high performance.

**About us**
------------


group.one is a leading European provider of online presence, cloud hosting, and digital marketing services. Over 2 million customers trust us with their online success. Our global team consists of 1 500+ employees operating from nearly 20 locations across 15 countries, with our headquarters in Sweden. Thanks to the support of our partners Cinven and Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan, we are steadily expanding the group's service portfolio and geographical footprint.


When you join group.one, you become a part of a global network that values collaboration, growth, and excellence. Join us in creating online success stories!

**We don't care whether you are female, male or diverse, where you come from, how old you are, what colour your skin is or what you believe in. For us, the focus is on mutual respect, personal appreciation as well as fun and motivation at work. Develop yourself - your personality - because we focus on you as a person and team member.**

**We want to continue to grow with you. That's why we look forward to getting to know you.**

title: Technical Information Security Officer
description:
We’re not just any bank – we’re Qred, a cutting-edge, tech-driven force on a mission to revolutionize financing for small businesses in 7 markets across northern Europe. With our innovative solutions, we’re making it easier for entrepreneurs to access the capital they need to grow and thrive. As we scale, we are now looking for a Technical Information Security Officer to be part of our journey to transform the financial landscape for entrepreneurs.  

  

**About the role**


We are seeking a skilled and proactive Technical Information Security Officer (ISO) to join our team. You will play a crucial role in ensuring our compliance with regulations and maintaining the highest standards of information security. Your technical expertise will be essential in automating compliance tasks and managing security controls.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Ensure Information Security compliance with the DORA regulation and ICT regulations.
* Manage and maintain security controls, including evidence collection and reporting.
* Develop and implement scripts or utilize low-code tools to automate compliance processes and evidence collections.
* Work within our tech stack (Jira, GitHub, GRC tools, Slack, Freshservice, Google Workspace, AWS) to streamline compliance and security processes.
* Conduct regular security assessments and support external audits.
* Work closely with our SecOps team, Compliance, and development teams to ensure security initiatives are implemented and live up to regulatory needs.

**Desired Experience:**

* Proven experience working in regulated environments, preferably within the financial sector.
* Minimum of 2 years of experience in information security or a related field.
* Understanding and experience working with cybersecurity frameworks like DORA, NIS2 or ISO27001.
* Technical proficiency in scripting or utilizing low-code automation tools.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (ideally AWS) and SaaS environments (ideally Google Workspace).
* Familiarity with GRC tools, Jira, and GitHub.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.

**Why join us?**


This is a unique opportunity to join a growing fintech company that is redefining financial services for small businesses in Northern Europe. You’ll work with a passionate and innovative team, participating in creating an environment where employees thrive and contribute to a shared vision of success.

**One last thing**

This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.

*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*

title: On-Site Technical Support Engineer
company_industry: IT System Training and Support, IT System Operations and Maintenance, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Location: Stockholm, Sweden** 




**Salary: Competitive** 




  





**Join the Options Technical Support Team!**




  










**Working for Options** 




  





  





 Developing and engaging our people is a strategic priority for our business. We are looking for talented individuals to join our team and contribute to Options’ future growth and success.
 



 We want to hear from candidates that are motivated, self-driven and have a passion to learn and develop their skills in the world of financial technology.
 



  










**Who are we?** 




  





 Options is the largest global financial technology company headquartered in Belfast. We are at the forefront of banking and trading infrastructure, serving clients globally with offices in New York, Chicago, Toronto, London, Cambridge, Paris, Hong Kong, Tokyo, Singapore, and Auckland. At Options, our services are woven into the hottest trends in global tech, including high-performance Networking, Cloud, Security, and AI (Artificial Intelligence).
 



  










**Why Options?** 




  










 •Global travel: We have offices in New York, Chicago, Toronto, London, Belfast, Dublin and across Asia.
 



 •Continuous career development opportunities: We provide professional skills development and technical training.
 



 •The chance to be a part of a self-sufficient, successful team: The Options team operates in a fast-paced environment with endless opportunities for innovation and forward-thinking.
 



 •Competitive salary: In addition to a competitive salary, Options reward employees with a range of bonus incentives and employee benefits.
 



  





  





**The Role** 




  










 As an Options Technology Support On-Site Engineer, you will play a critical role in supporting our options trading operations and technology infrastructure. You will work closely with the client’s technology team, and other technology professionals to ensure the smooth operation of our options trading platform. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment and contribute to the success of a global alternative investment firm. We are seeking a talented and motivated Options Technology Support On-Site Engineer to join our dynamic team in Stockholm.
 



  





  





**Typical Job duties would include:** 




  










 •On-Site Technical Support: Serve as the primary technical point of contact for the client, providing on-site support for all options trading technology systems.
 



 •System Monitoring and Maintenance: Monitor the health and performance of internal systems, ensuring that they are operating optimally. Conduct regular maintenance activities, including software updates and configuration changes, to keep systems up to date.
 



 •Troubleshooting and Issue Resolution: Diagnose and resolve technical issues. Escalate complex problems to appropriate internal teams and coordinate with them to find timely solutions.
 



 •Incident Management: Respond to incidents and service requests raised by the client, adhering to defined service level agreements (SLAs) and following established incident management processes. Document incidents and their resolutions accurately.
 



 •Client Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with key client stakeholders, understanding their requirements and proactively addressing their concerns. Serve as a technical advisor to the client.
 



 •System Enhancements and Upgrades: Collaborate with the Options Technology development team to implement system enhancements and upgrades. Participate in testing and validation activities to ensure smooth deployment.
 



 •Training and Knowledge Sharing: Conduct training sessions for the client's technical staff to enhance their understanding of the options trading systems. Share technical knowledge and best practices with both internal teams and the client to foster continuous improvement.
 



  










**We’re looking for someone who has technical proficiency in:** 




  










 •Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
 



 •It is desirable to have specifically strong knowledge of 365, Azure, Endpoint Management, Device Deployment. AV troubleshooting.
 



 •Experience: Minimum of 1-2 years of experience in a similar role within the financial services industry, providing on-site technical support and troubleshooting.
 



 •Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to analyse complex technical issues, identify root causes, and propose effective solutions. Strong troubleshooting and diagnostic skills with the ability to handle high-pressure situations calmly.
 



 •Communication and Interpersonal Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to convey technical information clearly and concisely. Strong interpersonal skills to build relationships with clients and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
 



 •Client Focus: Demonstrated ability to understand and fulfil client requirements while providing exceptional customer service. Proactive in anticipating client needs and exceeding their expectations.
 



 •Adaptability and Flexibility: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. Willingness to adapt to changing priorities and take on additional responsibilities as required.
 








  





**We’re also looking for candidates with:** 




  










 •Strong research, writing and communication skills.
 



 •Exceptional organisational skills and strong attention to detail.
 



 •Desire to travel and see the world.
 



 •Ability to work independently and manage your own projects in a professional manner.
 



 •A passion for innovation and the financial technology sector.
 



 •Project management skills and proven ability to manage own workload.
 



  










**Certifications:** 




  





  





 CompTIA A+, Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate (MCSA), or similar certifications are advantageous but not required.

title: Experienced Consultant within Identity & Access Management
description:
Deloitte is a leading global provider of audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, tax, and related services. During its 175-year history, our organization has grown tremendously in both scale and capabilities. Deloitte currently has approximately 457,000 people in more than 150 countries and territories, and serves four out of five Fortune Global 500® companies. Yet, our shared culture and mission—to make an impact that matters—remains unchanged.
   

  

  




**Job Description**

**Job Description**



* The role involves working with both technical and/or functional aspects related to identity & access management. For example solution implementation (technical) and/or IAM strategy, role management and process design (functional).
* You may work with senior stakeholders to assess, design and implement sustainable solutions, operating processes and people models to address key and evolving risks in the field of identity governance and access management.
* You may also analyse processes, documentation, and workflows through conducting walkthroughs with client stakeholders performing security and human resource related duties, perform gap analysis and identify and prioritize process improvements based on current risk of components adding professional insight based on regulatory requirements and industry best practices.
* You will plan engagement objectives, strategize to comply with professional standards, and mitigate risks inherent in the engagement.
* You will work with leading IAM products and technologies such as SailPoint, Saviynt, Okta, CyberArk or Microsoft etc.
* You will review work performed by the engagement team and maintain relationships with client account leadership to manage expectations of service, including work products, timing, and services to be delivered.


**Qualifications**
* Experience of 3-5 years working in the IAM field.
* Experience in planning, implementing, and managing identity and access management solutions (such SailPoint, Saviynt, Okta, CyberArk or Microsoft).
* Experience in working on one or more IAM engagements, in preferably all/most of the phases - requirements gathering, analysis, design, development, testing, deployment, or application support.
* Advanced documentation and presentation skills.
* Well-versed with software development life cycle processes.
* Exposure to process frameworks and methodologies.
* Prior experience (and interest) in working with broader cyber capabilities/projects is considered as plus.
* Professional cybersecurity relevant certifications such as CISSP or CISM is considered a plus.
* Familiar with security concepts and technologies in the wider Identity and Access management space (Logical Access Controls, LDAP and RBAC, Authentication solutions, PKI concepts, etc.).
* Fluent in English. Fluency in Swedish is considered a plus.
* Job Location – Stockholm or Gothenburg.


**Additional Information**

 We offer
   

  

  




* Access to a global firm and a powerful network of experienced colleagues
* Great possibilities for you to develop yourself and our business
* Many opportunities for exchange of experiences, training and personal development
* Access to one of the world's largest consultancy organizations, global training programs and specialist networks
* A chance of becoming a key player with a fast growing career, in the national and global consulting arena
* Competitive compensation and benefits


 How to apply
   

  

  


 You apply online. Please submit your CV, cover letter and university grades as part of your application.
   

  

  





 As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The background check process is carried out in collaboration with ToFindOut. https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/
   

  

 Questions?
   

  

  





 For questions regarding the role or application process, please contact Anna Cygnaeus, acygnaeus@deloitte.se
   

  

  





 We are looking forward to your application!
   

  

  





**What impact will you make?**




 Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

title: Data and Analytics summer intern 2025
description:
Velory is now looking for a talent to join the data and analytics team from May 2025 (4-6 months). We are looking for applicants from holders of EU residence permits who are eligible to travel to and work in Stockholm.
   

  

**This is Velory**
 Velory enables companies to buy and manage their IT in an automated, secure and circular way.
   

  

* IT Lifecycle Management: streamlining IT workflows from purchase to end of life.
* Employee Empowerment: unleashing productivity from the first day to the last


 What you will do
   

  

 You Will Be Part Of The Data And Operations Team And Interact Frequently With Sales, Product And Finance Teams. We Welcome And Seek a Dedicated Intern, Ready To Surprise Us With Creative Ideas, And Willing To Take The Lead On Small Projects. Here Are The Main Tasks You Will Perform
   

  

* Data
* Set up automated reporting
* Make analyses of our business processes and customer interactions
* Build models of customer behaviour
* Office duty


 As an intern you will help out on various other tasks, including writing texts, create product content, doing research.
   

  

 You will also be helping out keeping the office nice, turn on the lights, water the plants, buy beers for office After Work parties ie.
   

  

* Special project


 If you want to, or your university requires you to, we will help you formulate a project that can be carried out alongside internship tasks during your time with us.
   

  

**You are**
 Ideally a Business, Finance, Science or Engineering student with an interest in technology, data and analytics
   

  

 Open-minded, willing to work in an international environment and meet new people.
   

  

 Hardworking: A multitasker with a keen eye for detail.
   

  

 Enthusiastic: You always have new ideas and try to implement them no matter what you are facing.
   

  

 Passionate about disruptive innovation and digital solutions.
   

  

 First-hand experience in a startup is valued.
   

  

 You can write SQL queries, work with Excel formulas and pivot tables
   

  

 Knowledge of web analytics is a plus but not a requirement
   

  

 Able to use LLM chatbots (ChatGPT ie.) but not pass on your prompting results without understanding them
   

  

 Fluent in English (Swedish is a plus but not necessary).
   

  

**The internship**
 As an intern with Velory you will join a fast moving Swedish company on it's growth journey. You will work on finding solutions to new problems, and make the solutions scalable together with the other company teams, such as product team and finance team. You will both be driving your own and very challenging projects, as well as doing easier day-to-day tasks.
   

  

**Examples Of Tasks**
 Build a concept for a CO2 emission effect model on behalf of a customer, showing the effect of choosing different computers and leasing contract lengths. The concept should be able to scale.
   

  

 Write SQL queries to report NPS and CSAT scores by company on a monthly basis
   

  

 Pick up the newspaper on your way into the office every day, turn on lights and office Spotify playlist at 08.00
   

  

 Build a QA testing schema for an important product launch
   

  

 Find more efficient ways to categorize support tickets that can be shared with partners using the same ticket handling system (Zendesk)
   

  

**What We Offer**
 Travel cost recovery to Sweden/Stockholm if you are based in another country
   

  

 Monthly stipend of 10 000 SEK (pre tax)
   

  

 Gym with trainer every weekday
   

  

 iPhone and MacBook as your personal productivity tools
   

  

 2 paid vacation days offered per month worked

title: Enterprise Sales Consultant
description:
**About the Role** 

 ChainTraced is a fast-paced global tech start-up/scale-up that provides a SaaS solution that enables efficient and secure sharing of product data across the value chain – from raw material to end-customer product. Our clients are industrial companies worldwide that rely on various metals in the production process. With ChainTraced, they can establish more efficient, secure, and scalable processes for their Quality and Sustainability efforts, while simultaneously enhancing their own product offerings and improve customer & supplier relationships. We are committed to reshape the future of manufacturing, and we’re inviting you to be a part of this exciting journey!
 



  





 ChainTraced is seeking a dynamic and experienced Enterprise Sales Consultant to join our team. This role is pivotal in driving consultancy-led sales to enterprise clients within the manufacturing industry. Additionally, you will be responsible for managing Proof-of-Concepts (PoCs) and pilot projects to initiate and secure new enterprise clients.
 



 The role requires experience in selling software or consulting services to senior roles within procurement, sustainability and quality management. You can generate and close opportunities independently and together with technical sales and implementation consultants to deliver solution for complex customer challenges.
 



 ‍
 


**Responsibilities** 

 ·        Lead consultancy-led sales efforts targeting enterprise clients in the manufacturing sector.
 



 ·        Developand maintain strong relationships with key decision-makers and stakeholderswithin target enterprises.
 



 ·        Identify client needs and propose tailored solutions that align with their business objectives.
 



 ·        Manage and execute Proof-of-Concepts (PoCs) and pilot projects to demonstrate the value of ChainTraced's digital traceability solution.
 



 ·        Collaborate with implementation partners and product development to ensure successful implementation and delivery of PoCs and pilots.
 



  




**Qualifications** 

 ·        Proven track record of successful enterprise sales for SaaS / IT solutions or consultancy services within manufacturing / steel industry or leading positions within sustainability or quality management.
 



 ·        Strong understanding of manufacturing processes, challenges, and solutions.
 



 ·        Experience managing Proof-of-Concepts (PoCs) and pilot projects.
 



 ·        Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
 



 ·        Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team.
 



 ·        Preference for candidates with a background in management consultancy or LCA (Life Cycle Assessment).
 



 ·        Preference for candidates with Bachelor's or Master’s degree
 



 If you area structured doer, passionate about driving growth, and thrive in a fast-paced, customer-focused environment, we invite you to apply for the position at ChainTraced. Join us in revolutionizing the digital landscape and take your career to new heights.
 



  




**What We Offer** 

 ·        We provide you with a competitive salary
 



 ·        We offer generous equity packages to our employees
 



 ·        Personal development and impact is a key part of our growth journey
 



 ·        30 days of vacation for fulltime employment
 



 ·        We provide wellness allowance for full time employment
 



 ·        The opportunity to be part of a great culture & team
 



 ·        Flexible working conditions

title: Associate, IT Strategy Consulting
description:
**Who We Are**
 At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward – always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.
   

  

**The Role**
 Do you have a passion for driving meaningful change through technology? Are you a master of IT strategy and eager to make an impact on our customers? We're seeking a talented IT Strategy Consultant to join our team for multi-disciplinary, complex consulting engagements.
   

  

 As an IT Strategy Consultant at Kyndryl, you'll be responsible for delivering value to customers and Kyndryl by applying deep domain, technology, and industry expertise, consulting techniques, and cognitive approaches to analyze issues and create innovative solutions. You'll establish milestones, quality targets, and manage the work of others while possessing strong communication skills to articulate the impact and business benefits of your solutions and manage stakeholder expectations.
   

  

 In this role, you will use your experience and knowledge in guiding customers in their adoption of both major cloud and non-cloud technologies, including virtualization and containers. You will advise customers on technology options and help them make strategic choices and decisions. Additionally, you will have experience capturing and prioritizing complex requirements and resolving conflicting requirements. But that's not all – our IT Strategy Consultants have seen how organizations benefit from change and most importantly, know how to plan for it – giving our partners and customers the confidence to make a convincing case for it.
   

  

 As a trusted and experienced Consultant, you will be responsible for a vast number of essential technical components such as analyzing the customer's current state, defining IT Strategy including key outcomes, designing conceptual solutions, planning and executing design and implementation work (with support from technical specialists), and accounting for time, cost, and quality targets. You will also develop IP and own specific assets, tools, and white papers articulating point of views in a specific domain, assemble and lead a team of consultants and architects, and facilitate and capture lessons learned from engagements to update methodologies and assets.
   

  

 Lastly, as a transformational catalyst, you'll spearhead comprehensive modernization programs encompassing people, culture, process, and technology, revolutionizing organizations from within. Join us at Kyndryl and redefine the very essence of IT strategy consultancy.
   

  

 Your Future at Kyndryl
   

  

 As an IT Strategy Consultant at Kyndryl you will join the Kyndryl Consultant Profession, working with other Kyndryl Consultants, Architects, Project Managers, and cross-functional Technical Subject Matter Experts. Whether you want to lead multi-disciplined teams as a Senior Strategy Consultant or delve into transforming Fortune 500 companies as a Strategy and Transformation Consultant – you’ll have access to unlimited opportunities with Kyndryl.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You’re good at what you do and possess the required experience to prove it. However, equally as important – you have a growth mindset; keen to drive your own personal and professional development. You are customer-focused – someone who prioritizes customer success in their work. And finally, you’re open and borderless – naturally inclusive in how you work with others.
   

  

**Required Skills And Experience**
* Consulting experience with an IT professional service “big 4” firm or similar background focused on IT strategy enablement
* Knowledge of major cloud technologies including virtualization, containers, networking etc. on different cloud platforms
* Subject matter expertise in at least three domains (e.g., cloud computing, IT strategy, infrastructure, IT operations, applications, enterprise architecture, solution architecture, automation, data management, AI/ML, IoT and cloud governance models) to advise on industry-leading solutions
* Data modeling and analytical experience using common tools (e.g., Excel, Tableau)
* Issue-based analysis determined and structured data to collect, and produced structured conclusions, recommendations, and roadmaps
* Knowledge of IT Operating Model and Process Frameworks
* Awareness of broad competencies and depth in specific competency areas (IT strategy, enterprise architecture, solution architecture, process reengineering, automation)
* Ability to lead/facilitate workshops and interviews, great presentation skills
* Understanding of DevSecOps, Agile, Scrum construct to identify inefficiencies through readiness assessments and development of strategies and approaches to optimize the implementation of IT or cloud resources and capabilities


**Preferred Skills And Experience**
* Experience in the areas of IT and/or cloud technology architecture, service management and/or resiliency
* ITSM and ITIL or COBIT certification
* Business case skills, ROI, and TCO analysis to validate IT strategy
* Experience leading workshops and interviews for discovery and assessment engagements


**Being You**
 Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it’s how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we’re not doing it single-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you – and everyone next to you – the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That’s the Kyndryl Way.
   

  

**What You Can Expect**
 With state-of-the-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter – wherever you are in your life journey. Our employee learning programs give you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Skillsoft, and many more. Through our company-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you, we want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed.
   

  

**Get Referred!**
 If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ‘How Did You Hear About Us’ during the application process, select ‘Employee Referral’ and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.

title: Specialists in Migration and Forced Displacement
description:
**Senior and Junior Specialists in Migration and Forced Displacement**




 NTU is searching for consultants (short and long-term) for an upcoming EU tender in Sub-Saharan Africa,
 *Technical support (including on ‘evaluations’) to manage the Support Measures (Technical Assistance Component) for the Multiannual Indicative Programme.* 




**Location:** 
 Location: Sub-Saharan Africa and Europe (Remote/Field-Based)
 



**Duration:** 
 01/09/2025 – 30/09/2029
 



**Key Responsibilities:** 




*☝️* 
**Migration Policy & Governance** 



* Support
 **policy development and institutional reforms** 
 to improve migration governance.
* Strengthen
 **national and regional migration frameworks** 
 in line with international conventions.
* Work with stakeholders such as
 **IGAD, AU, UNHCR, IOM, and national governments** 
 to facilitate cross-border cooperation.



*☝️* 
**Forced Displacement & Protection** 



* Develop
 **comprehensive protection and assistance frameworks** 
 for asylum seekers, refugees, IDPs, and returnees.
* Strengthen
 **national asylum systems** 
 and promote
 **durable solutions** 
 (local integration, voluntary return, resettlement).
* Support programs integrating
 **climate resilience and gender-sensitive approaches** 
 in displacement responses.



*☝️* 
**Combatting Human Trafficking & Migrant Smuggling** 



* Enhance
 **border management and law enforcement cooperation** 
 to prevent trafficking and smuggling.
* Strengthen
 **regional and international judicial cooperation** 
 to dismantle trafficking networks.
* Improve
 **protection mechanisms** 
 for victims of trafficking and vulnerable migrants, with a focus on
 **women and children** 
 .



*☝️* 
**Humanitarian & Development Nexus** 



* Promote
 **inclusive social protection systems** 
 that provide
 **access to healthcare, education, and decent work** 
 for displaced populations.
* Implement
 **livelihood and resilience-building programs** 
 for migrants, refugees, and host communities.
* Facilitate
 **multi-stakeholder coordination** 
 among governments, CSOs, development banks, and the private sector.



*☝️* 
**Capacity Building & Stakeholder Engagement** 



* Train
 **government officials, civil society actors, and law enforcement agencies** 
 on migration management and protection.
* Strengthen the capacity of
 **local and regional migration governance bodies** 
 .
* Enhance
 **public-private partnerships** 
 to improve migration service delivery and sustainable solutions.



  





**Key Requirements** 



* **Senior Specialists:**
 Minimum
 **12-15 years of experience** 
 in migration policy, refugee protection, humanitarian response, forced displacement programs, program implementation, migration governance, or refugee assistance.
* **Junior Specialists:**
 Minimum
 **5 -7 years of experience** 
 in migration policy, refugee protection, humanitarian response, forced displacement programs, program implementation, migration governance, or refugee assistance.
* Strong knowledge of
 **AU, EU, UNHCR, IOM, IGAD, and regional migration policies** 
 .
* Experience working with
 **government agencies, UN organizations, NGOs, and development institutions;**
* Understanding of
 **migration data collection, border security, international legal frameworks, and human rights mechanisms** 
 .
* Fluency in
 **English and/or French** 
 ; knowledge of other languages spoken in Sub-Saharan Africa is a plus.



  





 If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply and upload your CV via LinkedIn or sent to recruitment@ntu.eu. Only the candidates with relevant experience will be contacted.

title: Senior Lösningsarkitekt
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
* Leda och driva framtagandet av IT-lösningar på ett korrekt sätt baserat på behovsbild och med förutsättningar från existerande IT-tjänster i organisationen, utifrån såväl ett verksamhets- som tekniskt perspektiv.
* Ansvara om utformningen av applikationer och integrationer, arkitektoniska principer, IT-säkerhetsarkitektur och riktlinjer kring standarder. Lösningsarkitekten ska säkerställa att den tekniska lösningen överensstämmer med de krav som domänarkitekten anger.
* Lösningsarkitekten samverkar med verksamhetsarkitekter och utvecklingsteam (mjukvaruarkitekt), samt med enterprise- och infrastrukturarkitekter.
* Analysera behov (funktionella, icke funktionella) ur såväl strategiskt, taktiskt som operativt perspektiv. Du dokumenterar de icke-funktionella kraven och kraven på SLA:er.
* Stödja initiativ i både projekt och förvaltning från idéstadie, kravställning, design, implementation, drift och förvaltning och under processens gång. Du säkerställer det aktuella förändringsinitiativets framgång samt stödjer förvaltningsetablering av applikationer eller nya lösningar.
* Stödja som expert för en eller flera IT-system/applikationer i diskussion med enhetschefen, domänarkitekten och förvaltningsledaren runt nya lösningar eller utveckling av befintliga system.
* Ta fram en uppdaterad ADD (TOGAF) och föredrar den tillsammans med domänarkitekten för Arkitekturforum. Exempel på leverabler: behovsanalys, kravbeskrivningar, scenariobeskrivningar/användningsfall och lösningsdesign (arkitekturbeskrivning).
* Kommunicera och förankra rekommenderade lösningar och vägval hos relevanta målgrupper, på såväl strategisk nivå som operativ nivå.


**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Högskole/universitetsutbildning om minst 180hp inom systemvetenskap, IT, eller ingenjörsutbildning.
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet som IT-lösningsarkitekt.
* Arbetat minst ett år inom en organisation som har en IT-organisation med mer än 200 personer.


**Meriterande**
* Arbetslivserfarenhet från att ha varit huvudansvarig för arkiteturleverabler som t.ex. Architecture Definition Documents, inom minst ett projekt.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet som arkitekt från minst ett projekt där ISO 27001 har tillämpats.
* Certifiering inom IT-arkitektur.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 28-03-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: IGA System Owner (Sweden)
description:
**IGA System Owner**
*Is automation something you find engaging, and do you aim to provide remarkable service? Do you thrive in a Nordic team, managing a large system landscape, and contributing to a high-priority project with the right resources at your disposal? If that sounds appealing, this role could be a great match!*
 GlobalConnect is undergoing a significant IT transformation, transitioning from legacy systems to innovative technologies, and moving from manual processes to smart automation. As part of this journey, we have chosen the SailPoint platform to automate access authorizations and identity management, aiming for a more efficient and security-focused approach to Identity Governance and Administration (IGA).
   

  

 In this role, you will serve as the system owner for SailPoint, contributing significantly to the implementation project, establishing rules for roles, and automating access management. This large-scale project will initially encompass around 115 systems, expanding later to cover the entire system landscape. We are making substantial investments in this project, ensuring all necessary resources are allocated, and you will directly witness the impact of your contributions on the organization.
   

  

 You will be a part of a team consisting of 6 other members focusing on IAM and collaboration. The team purpose is to “Empowering GlobalConnect to securely manage identities, access and collaboration across the digital workplace, driving operational efficiency and safeguarding assets in a rapidly evolving landscape.”
   

  

 If you are motivated by improving efficiency, enhancing collaboration, prioritizing security, and thrive in organizing and making decisions with a big-picture view, this role will suit you well. We also place great emphasis on user experience and the value your service brings to the organization.
   

  

**To perform well in this role, you should have:**
* Experience with Access Management, Entra ID, Directory Services (e.g., LDAP), and Identity Provisioning.
* Knowledge of API integrations, scripting languages, and identity automation.
* Familiarity with cloud-based directory services, such as Azure AD.
* Experience with JSON, Microsoft PowerShell.
* Experience with RBAC (Role-Based Access Control) for authenticated applications and resources.


 Prior experience with IAM (Identity and Access Management), PAM (Privileged Access Management), or IGA (Identity Governance and Administration) is beneficial for this role.
   

  

 Since GlobalConnect is integral to the digital infrastructure throughout the Nordics, the applicant selected will need to complete background security clearance.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Sr. Solutions Engineer
description:
Our world is transforming, and PTC is leading the way. Our software brings the physical and digital worlds together, enabling companies to improve operations, create better products, and empower people in all aspects of their business.
   

  

 Our people make all the difference in our success. Today, we are a global team of nearly 7,000 and our main objective is to create opportunities for our team members to explore, learn, and grow – all while seeing their ideas come to life and celebrating the differences that make us who we are and the work we do possible.
   

  

 PTC’s ServiceMax is on a mission: enabling field service teams to keep the world running. A career at PTC’s ServiceMax means unleashing your potential to build, sell, implement and market award-winning products with a #wintogether and #customerobsessed approach. From MRI machines to gym equipment, customers around the globe rely on ServiceMax’s cloud-based software platform to keep these machines – and the world – running, every single day.
   

  

 We are looking for a Sr. Solution Engineer to join our tight-knit team of field service, CRM and cloud computing experts. We are innovative and competent, and we like to have fun working. We value creativity, passion, hard work, and of course winning. The Senior Solution Engineer (Pre-Sales) will establish a trusted advisor relationship with both our external prospects, customers, partners and internal technical teams. You will collaborate with internal product teams, the global Solution Engineering team and our commercial sales team in the Nordic region, to help drive sales of our enterprise-wide SaaS solution that will transform Field Service operations and increase productivity. In this role, you will be a strong voice for our customers, bringing technical and business requirements back to our product teams helping ensure our solutions continue to meet our customer’s needs.
   

  

 What You Will Do:
   

  

* Establish a deep understanding of our customers’ business and technical needs
* Create a “trusted technical advisor” relationship with our customer’s technologists and internal technical teammates
* Develop a solution architecture framework to support solution selling on an enterprise level. Help to provide vision, define system and application architecture, problem anticipation, and problem-solving ability across the landscape
* Lead change across large platforms / functional areas using technology solutions
* Provide software/hardware technical architecture expertise to ensure proper solution design
* Interface with all Pre-Sales Solutions Engineers globally (and build a community) to train, mentor, and guide through new solution architecture framework
* Provide coverage for key customer-facing events, particularly C-level discussions
* Build a link to a provocative selling model to ensure architecture views are properly integrated
* Shape, drive, and be held accountable for delivering significant strategic initiatives across broad scope/platform(s) in liaison with key stakeholders
* Help prospects and customers to realize the value of the solution you suggest. This is one of the most essential key responsibilities for this role


 What You Bring to ServiceMax:
   

  

* Bachelor's Degree in business, science, engineering, technology, or related discipline
* Strong work experience with at least 5 to 7 years in Software pre-sales
* Must be willing to travel 20%-40%


 Desired Characteristics:
   

  

* Significant expertise in developing and selling cloud-based solutions. Including creating and executing propositions and a track record of success
* Good understanding of cloud-based solutions with proven experience in selling Software as Service (SaaS) applications
* Strong presentation skills
* Experience with the salesforce.com platform
* Strong interpersonal skills, including creativity and curiosity, with ability to effectively communicate and influence solution direction to both technical and non-technical audiences alike across all organizational levels
* Technical acumen to interface with technologists, understand complex concepts and translate in a way that businesses or industries can understand
* Demonstrated problem-solving and creative skills, ability to exercise sound judgment and make decisions based on market and customer trends – go beyond the status quo
* Ability to deal with ambiguity, strategic agility, manage diversity and drive for results
* Strong English speaking and writing abilities
* Finally, one of the most critical aspects of this role – is being able to help understand the VALUE of what you are selling and articulate this for prospects and customers in a way they easily understand


 What ServiceMax Offers You:
   

  

* Highly competitive package
* Professional development and training opportunities


 Life at PTC is about more than working with today’s most cutting-edge technologies to transform the physical world. It’s about showing up as you are and working alongside some of today’s most talented industry leaders to transform the world around you.
   

  

 If you share our passion for problem-solving through innovation, you’ll likely become just as passionate about the PTC experience as we are. Are you ready to explore your next career move with us?
   

  

 We respect the privacy rights of individuals and are committed to handling Personal Information responsibly and in accordance with all applicable privacy and data protection laws. Review our Privacy Policy here."

title: Security Engineer
description:
*You know that corporate document or piece of research you know you have somewhere but you can’t seem to find it?* 
 🤯
 *The struggle to gather, organize and visualize all corporate knowledge and insights is real.*
****We are Stravito and this is the problem we solve.****
 Due to the universal nature of this problem, our customers come from various industries all around the world. We help world-leading organizations, such as McDonald’s, AT&T, Burberry and Heineken, get closer to their customers and make better, insights-backed decisions by organizing their knowledge and making it easy to access through our intuitive platform.
   

  

 We really mean it when we say we're a diverse and international team as our team of 100 has more than 30 different nationalities! We are guided by our operating principles: simplicity first, an “own it, do it” mentality, embracing different perspectives, and enjoying the journey together.
   

  

**About The Job**
 As our first dedicated Security Engineer, you'll play a key role in ensuring the security of our platform. You will join a tech team with a great team environment and high quality standards, to go from good to great when it comes to security related topics. You will nurture a robust internal security community, evolving our bug bounty program, setting security standards for our production pipeline, and defining security measures for our GenAI features.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities Will Include**
* Finding and fixing code vulnerabilities
* Testing and improving security in our AI pipelines
* Support other engineers in secure coding practices
* Lead and mentor our Security functional group
* Manage our bug bounty program.


****About you****
 To succeed in this role you will need a solid understanding of software architecture and security, including compliance and regulations. We believe you have experience from back-end development, preferably in Java/Kotlin from working in a product company. You have extensive knowledge in AWS-specific security measures, as well as OWASP or similar frameworks. Certifications such as CSSLP or OSCP is a plus, as well as experience working with Python and TypeScript. With strong communication skills and a helpful approach, you effectively collaborate with a variety of stakeholders and team members. You have the ability to prioritize and advise in all things Security, both internally at Stravito and to our customers.
   

  

****What’s in it for you?****
 You will join a remote-first and globally spread team, with company events a couple of times each year as the icing on the cake 🎂 We offer a fun, collaborative environment where everyone truly cares and helps each other. We have zero micro-management and instead you are encouraged to cultivate your own processes while giving and receiving feedback for improvement. Add to that a competitive compensation package, the possibility of working with cutting-edge technology in our industry (such as GenAI) and to be part of simplifying the professional lives of many - what’s not to like?
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Strategic Account Manager
description:
Hobson Prior is seeking a Strategic Account Manager for a contract role. This position focuses on enhancing patient care within the cardiovascular, renal, and metabolism areas. You will be responsible for developing strategies to improve market presence and drive sales performance. If you are passionate about making a difference in healthcare, we encourage you to apply.
 



 Please note that to be considered for this role you must have the right to work in this location.
 












**Responsibilities:** 



* Develop and implement strategies to meet sales targets.
* Identify and prioritize key accounts like hospitals and pharmacies.
* Work closely with the brand team to create tailored strategies for each account.
* Use data and customer insights to find growth opportunities.
* Build and maintain partnerships within the healthcare sector.
* Stay updated on industry trends and healthcare policies.












**Key Skills and Requirements:** 



* Degree in Business or Healthcare, or equivalent experience.
* Experience in healthcare or pharmaceutical sectors.
* Strong skills in sales, project management, and customer interaction.
* Proficient in Swedish and English, with excellent presentation skills.
* Familiarity with digital tools and data-driven decision-making.
* Valid driver's license.












 For more information, please contact
 **Abigail Sivertsen** 
 .
 













**Apply now** 




 If you are interested in learning more or applying to this exciting opportunity then please click 'Apply' and upload a copy of your CV. Alternatively for further details or to talk directly to a life sciences recruitment specialist directly please select 'Contact me' at the top of this page.
 



 Hobson Prior is a leading life sciences recruiter focused on finding exceptional people and matching them with the finest positions across the globe. Hobson Prior is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.
 



 By providing your details and submitting this form you confirm you have read and understood our privacy policy. We only share your personal details with our group companies at acaciumgroup.com/affiliates and those categories of third parties in our privacy policy at hobsonprior.com/privacy-policy.

title: Content Manager (föräldravikariat)
description:
Är du en kreativ Content Manager med passion för att skapa engagerande innehåll?
   

  

 Vill du vara med och stärka Westers varumärke genom inspirerande och genomtänkt content? I rollen som Content Manager får du möjlighet att utveckla och skapa innehåll som lyfter vårt varumärke och når ut till våra kunder på ett sätt som engagerar och inspirerar.
   

  

 Detta är ett föräldravikariat på ett år.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som Content Manager ansvarar du för idé, produktion och publicering av innehåll i våra olika kanaler. Du skapar content som stärker Westers identitet och ser till att all kommunikation har en röd tråd. Du jobbar självständigt och målinriktat för att säkerställa att våra budskap når ut på rätt sätt, i rätt tid och till rätt målgrupp.
   

  

**Dina Huvudsakliga Arbetsuppgifter Består Av Att**
* Idéa och producera content i form av text, grafiskt, ljud, foto, video/animation.
* Uppdatera, skapa och distribuera innehåll i våra kanaler: webb (menyer, artiklar etc), nyhetsbrev, podcast och sociala medier (i dagsläget främst Linkedin och Instagram).
* Skapa och uppdatera innehåll internt i form av presentationer, pitchar och övrigt material.
* Agera beställare av diverse innehåll från partners och leverantörer, ex. print, profilprodukter, video och foto.
* Arbeta mot budget och rapportera till VD.


**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som brinner för att skapa engagerande och högkvalitativt content. Du är kreativ, nyfiken och vågar testa nya idéer, samtidigt som du analyserar vad som fungerar bäst för att optimera och utveckla innehållet. Med din starka visuella känsla skapar du material som både inspirerar och ger effekt.
   

  

 Du har ett genomtänkt och långsiktigt perspektiv i ditt arbete, kombinerat med ett stort intresse för sociala medier. Du trivs med att arbeta självständigt men är också en lagspelare med en positiv inställning och god samarbetsförmåga. Din kreativa ådra och din förmåga att anpassa innehåll efter olika kanaler och målgrupper gör dig till en värdefull tillgång i teamet.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du även har ett intresse för event och upplevelser – och att du tar dig an ditt arbete med energi, engagemang och rätt mindset!
   

  

**Vi Tror Att Du**
* Har arbetat i en liknande roll i några år, antingen på byrå eller inhouse.
* Har relevant utbildning inom marknad, kommunikation eller design.
* Kan skapa och redigera texter, bilder, video/animation, ljud (krav) och gärna kan fota och filma själv (meriterande).
* Har goda kunskaper i Adobe Creative Suite/Cloud (krav), Wordpress (meriterande), Apsis (meriterande).
* Har stor förståelse och intresse för kommunikation och varumärke.
* Pratar och skriver flytande svenska och engelska.


**Vi erbjuder**
 På Westers Drivs Vi Av Att Skapa En Arbetsplats Fylld Av Trivsel Och Engagemang, Där Du Som Anställd Kan Växa Och Utvecklas. Hos Oss Får Du Därför Ta Del Av Bland Annat
   

  

* Kostförmån (lunch från Stockholms bästa cateringkök)
* Friskvård
* Återkommande aktiviteter och event
* Individuell utvecklings-/utbildningsplan
* Regelbundna hälsokontroller
* Sköna och hjälpsamma kollegor!


**Om Westers**
 Westers är ett av Stockholms ledande företag inom catering och event. Vi genomför årligen närmare 800 evenemang för företag och privatpersoner, där vi får vara med och skapa allt från bröllop och födelsedagar till företagsfester och konferenser.
   

  

 Idag är vi cirka 25 medarbetare fördelat över organisationen, plus en härlig bonusfamilj av skicklig extrapersonal på våra event, många av dem utbildade i vår Westers Academy.
   

  

 Vi jobbar utifrån värdeorden engagemang, empati och gemenskap. Vi har ett aktivt arbete med Westers Hjärta där hållbarhet, inkludering och socialt engagemang är våra främsta hjärtefrågor.
   

  

 Är du den vi söker? Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Quantitative Analyst
description:
**About Kambi**
 Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.
   

  

 Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.
   

  

 Kambi are looking for a highly motivated and experienced self-starter to join our quantitative analysis team in central Stockholm. For the right candidate, the position will provide the opportunity to research and develop cutting-edge algorithmic solutions to support our B2B Sportsbook operations. You will take a leading role in cross-functional teams, building complete trading and risk solutions, and where your main responsibility will be to develop and maintain risk and sport models. You will report to the Head of Quantitative Analytics.
   

  

**Main responsibilities:**
* Support and work in close collaboration with trading, risk and other areas of the business by providing algorithmic solutions
* Responsible for the end-to-end process of algorithm development, from inception to deployment as well as maintenance
* Analysis and interpretation of data to produce meaningful information, in particular changes in patterns and trends
* Communicate results and ideas to stakeholders


**Skills and experience:**
* An academic degree in a quantitative discipline (computer science, mathematics, physics, etc.)
* Previous experience in a similar role designing predictive models for real-world business problems
* Advanced knowledge of stochastic processes, mathematical methods and probability theory
* Proficiency with C/C++ and Python, in particular having worked in software teams (git) is a plus
* Experience using statistical and query computer languages (R/SQL) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Experience with cloud computing (AWS) is a plus
* Familiarity with Apache Spark is a plus.
* Skills in object-oriented programming is a plus


**The successful candidate has:**
* Creative and experimental mindset to data mining
* Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on product development
* A drive to promote innovative algorithmic solutions and data driven decision-making
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate to both business and technical minded colleagues
* Ability to handle multiple tasks and priorities


**What's in it for you?**
* Opportunity to work in a fast-growing industry
* A role within a highly ambitious team
* Support for personal development
* A fun and flexible working culture


 We are curious about your story, if you are interested in meeting us please apply with your CV.
   

  

 #wearekambi
   

  

**Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace**
 If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.
   

  

**Creating an inclusive environment**
 We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.
   

  

 #wearekambi

title: AI Engineer
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization is approaching 150 highly skilled professionals.
   

  

 Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?
   

  

**The Role**
 As an AI Engineer, you will be part of a team that is responsible for our organization's AI-focused initiatives, unlocking the full potential of artificial intelligence to create transformative solutions for our business opportunities. With your expertise in generative AI, you and your team will lead the charge in crafting cutting-edge AI strategies and solutions. You will be pivotal in defining how we apply AI solutions to business problems, mainly through usage of LLMs from various providers. We want to deeply integrate AI across our organization, drive innovation and ensure that AI is a clear part of our business strategy.
   

  

 You will be reporting to our AI Engineering Manager.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You are an experienced and driven software engineer who has been part of the Generative AI wave, and both experimented with and shipped applications to real users. Complex challenges do not deter you; they intrigue you. You tackle them methodically, finding practical solutions that truly make a difference.
   

  

 You prefer working in a team with developers, designers and product managers and deeply collaborate with your team rather than working from specifications. You communicate effectively and can discuss the pros and cons of different options in constructive ways.
   

  

 As the AI field is moving forward at enormous speed, you are constantly following tech news for interesting developments that you can use to solve business problems.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, and product managers, to define requirements and deliver AI solutions that meet business needs.
* Stay up to date with the latest developments in generative AI, actively following open-source projects and explore innovative AI technologies that can benefit the organization.
* Create prototypes and proof-of-concepts to demonstrate the feasibility and potential of AI solutions to stakeholders.
* Document architecture designs, algorithms, and best practices for knowledge sharing within the organization.
* Assist and inspire AI development done by other teams in the organization.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
* Experience in backend development using Python and FastAPI, and React for frontend development. Experience from other languages is also valued as we’re always open to using the best tool for the task at hand.
* Proven experience with building applications for real users, spanning design, frontend, backend, databases and infrastructure. We don’t require deep experience in all areas.
* You will be asked to demo your experience in the interview process
* Proficiency in Swedish


**What We Offer**
* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools, we sign agreements with the largest players, and we encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work to form a collaborative environment where AI is used throughout the group.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
* Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.


**Location**
 We find great value in being able to work closely with our Stockholm-based team in person. At the same time, we understand the need to focus deeply without interruptions. Therefore, the team works according to a hybrid setup with 3 days at the Stockholm office, and 2 days remotely from home, combining the best of both worlds.
   

  

**Excited?**
 If you are excited about being part of a successful team, apply for this position!
   

  

 👉🏽 Why we formed Odevo
   

  

 🔍 About Odevo
   

  

 🌐 Our Software

title: Microsoft Fabric Data Architect
description:
**Microsoft Fabric Data Architect:** 




  





 For one of our globally leading tech clients we are urgently looking for an experienced Microsoft Fabric Data Architect for a long contract based in Stockholm, Sweden
 



  





  





 Its paying well and my client can interview asap!
 



  





  





**We have Malmo Location also** 




  





  





 Architecture & Design
 


* Design and implement Microsoft Fabric solutions for data integration, governance, and analytics.
* Architect scalable data lakehouses, warehouses, and real-time analytics solutions.
* Ensure security, compliance, and best practices for Microsoft Fabric deployments.
* Optimize data models, Direct Lake, and Real-Time Analytics for performance and cost efficiency.



  





 2. Data Engineering & Integration
 


* Work with Synapse Data Warehouses, Delta Lake, and Lakehouse concepts within Microsoft Fabric.
* Implement ETL/ELT pipelines using Data Factory, Dataflows, and Pipelines.
* Integrate Microsoft Fabric with Power BI, Azure Machine Learning, and third-party tools.



  





 3. Governance, Security & Compliance
 


* Define data governance policies using Microsoft Purview.
* Implement role-based access controls (RBAC) and security best practices.



  





 4. Performance Optimization & Monitoring
 


* Optimize compute and storage costs for Microsoft Fabric workloads.
* Monitor data pipelines, Power BI DirectQuery performance, and Synapse workloads.
* Troubleshoot DAX, SQL, and KQL queries for performance tuning.



  





  





 If this is you, then please do not delay in applying!

title: Senior Strategic Security Consultant (Government), Mandiant, Google Cloud
company_industry: Information Services and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following:
 **Brussels, Belgium; Berlin, Germany; Stockholm, Sweden** 
 .
 **Minimum qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Cybersecurity, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 6 years of experience assessing and developing cybersecurity solutions and programs across security domains.
* 6 years of experience in delivering cyber outcomes, identifying mission risks, and devising solutions.
* Ability to travel up to 30%.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* Certifications related to specific cloud platforms.
* Experience implementing industry-leading practices around cyber risks and cloud security for clients’ cloud security frameworks using industry standards.
* Experience working in government departments, military, or intelligence services.
* Experience with cloud governance, with the ability to convey governance principles to cloud computing in terms of policies.
* Excellent time and project management skills.


**About the job** 
 You will work with the experienced Mandiant EMEA team to help chart a course for our Government partners, helping advise, build, and design the capability frameworks and roadmaps for their continuous improvement. In this role, you will become a key driver for our continental European strategy and implementation.
   

  

 Part of Google Cloud, Mandiant is a recognized leader in dynamic cyber defense, threat intelligence and incident response services. Mandiant's cybersecurity expertise has earned the trust of security professionals and company executives around the world. Our unique combination of renowned frontline experience responding to some of the most complex breaches, nation-state grade threat intelligence, machine intelligence, and the industry's best security validation ensures that Mandiant knows more about today's advanced threats than anyone.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Become a trusted partner to our Government clients, building and maintaining relationships, and understanding and respecting sensitivities.
* Help drive and deliver Mandiant's National Cybersecurity Capability Framework (NCCF) in support of national-level transformation programs and roadmaps of improvement. Develop and deliver threat-led tabletop exercises and other deliverables.
* Assess security operations and incident response team capabilities, and provide recommendations for improvement. Advise Government clients and large-scale multinational entities on how to prepare for incidents, testing, and capability development.
* Develop bespoke documentation such as response plans, playbooks and roadmaps. Participate in client workshops and develop reports.
* Deliver threat briefings and mentoring to executive and technical teams.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Supporttekniker med fokus på Linux
description:
För vår kunds räkning söker vi nu efter en engagerad person som vill ta sig an en roll som supporttekniker med fokus på Linux. Företaget fokuserar på att stödja bolag i deras tillväxtresa genom att erbjuda skräddarsydda partnerskap som är anpassade efter specifika behov. Med lång erfarenhet av att arbeta med nordiska tillväxtbolag har man utvecklat en intäktsdelningsmodell som maximerar värdet av en börsnotering. Företaget strävar efter att vara en stabil och långsiktig partner som förstår entreprenörers utmaningar och möjligheter och erbjuder dessutom tillgång till den europeiska kapitalmarknaden genom sitt moderbolag.
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 I rollen kommer du att arbeta med den löpande hanteringen av extern support för företagets handelssystem samt de kringliggande systemen, med särskilt fokus på Linux Debian-miljöer. En del av ditt arbete innefattar mjukvaruhantering, såsom installation, uppgradering och uppdatering av programvara. Du kommer också att ge stöd vid felsökning av handelssystemet och dess kringliggande system. Vid behov kan interna arbetsuppgifter introduceras i rollen. En viktig del av ditt ansvar blir att koordinera och leda första linjens support, där teamet ansvarar för extern support, systemanalys och administration av kundnära systemlösningar.
   

  

**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 
 Vi söker efter dig som är lösningsorienterad, samarbetsvillig, ansvarstagande och nyfiken, samt har ett stort intresse för fintech och börsrelaterade system. Du trivs i team och förstår vikten av att samarbeta för att nå gemensamma mål. Du tar ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och ser till att de genomförs noggrant och effektivt, även under press. Din nyfikenhet och intresse för fintech driver dig att ständigt utvecklas och hålla dig uppdaterad inom branschens senaste trender och teknologier.
   

  

**Krav**
* Revelant kandidatexamen inom IT
* 1-2 års erfarenhet av att ha arbetat i en servicedesk
* Erfarenhet av Linux (Debian)
* Erfarenhet av Windows, Microsoft 365 och nätverksenheter
* Erfarenhet av ITIL
* Flytande svenska och engelska – både i tal och skrift


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av SQL
* Erfarenhet av Python, PHP eller Bash


**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
   

  

*Mer om oss*
 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Azure AI Developer
description:
